review.description:
Easily the best and freshest Cajun-style crawdads ever! They call them crawfish here, other places refer to them as langostinos.. 

I asked for the hottest of the three sauces available. It was mild for my personal taste but had the delicious complexity I associate a live Cajun old timer in the kitchen drinking shine. In other words: AUTHENTIC.

I was so happy with the dads, I ordered the Alaskan crab legs in the same sauce. Equally good.

My server, An-Gelek (pronounced Angelique) explained everything arrives fresh in the morning from Boston. 

When I sailed on tugs, we used to sail through the lobster and crab areas there and traded frozen chicken and beef for crustaceans with the Boston  trappers. We just parked our boat next to theirs and passed the goods between us.

What I had here tasted as fresh as that.
review.author: Eddie V.

review.description:
i don't think so it is delicious,
so,i hate it
the best gift for your family
if you like
review.author: Sa F.

review.description:
Atmosphere is pleasant 
Service was great (AN-GELEK) was our server
Overalls the food was ok  not great
Catfish good
Garlic noodles good
King crabs good to to much garlic
NO LIQUOR LICENSE BUMMER
review.author: Keith B.

review.description:
Being from Texas, I have a high standard when it comes to Cajun food - especially crawfish, and this place didn't disappoint!

We passed by this place on the way to the subway and decided to check it out. They apparently just opened, and they have a lovely vibe. 

Here's a breakdown of what we ordered. Sorry that not much food was left when the pictures were taken. We cleaned up quickly!

Crawfish boil: 5/5
Loved it! I would say their "hot" is just enough to make your lips tingle a little, so if you're into spice at all, get "hot" :)

Snow crab: 5/5
Mmm very well flavored! Just note that a 1/4 lb of snow crab is significantly more food than 1/4 lb of crawfish ;)

Argentinian shrimp: 5/5
By far the largest shrimp I've had in a boil. I totally recommend

Fries: regular 4/5, sweet potato 5/5
We got both regular and sweet potato. If you're into crispy fries, I recommend sweet potato.

Collard greens: 4/5
Delicious and very well seasoned

Sweet tea: 5/5
I've had sweet tea in bumfuck nowhere Louisiana and this was just as delicious. 

Overall, great place, delicious food, solid service. Check it out before it gets too popular :)
review.author: Elaine W.

review.description:
Just noticed we have this cute spot in our school area. My sister and me out there for a quick late night during the final week. We took the garlic&butter sauce with shaking spicy for our seafood bag. It's not salty and tasty as we expected TBH. After communicating with their servers, we decided to order another bag, with side note "more salty". And the second bag is super amazing!!! We were totally full after taking two bags of seafood and veggies (we had crawfish and shrimp & small potatoes; crawfish and lobster & corns).

BTW, our cute server will become as a freshman after this upcoming summer, he is CUTE and Professional. Hope he'll  love the community and have wonderful four years college life :P 

Thanks for the meal shaking crab and Welcome to this wonderful neighbor. Will be here again when I got chance to back the UWS.
review.author: Rebecca M.

review.description:
There has never been a place that is more deserving of a five star than Shaking Crab. We came during their soft opening when they were the new kids on the block and a very welcome addition to the Upper West Side. 

This place has the best customer service I have ever experienced. Glasses were full at all times our amazing server An-Gelek was such a sweetheart and came back to check on us frequently and gave us amazing recommendations about what to order. I feel like we got to know the whole staff so well, the manager - Chantay was delightful and came to gave us a demo. One of the bussers - Jonathan was also incredibly attentive and came by to make sure we were happy with our orders. This place is such a gem in the neighborhood!

We ordered the Snow Crab, Cajun fries and Argentinian shrimp with the Seoul and Envie sauce; both complemented all our items so well! I wish this place had been open sooner, but it's great to know that it's in the Columbia area. Highly recommended if you're a seafoodie!
review.author: Alliey L.

review.description: Took my mom out here for some delicious seafood and we were not disappointed! Our server An-Gelek was super attentive and so sweet and made our first time here wonderful. We got a demonstration on how to get the most out of the shells which was super helpful. We had snow crab legs and shrimp and calamari and sweet potato fries and everything was delicious! We will definitely be back! When you come ask for An-Gelek! She's a total doll!!
review.author: Natalia S.

review.description:
Came on a Wednesday night and seating was immediately available. Service was delightful and accommodating--informative yet non-invasive.

Garlic noodles are better than other boils with the same offering. Also ordered shrimp and mussels with Shakin' flavoring with hot spice level (which is the second tier spiciness out of three). Def on point in heat and flavor there.

Will def be returning once the booze license kicks in (which should be very soon).
review.author: Quan N.

review.description: Super fun & delicious! We had the crawfish and added on the 1/2 lb of shrimp and French fries. The gulf sauce was tangy and just spicy enough and the Cajun fries were crispy and delicious dipped in the Gulf sauce. Our server Roberta gave us a helpful demo on how to open a crawfish and the Manager Ken gave us some great suggestions on what to order. Happy we got to try it out before it gets packed! Excited to come back with friends this summer for some seafood and beer!
review.author: Tabitha S.

review.description: I absolutely enjoyed my self here. Dorian was the best server. Everyone made us feel so welcome. I will definitely be back!!
review.author: Torri L.

review.description:
We were excited to try this out! So goooood. We had garlic noodles plus Snow Crab legs, clams and shrimp. Mixed in potatoes with the Seoul sauce. Next time we will try appetizers and lobster. 

The food came super fast. Service was great with multiple people asking if we were ok or needed a tutorial on how to crack open the crab legs. The bathrooms were very clean which is always a plus and basically can't wait to go back. 

Welcome to the neighborhood!
review.author: Sasha M.

review.description:
We've been looking for a great crab and lobster place for a while now and finally found our new favorite spot! Everything we had was cooked perfectly: crab, lobster, and shrimp. The sauces were also delicious and unique. 

The only thing that could make this place better would be a liquor license but they tell me that's on the way. 

Highly recommend!!!
review.author: David T.

review.description:
Being from New Orleans, I am quite familiar with Cajun and creole food and how it should be prepared, and this place does a terrible job at it. I ordered the fried catfish basket and the batter was thick and full of oil and over-fried. The catfish did not taste fresh at all and my stomach hurt after just a few bites -- I picked most of the batter off to try to salvage some fish, but was still terribly disappointed. You don't even get very much fish for $12. What you think looks like a decent amount of fish is actually just a tiny bit of fish with very thick, unappetizing batter--not the kind of batter that's actually good that you are sometimes almost ashamed that you would eat it plain. What a waste of money. 

Fried catfish is pretty difficult to mess up, so I am  highly disappointed. 

It was also quite apparent that the fries had been cooked in old or just bad oil that definitely needed a change.
review.author: Erin H.

review.description: This place is soliddd. I'm from Texas so I have pretty high standards. The food was good and the service was amazing! Thank you An-Gelek! There's a "shake it up" add on and you get 1/2lb shrimp AND fries. In my opinion the hot was definitely not spicy enough (but this is coming from an Asian person). Ask for D's spicy!! He hooked us up with a special sauce! It was a game changer :) Will be back when they get their liquor license
review.author: Sora L.

review.description:
Hot & New near Columbia U

Nice service and awesome food, try the snow crab leg, and  An-Gelek V would serve you well, the shrimp is also worth a shot. It tastes like some traditional Chinese style cuisine lol
review.author: Yiming Z.

review.description:
Yummmyyy food! We had the Alaskan crab legs and shrimp in gulf sauce and it was delicious! I thought I was not a crab person but this was such a great experience! 
Our server An-Gelek was super kind and helpful in taking us through the menu and providing helpful recommendations! 
Definitely recommend!
review.author: Nazish M.

review.description: Our waitress was Roberta, really friendly and professional! Definitely recommend to seafood-lover!
review.author: Charles L.

review.description: Excellent cajun seafood ! There is the only Cajun sea food on the upper west, near Columbia. Snow crab leg is my favorite and An-Gelek serve us perfect!
review.author: Fan Z.

review.description:
It was our first time there and it was delicious! 

Price: Dinner for two cost a little over $20, which is competitive and reasonable. 

Food: We ordered the pound of shrimp and pound of crawfish in the Shaking Sauce with added corn and baby potatoes. It was well season- the sauce in the bag showed they don't skip out! We didn't order any "Spice" addition, but my boyfriend thought it was spicy; he refilled his water quite a bit. Not too greasy, but it was messy. They provide bibs and gloves which make the processes fun and relatively neat. 

Service: While we went later in the evening, we were seated promptly and our order was taken quickly. The server was attentive to our needs and helped answer questions that we had -- he even had some good tips on how to get the most meat out of the crawfish! The rest of the staff was easy-going and made the experience enjoyable.

Definitely recommend - will be coming back again!
review.author: Karina R.

review.description: Love this place so much. Went there on last monday. Even though, they were only soft open. Server is excellent! The food is the dopest. Better than the boil.
review.author: Eakapap P.

review.description:
This is probably the best restaurant in the Bay Ridge area. The wait staff is awesome and friendly. The food is all so delicious and of course. Beet ketchup!!!

When friends come to visit the area this is the place we bring then to. We always split the Baked Bratwurst Halusky which is a cheesy noodle and pork belly appetizer that feels like an oily heart attack on a plate but sooo delicious. Was disappointed last time I went to find they didn't serve Maria's Kremes anymore because that was the perfect light & refreshing finish to the meal. Hope they bring it back!
review.author: Ellen S.

review.description:
One of the best places to eat in bay ridge. It is only open for dinner which is a shame but you will not be disappointed. We sat in the outside back area at a shared table. Looks like most of the tables are shared since they do not have much space. This is ok considering it is brooklyn and space is at a premium. 

Started off with the edam slovak which was a fried cheese appetizer with a home made mustard. Very delicious with the right mix of crunchy and creamy in the cheese.

I had to try the original korzo burger and it did not disappoint. Im not even sure what were the toppings on the burger but everything worked together well. If i had one negative it would be that it was a bit oily. Overall it was great.

My wife got the pulled pork sandwich. It was not your typical pulled pork sandwich from bbq place. It had its own twist and flavors like most of the items here.

They also had a homemade spicy ketchup that waa awesome. It complimented the burger very well.

We tried the beet-tini for a drink and it was spot on with the meal. 

There is a serious argument between a 4 and 5. And i went with 5 bc everything was homemade and tasted like it was. Well done Beet Company!
review.author: Nicholas G.

review.description:
We favorite coming here for their hearty dishes and friendly service. 
The appetizers are small, tend to be for 2. Entrees are large and super filling. Plus they come with descriptions of the fresh greens on the side. 
Sausage and lentil soup is splendid for the cooler temperatures. Every scoop has plenty of veggies and meat and the broth is rich with lentil flavor. 
The fish and chips entree is delightful. Plating keeps the chips on the side and crunchy, center lies the pieces of fried dish with three dipping sauces, and on the other end is a tasty serving of squash. Excellent entree option. 
Korzo burgers look superb, will try one next time around. 
Dessert was the cheesecake flan. Mouth watering and such an eccentric design with the Strawberry topping too. Decadent cheesecake texture and flan caramel sauce on top. Superb option for the last course. 
Our service experience is always positive. Caroline* and Pavel are very friendly and frequent check up on you. 
Note, there is an outdoor seating. Very clean, quiet, and well kept with the purple theme.

*updated review to fix our waitress' name
review.author: Kenny L.

review.description: An amazing experience with such a unique selection of food. Service was great, prompt and with a smile. I got the Brooklyn beet "burger", an incredible beet and bean patty wrapped in a pastry with cheese and quickly fried served with fries with a beet catch-up and the Brooklyn beet-tini... Just can't say enough amazing things about this place from food options to atmosphere. Plenty of vegetarian and non vegetarian options. My husband was equally pleased with his choice.
review.author: Elen C.

review.description:
Second time coming here for dinner and the food didn't disappoint.  It's so cozy inside and the staff is super nice and friendly. We ordered the dates wrapped in bacon which are the best I've tried! The beet salad, wunderwurst sampler which were delicious! My friend ordered the skirt steak which was huge!! I had the salmon dish and honestly the piece was tiny; maybe it was a bad piece of the cut I don't know, but it tasted good and wasn't dry. The pulled pork sandwich was huge, the meat was so tender it melted in your mouth, sooo good! The burgers here are amazing!! Definitely one of the best burgers in ny!!  
Will definitely be back for one!
review.author: Nadia K.

review.description:
Wow, I've been to Brooklyn Beet Company (BBC) more than a few times, yet this was the first time I tried their burger and it was AMAZING! I could finish this review with: burger was amazing, staff is awesome, you should totally go! However, I will add a bit more color for you.

Food wise, I had the Original Burger, medium rare while my girlfriend had Beet Benedikt. The burger was excellent: well seasoned, perfectly cooked and wrapped in a fried dough bun. Along with the string french fries and homemade cole slaw, its a pretty fantastic dish. Seriously, I am running out of adjectives to describe how much I enjoyed it. The Beet Benedikt, overall was a great dish. The combination of poached egg, hollandaise sauce, ham and cornmeal pancake makes an excellent flavor. These should be eaten together, however, because alone, they are not quite as delicious as the sum of there parts. The beets and lettuce are a nice complement, but not necessary to the whole dish. The menu has a number of other dishes I would like to try, so I will be back.

Should you go? Absolutely, the food is great, the cocktails are creative and tasty and the staff is super friendly. You can tell a lot of care goes into everything at BBC and you will not be disappointed when you go.
review.author: Nick M.

review.description:
So I've heard good things about this place where "Beets" are the star and worked into many dishes. 
Aside from the beet ketchup and hot sauce (which was really good btw), we opted to try other popular items. 

We shared the Halusky and the Original burger with a cocktail and their signature beer. 

Halusky was heavy. Sausage, pork belly that tasted more like thick cut Canadian ham drowned in Gouda, sautéed onions and nougatine dumplings. It was small in size but boy did it pack a punch. I would've liked some pita or crostini to accompany this as it were a bit salty for my sensitive palate, but at that rate, the appetizer would've sufficiently fed 2 people. 

The Original burger, medium rare, was dressed with pickled relish and applewood bacon and encased in fried dough, not unlike a doughnut. Someone described it like a burger pie. I would say a burger knish or a burger patty. That is their unique spin on reinventing the burger. And BBC deserves praise. Fun, easy to hold and eat. The burger meat was juicy and delicious. I do miss my regular buns though. Maybe 2nd time's the charm. Oh, and their skinny square fries deserve an honorable mention. So good and crispy, we finish every last one with the hot sauce that tasted like tangy salsa with a kick. You can purchase by the bottle. 

A quaint place for a relaxing late lunch.
review.author: Elisa H.

review.description:
Had this place bookmarked for a while and decided to try it out. Happy to say that I will absolutely be coming back. They have a great menu - lots of options. Although a lot of the foods are on the heavier side, everything my bf and I tried was delicious. 

FOOD: They are NOT lying when they say that the Korzo burger is one of THE BEST burgers in NYC. The meat is incredibly juicy! Most interestingly, it is served almost as a pierogie. The dough around it is very soft and light. It compliments the meat and makes the juiciness of the meat the main focus. 
My bf and I both got "The Original" which comes with their beef blend, apple-smoked bacon, Allaguer cheese, house made mustard and a pickle. This all fits within the "pierogi". It comes with a choice of fries or salad. They suggest that you order the meat medium rare - which after trying, I highly suggest as well. 
Theres not a doubt in mind I would want to come here instead of my usual burger spots when the craving hits! 

We also got a few appetizers - The "Turnip Fall Squash Dumplings" with spicy pulled pork. They reminded me of the Russian "vareniki" - which is a dumpling, flat but filled. The pork here was tender and although there were only four served, they're filling. If you like dumplings, definitely get these to try! They're an unusual flavor from the dumplings at Asian places. There is an option to get the dumplings with mushrooms instead of the spicy pork. 

We also got the "Battered Slovak Edam" which is fried cheese. It basically reminded me of a very high end mozzarella stick. It comes with tartar sauce which is a very interesting touch to the cheese. It's a fairly large square - definitely a "comfort food". Both appetizers came with some beets on the side . 

The service was quick and our waitress was super friendly. The place itself is very small. There are a few high tables and then cafe style shared tables on the side.

Definitely give this place a try!
review.author: Yelena K.

review.description:
One of my favorite brunch spots in Brooklyn. The food is always solid everytime I visit and the service is great. I love how they're not super well known since that means I never have to wait when I come here for brunch. 

My favorites here are the korzo burger, which is a delicious beef patty slightly precooked and then wrapped in a dough that reminds me of donut. Then it is fried and served with a salad. This is my all time favorite burger! It is my idea of a hamburger and donut hybrid! I also love coming here for their brunch flatbread that has various fruits and Nutella on it. 

Please try this place out, you won't regret it!
review.author: Tiffany T.

review.description:
Here I go again ranting about restaurants who don't believe in their servers writing shit down. 

Time to set the scene. It's Wednesday around 6:30pm on the last day of summer. We're a group of 5 and the restaurant is about half full or half empty depending on how well your Zoloft is working today. 

When we arrived, we noticed that there was 1 server and 1 bartender who both seemed in good spirits. We were seated in the backyard and asked about drinks right away. Now watch out. This review is about to take a drastic turn. 

After we ordered drinks, we waited. Then we waited some more and after a little more waiting, our drinks came. When the waitress came back, we were way past ready to order. We ordered appetizers and main meals at the same time and yup...this woman did not write one thing down. 3 appetizers and 5 meals with a ton of substitutions and questions in the middle...not one word written. And then we waited again and waited some more. 

The main meal surprisingly came about 15 min after the appetizers and thankfully the food was good and hot. 3 out of 5 of us had been here before so we knew the food was worth it. 

After 4 of us we're served, we waited for the last person in our party to get their meal. After about 5 minutes, she insisted that we start without her. 20 minutes later, after everyone was on their last few bites and the waitress was nowhere to be found, we were still waiting on the last entree. At this point we were all pissed and one of us got up to find the waitress. She was happily standing around by the opening of the kitchen EATING A PLATE OF FOOD. Ummmm seriously?

So we angrily told her that we still hadn't  received all of our food. After an unapologetic & annoyed "sorry" SHE GOT MAD AT US!!! She asked what was missing (you would have known if you had written it down) and repeated about 10 times..."What!! I SAID I was sorrrry." Ugh. 

So after all of the meals were sent and eaten, I told the waitress that we were celebrating a birthday and to please bring us  a dessert. Though the dessert was on the house, nothing else was. Maybe if that last meal was on the house I wouldn't have complained as much, but the waitress seriously screwed up. 

I will be coming here again for the food, but I will be very cautious if I see that woman again.
review.author: Lori K.

review.description: This is literally the second time I came here. This spot surprisingly never upsets me. The food is amazingly delicious everything on this menu that I tried so far has been so good. The steak is soo worth it. Outside other steakhouses the steak is like $60 for such a small amount but this place gives you a lifetime of steak. This is probably one of my favorite spots that I like to go to eat American food. I recommend this to anyone who wants to try something different. Definitely one of my go to spots. Even though it is small and you might have to wait it's definitely worth every minute waiting.
review.author: Mickie K.

review.description:
Outstanding service and food. Definitely recommend and a well deserved 5 star. I didn't order any drinks because I drove that night but I will try them one day for sure. For appetizers, we had the baked halusky, wunderwurst sausages and the perogies.

The baked halusky can serve up 3-4 imo. It might smell weird to you cause of the gouda but it is sooo delicious. I haven't had anything like it before and I was hesitant at first from the smell but once I took a bite, I was in heaven!

The wunderwurst i believe is 3 different sausages cut in halves so it can serve 4-6 if you like to share . The sausages were not dry, it was very juicy and cooked just perfectly. I can't remember how each tasted but I know all three sausages tasted delicious along with the sauces and condiments not comes with. 

The perogies comes with I was wasn't a big fan of because I'm just not a fan of them but it still tasted better than other restaurants I tried it at. Don't have much to say about them.

For the entree, I ordered the original korzo burger medium rare with fries. My date also ordered an original korzo burger medium rare but with a salad.

Never had a burger that tasted this good. Puts shake shack, in n out, burger bistro, or any burger joint to shame. The deep fried bread makes the burger unique and adds so much flavor to the beef patty. Their homemade beet ketchup makes the burger even more tasty. The fries also good. Not salty at all, not too crispy and definitely not soggy. The fries are better than most fries served at a burger joint imo. The salad was surprisingly tasty. I'm a big guy and I don't like salads but their salad tasted so fresh and refreshing with their minty dressing. Leaves your mouth feeling clean and minty after each bite.

This place is a small spot so a long wait is expected during dinner hours and weekends but trust me, it is definitely worth the wait. It would be great if they could expand . I'm surprised this place is only $$ because it was that good. Well done Brooklyn beet company, keep up the outstanding service and cheers to the chef and cooks
review.author: Harry C.

review.description: The service was absolutely excellent. The food was overall very good. We had the flat bread for starters it was a bit dull and I wouldn't order it again. However I had the rabbit stew and my husband had the one of their burgers both were really delicious. The wine list is short but very good.  I wish I had space for dessert! The ambience of the restaurant is great. I'll definitely be returning and have no hesitation in recommending this restaurant.
review.author: Georgia E.

review.description: A very narrow and cozy restaurant. The staff is friendly and attentive. The aged burger is tasty and you can taste that good funkiness. A good neighborhood restaurant to grab a burger.
review.author: Diane Z.

review.description: Amazing sausage appetizer and Absinthe cocktails but the burger was sick in the head! We sat outside in the beet colored secret garden and had an amazing time.  We are rushing to go back. A diamond in the rough!
review.author: Michael C.

review.description:
Burgers for brunch? I'm down! Had the original korzo burger and it truly is a one of a kind burger, which I will be coming back for more. Its bun is deep fried and perfectly cut in half, showing off the perfectly cooked meat inside. It is juicy, flavorful, and has the right crunches from the pickle and other condiments included. On the side are both the beet ketchup and hot sauce which is not overwhelming so that you can enjoy the korzo burger to its fullest extent.

I also got the flatbread with cocoa-hazelnut spread on top (tastes a lot like nuttella), and fruits on top and it was amazing as well. My biggest fear when ordering such decadent dishes is that it'll be too sweet, but this was perfect. The flatbread looks like a pancake but looks can be deceiving. So if you're looking over to the next table, wishing that you ordered pancakes and you ordered the flatbread instead, fret not. 

The space here is very intimate and tiny. Tables will probably be shared and the environment is essentially communal. Long wooden tables for people to sit around. Can't wait to try their other burgers and indulge in brunch!
review.author: Carmen W.

review.description: Everything I've had here has been delicious. Really comfy place to hand out and catch up with friends. And double for a great fate spot. Seating feels pretty communal when it gets crowded. Any of the korzo burgers are a must, but the sausage appetizer is incredible. As are the Savory potato lakes.
review.author: Jonathan I.

review.description:
The original korzo burger was nice but a little heavy to me because of the fried bun. Fries and coleslaw was good too. 

I liked their beet ketchup too.

Also, Emma was a great and helpful.
review.author: Dilek T.

review.description: Good cozy place! Great staff!good damn fried burgers!! Everyone with me loved their food. The atmosphere was laid back but enjoyable. I will be coming back. Also try the beet sauce.
review.author: Chancelle W.

review.description: Everything was delicious..especially the mushroom turnip dumplings.  Definitely recommend buying a bottle of beet ketchup for home!
review.author: Dara F.

review.description:
I've dined at some amazing places. Such as Cosme, Blue Hill, etc. I would have never imagined to find a restaurant that rivals these world renowned places tucked away in Queens right off of Roosevelt Avenue!

Firstly, I want to say that my waitress Sandra was so kind and warm! She made my friends and I feel welcome from the start! We all engaged in great conversation that made us feel right at home!

Then came the food. Superb! Amazing flavors from an amazing chef (We later learned that he worked for Blue Hill!). I enjoyed all 4 dishes my friends and I ordered. They all were presented beautifully, and tasted great! Let's not forget the delicious house cocktails! The Piña Colada was so tasty! I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this place and will be recommending it to all of my friends!

Thanks for the experience Casa Del Chef!
review.author: Oscar V.

review.description:
My friend and I were adventurous and came here, after passing it a month or so ago on accident. 

To start with, we had the "Homemade Ricotta Gnocci" with mushrooms, asparagus and challots - SO GOOD! (I could have had two orders of it). 

For dinner (it was a tough choice) but I ended up going with the "Monk Fish", my friend had the "Pan Seared Scallops". Yum, yum, yum! This was my first time having Monk Fish, so I have nothing to compare it to, but, I loved it! So delicious!

Our waitress was so sweet, very helpful and knowledgable of the menu items (for us first timers). I love the fact that the menu changes and they also offer a "Chefs Tasting" - which I can't wait to come back and try. 

Happy to have stumbled upon this gem in our neighborhood!
review.author: Misty M.

review.description:
Everybody falls into a routine when they eat out. You know what food you like or what you are willing to try. It's playing it safe. Over time, food loses its dynamic and wonder. This is the perfect time for a tasting menu. 3 courses and a dessert. All the restaurant is going to ask you if you are allergic to anything. The rest is an adventure. The food was delicious and one of the best dining experience. 

Are you ready for your adventure?
review.author: Huan C.

review.description:
*5 stars!*
*cash only!*

This place has been on my list for awhile. Finally got to try it tonight with some friends and it was such a delight. It was a late night dinner, around 10pm. Let's get down to the breakdown: 

Scene: cute, cozy, romantic & casual spot. They had an excellent playlist that was relaxing and not loud where you can't have a conversation. 

Food!: gnocchi app- delish. Nice little crisp on one side and then biting into it, a great combo of creamy & crisp per piece. 
            Vegetable risotto- delish. Just the right texture and creamy with the right amount of vegetables. 
            Red snapper entree- delish. The fish was nicely filet'd. A perfect char on the skin side to make it crispy and the right amount of seasoning. 
             Oso buco- super delish. Tender piece of meat with a nice sweet wine sauce over some lentils. I devoured it. Must get! 
              Ecuadorian chocolate mousse - super delish. Just the right decadence. Not super sweet and balances well with the milk tapioca on the bottom. I really liked this dessert. 

Service: impeccable! Very friendly and professional. They were always there to fill your glass without asking. Attentive and there when YOU need something! 

Overall, what a gem.  If you're around the area, don't miss the chance for a great meal. I'll be coming back to try the other stuff soon.
review.author: Billy C.

review.description: Wow! This place is the shiat! A total gem in my neighborhood. We wanted to check this out for a while and it did not disappoint.  Started with the gnocchi which were little pockets of yumminess with asparagus, mushrooms and a green sauce-so light and fluffy.  Followed by Scallops with. Potato purée and a leek sauce.  It was da-looooooosh!  Tried the other monkfish entree and it was cooked really nicely, pan seared with peas and pistachio. I am not a big fish eater by any means but it was tasty!  CASH ONLY but well worth it. Can't wait to come back!
review.author: Michele C.

review.description:
I visited last Friday 3/31 to have dinnner with friends. As always Sandra took my reservation for 5ppl over the phone and we secure a  table for 7pm. I order a bottle of Rioja to start the evening, which was a very good value "Cepas Antiguas,  Rioja seleccion privada 2015"
 When they opened the bottle, it had a nice bouquet of plums and berries and since i had already planned my meal, i knew it be a good choice for the evening. I had the homemade ricotta gnocchi with asparagus and mushroom sauce. Perfectly cooked gnocchi, flavorful sauce, silky smooth and well seasoned.  I had a chance to get a bite of the P.A. braised pork belly, wow that pork was spectacular. Nice crunchy skin, with layers of pork goodness and the sauce had a nice level of acidity to accompany the pickles, pork and watercress harmoniously. I mean this is why i have been to casa del chef 2x in the last month. You cannot find farm to table cuisine with such a degree of fineness, execution and 
Refinement unless you go to an overprice stuffy manhattan restaurant. Casa del Chef is perfect for a home style sit down meal without having to worry about wheather your meal will be good or not. Totally worry free option, just sit back and enjoy and yes bring cash, as they no longer take credit cards.
I digress back to my food, my main course was the pork ossobuco with ginger gastrique. This dish was served on a bed of lentils and collard greens.  One can ask, how much pork can you get in a meal. My answer would be "Never enough"  This was a very healthy portion for a main course. Even my wife got to share a little bit of my meal. Our friend was also blown away by the food and she will also become  loyal customer as well. We all had room for dessert, so we order a round of port wine for the table to go along with the warm white chocolate bread pudding which was super yummy. I must confess i never saw the guiness ice cream when i read the menu, but it amazing. The rest of the table had creme brulee, and the Ecuadorian chocolate ice cream. 
It was a great way to spend a rainy evening with good friends and awesome food.
Thank you Chef Alfonso and Thank you Sandra for making us feel part of the family!
review.author: Daniel M.

review.description:
I have been twice and I am going to say I was blown away. I am not going to say it was a perfect meal, the apps and the dessert in my Chef's Tasting were just good but both my entrees were excellent. On my second visit, it solidified my belief that the fish dishes here are outstanding, if they offer any kind of pan seared bass or red snapper, you must get it. Also, his menu changes often so make sure to check the website.

The chef, Alfonso Zhicay, came to America in 1994 from Ecuador and since then has worked at Bouley, Union Pacific and spent ten years working at Blue Hill. He lives in the neighbor of the restaurant, so I appreciate that he opened the restaurant here since he really could have easily opened up anywhere but he decided to put faith in the area he calls home.

The food:

Chef's Tasting July 

Cucumber Gazpacho- This was refreshing especially with the Summer heat but the flavors didn't really blow me away. It was OK. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=wCZ4GQDpgRytZm-Ghsrw7g&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

Red Snapper- This was my favorite dish of the night. It was so perfectly cooked with a nice crispy skin. The portion was on the small side but the flavors were spot on. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=oEnt1DDHLrxQiC9EQR8HSA&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

Pork Chop- The pork chop was super tender and had good flavor, the sauce was tasty but my only issue was the dish came off too sweet. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=3GNCdAMKH3MmzGzya_C7yQ&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

Chocolate Mousse with Passion Fruit and Blueberry- It was kinda an odd pairing but it was nice and refreshing for the Summer. I thought the passion fruit and blueberry had too much of an aggressive flavor and kinda overpowered everything else. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=wnOkYsodA0iw8dWdiAHjWw&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

A la Carte October

Autumn Soup- The Autumn Soup was a bowl of corn soup that was served hot. The broth was really tasty, it had a very deep corn flavor and had a nice sweetness. The corn itself was surprisingly mild in flavor, it was kinda surprising the corn pieces didn't have more flavor. Overall, still a good soup. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=0Kt49Jn4S4v4TZv15vUXGA&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

Grilled Rainbow Trout- Roasted Cauliflower, capers & olives vinaigrette. Like I said, they know how to do fish here. I really like the Trout dish here. The fish was cooked perfectly and the cauliflower add a nice contrast in texture with vinaigrette tying everything together nicely. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=kE_S39P_aJzFcPZRhkjcqw&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

Pan-Seared Black Bass- Spaghetti squash, potatoes, pumpkin seed pesto. This was the dish of the night, it was spectacular. The fish was perfection and the squash and potatoes paired well with the fish, and I loved the pesto. This is an absolute must order. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=_i6ZA_rugfH4HGwCOzJj3w&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

Swordfish- Green tomato marmalade, greens, roasted beet sauce. I thought this dish was OK, the fish was very lightly cooked and the taste of the fish was a bit strong for me and the texture kinda looked and felt like eating raw chicken breast so it wasn't the most appealing. The green tomato marmalade was funky, it had a pop of flavor that was kinda weird with the fish. The roasted beet sauce added a tang but not a lot of flavor. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=dk_Mt1wD7hehq3Iz_iIhkA&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

Vanilla Creme Brulee- Sweetened with local maple syrup. OMG get this, this was executed perfectly, it is one of the better creme brulees I have had. The custard portion had the right texture and had a very nice mouth feel. Then the sugar top was great, it had a perfect hard outer shell that added a nice texture to the soft custard, it was like eating candy. This is an absolute must. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=9KrVaCnKPpBFuo6RnktV6A&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA
review.author: Ben L.

review.description:
I really like this restaurant a lot! The vibe, the people are nice, the chef/owner is so friendly to chitchat with us & the food was great! 

I have this place bookmarked for a long time & really wanted to try it because its in Queens & I don't see those types of food in that area (woodside). I reserved & set a dinner with my 3 yelper friends. 

The place was nice with modern decor. We decided to try their $45 tasting menu. They served us three courses of meal & 1 dessert. Cucumber gazpacho, red snapper & pork loin. I forgot the name of the dessert but all I can say is the food was amazing! Everything was so tasty!

I'm glad this place exist in Queens. I'm planning my 2nd visit here & I'm gonna try from the regular menu so I can have big portion of each dish. Can't wait!
review.author: Jean Claire G.

review.description:
Casa Del Chef is a small but quaint little restaurant located in Queens. The choice of menu options are small but they have a fabulous tasting menu for $45.00. When you order make sure to tell your waiter what foods you don't like they will know not to include them when they serve your meal. I also wanted to note this is an Equadorian restaurant.

I was eating with my son and some friends so we all opted for the tasting menu.
Our tasting menu consisted of a small salad which consisted of micro green and tomatoes as our first course. The second course was grilled salmon accompanied by corn, carrots, and lobster chowder. The salad was very good but sure enough I found a hot pepper in there. My fault for not telling them I couldn't have foods that burn. The grilled salmon was to die for!! It seemed like just enough for me but wait the third course was coming.

Each time the waiter served us he explained what our dish consisted of. The main course was sirloin steak with pork, squash, and dandelion. This also was very good but I did find the steak just a little tough in areas. It was extremely filling for me.

For dessert which I was grateful was small consisted of banana mousse with yogurt and currant.It was delicious. 

This is a place known to locals so I was grateful for our friends who suggested we try it. Reservations are recommended for the weekend because since it so small the place does fill up fast. They are not needed for the weekdays.

We also shared some white wine to top off our evening together. Located near a train stop which they call the "L" for elevated Casa Del Chef makes a great spot for an evening meal.
review.author: Arlene M.

review.description:
I have been here multiple times and I love it every time.  The restaurant is cozy and I feel like I am dining at a friend's house.  The food is amazing and I love that the chef is able to create wonderful dishes and always let the freshness of the ingredients shine through.
We started with the Farmers Market Ratatouille and the squash of the week.   The ratatouille was diced up on the bottom of a small stoneware crock and it was topped off with a disk of polenta and cheese foam.  The vegetables had just a little crunch left in them and the creamy polenta was a nice contrast.
The squash of the week was a ring of acorn squash with a perfectly poached egg in the middle with some baby greens.  It was delicious as well.

For main course we had the  Duck Confit , Steamed Red Snapper and the Pan-Seared Black Bass.
Duck confit had nice crunchy skin and the tartness int he red cabbage help cut through the richness of the dish.  The steamed red snapper's broth was delicious!  I could drink bowlfuls of it!  The black bass had perfect crunchy skin and the fingerling potato was perfectly cooked.  

For dessert, the Ecuadorian Chocolate Mousse was awesome.  Nice and rich and not too sweet.

Can't wait to go back again!
review.author: Amy M.

review.description: I had waited a while to try this and really wanted to like it as much as everyone else has but was disappointed.  Ambience and music was great, but the pasta was over cooked and under seasoned for the appetizer and the scallop entree though tasty was the size of an appetizer.  Unfortunately, i won't be returning...
review.author: Andrea C.

review.description:
Chef tasting is $45 each and includes 3 courses plus dessert

Amazing ingredients all from the Jackson heights green market 

Perfect service and ambience 

Will be back to explore more
review.author: Michael V.

review.description: I went for the Valentine's Day Tasting Menu for $75 and was first blown away by the level of detail that went into the plating of each dish, and then by how wide the gamut of delicious flavors that kept coming with every dish was. Will definitely be coming back for their Chef's Tasting Menu. One would easily pay 3x more or a similar meal in Manhattan. The wait staff is also top quality. The space is comfy and very welcoming, somewhere to enjoy dinner for two. If you are looking for a great date spot or just a lover of great cuisine, this is the best in woodside. Just go!
review.author: Jham V.

review.description: The tasting menu was absolutely exquisite and half the price what you would have to pay in the city. No surprise since the chef originally worked for the renowned blue hill prior to opening this place.
review.author: Emily V.

review.description:
I really wanted to like this place because of how highly it's rated by fellow yelpers and it is Michelin rated. But, I found it incredibly underwhelming. 

The good: 
The atmosphere is very quaint, warm, and cozy. I went on a weekday night so the restaurant was fairly empty, with only two other parties seated. The waiter was attentive. Ingredients clearly tasted fresh. 

The...eh: 
They were out of the duck confit and the snapper so we ordered the sea bass, which turned out to be the most flavorful dish, with whatever the green sauce was; butternut quash soup, which was topped with crispy, savory kale chips that offered a nice contrast of flavor to the sweet butternut squash purée; the ratatouille was good, but lacked...something - I won't crave it. For the main, I tried the monk fish which was just not enjoyable. Yes, you can taste the fresh ingredients and the perfectly cooked fish, but it was incredibly boring. It lacked flavor completely as it just had a butter sauce to it. Even the fish could have been lightly salted to bring out natural flavor, but I don't know that it was. Garlic? Bright lemon? Anything? No. It relied heavily on butter...

All in all, if you are a person who enjoys complex flavors more than anything else in dining, you might want to reconsider this restaurant or you might feel a little remorse when you get the check. It's not for everybody. And it was not for me.
review.author: A R.

review.description:
I wanted to like this place. The service is so warm and welcoming I wanted to leave fully satisfied and ready to come back. Unfortunately, it wasn't the case. 

I was here just yesterday, a Saturday reservation for 5pm to avoid the crowds. As previously indicated, the place is small, and rather unassuming. Rustic tiny wooden tables, bare decor (although polished), and family-run vibe. You would never think u'd be charged Greenwich Village fares, here.

After reading of several yelpers complaining about the amount of food served on the tasting menu, we were cautious on our order, and asked for a couple of appetizers and 1 entree to share. We wanted to test their cuisine before fully committing. 

The pork belly was delicious. 1 small thin piece worth $12, but still very good. 

The Brussels sprouts were tasty, although the portion was also very small... for $10. 

Unfortunately, the $23 steak was disappointing. The meat was clearly of low quality, as every piece contained a thick string of tendon right in the middle. It was chewy and difficult to cut. We kept trying and trying with our helpless knives until we left part of it in the dish. Despite the presence of the tendon, the meat wasn't succulent, and surely more rare than medium-rare like we ordered it. Needless to say, it was disappointing. I don't feel it's fair to charge that much for such a low quality cut of meat. After the waitress kindly asked us how we found the steak, I felt compelled to gently let her know what was wrong. She looked sincerely apologetic, but nothing was done to make it better. 

Overall, we were glad we were cautious and didn't order more, and eventually finished dinner in a nearby place we trusted. Sadly, despite the good quality of the appetizers, I have no reason to go back. The menu doesn't have much variety.
review.author: Giacomo C.

review.description:
This place is tucked away in the side streets of woodside. It's fairly close to SriPraPhai (literally 2 blocks away). Case Del Chef is an unpretentious restaurant with taste from the city with Queens pricing. 

We ordered the (Vegetarian) Chef Tasting, which is about $45 pp for 4 courses (including dessert). You let them know what your restrictions are and they work with the local produce they have in-house. There's a nice elementary of surprise letting the experts design your meal for the evening -- cause flipping through the menu and deciding what you want is so last season. 

Onward to the food -- we started off the meal with a house shot which fires up the belly for all the deliciousness you're about to consume. We had beets with wild greens drizzled with beets vinaigrette -- it tangy and sweet in all the right amounts. The next course we had hand rolled captuni pasta in tomato based sauce -- it was light but it packed with the creamy tomato sauce. Our main course was a mushroom medley with long bean and greens sitting on a bed of quinoa -- this one I had to save half for the next day, it was too good to finish it in one sitting. And lastly the DESSERT -- marinated rhubarb stems with house-made frozen yogurt. It was light and sweet and wasn't chewy as you expected the rhubarb to be. 

Overall, great meal with superb presentation and a nice balance of sweet and tangy. Will definitely stop by again.
review.author: Flora M.

review.description: First time here with the hubby and it was phenomenal! We had the grouper and rainbow trout appetizers. Both were delish! Especially the rainbow trout. The fish was fresh and skin crispy! For our entrees I had the pan seared bass. This was incredible as well! Light, crispy, with perfect accompaniments. My husband had the ossobucco, the meat fell off the bone, tender and flavorful! Then our desserts were the chocolate mousse and creme brûlée. We loved the mousse. Creams brûlée was good but the mousse topped it for us. Over all great experience, amazing food and amazing staff!! Will be back again! Thank you Casa Del Chef!!
review.author: Hannah D.

review.description:
I had high hopes for this place. A friend recommended it to me and it's not often that you find a fine dining type of establishment in this area, so it really stood out to me. Unfortunately it turned out to be underwhelming and overpriced, which is what I feared. 

We came in around 7:15 on a Saturday evening for a 7:30 reservation. No problem getting seated slightly early, as the place was surprisingly empty. We immediately proceeded to make our worst decision of the night by ordering the chef's tasting menu for two. 

It started off with an appetizer of two corn cakes plated alongside a small nest of pickled cabbage with a quail egg on top. It was tasty but the portion was incredibly small. We were pretty hungry, but we figured the later courses would be more satisfying. 

However, later dishes were just as paltry. I would equate them to tapas (for which by the way, I highly recommend Salt & Fat in Sunnyside). Aside from the portioning, the food was fairly traditional. At this price point I suppose I expected something a little more creative. If I wanted something traditional, I'd have gone to a more standard place. 

I really do appreciate the mission, opening shop in humble Woodside, sourcing local ingredients, etc. Everything tasted great, the steak was cooked perfectly, the service was fantastic. But when it comes down to it, it was a very standard meal. And when we were done paying the ~$130 bill, we had to go down to 74th street and get some $5 momos at a food truck to feel satisfied.

We did notice that the couple next to us that ordered a la carte (rather than the chef's tasting menu) seemed to get some decently-portioned, tasty looking dishes, and I doubt they had to spend as much as us. Perhaps we'll return in the future and give this place another shot.
review.author: Lily J.

review.description:
Casa Del Chef is outrageously good.  One of our friends told us they had one of the best tasting menus.  The food is out of this world.

We came and had the Chef's tasting menu.  Each dish just wowed us one after the other.  The food was a symphony.

We started off with an amuse bouche of chilled fennel soup with a drop of basil oil.  Okay... it's a shot of soup but well done to cleanse the pallet.  And it's pretty and well executed.

We had a veggie plate of succulent vine.  This was something special.  It tasted like nothing I've ever had before and at the same time felt like home.  I just wanted more after this plate was done.

We had a small cut of branzino over a bed of squash.  The veggies cut nicely into the oily taste of the fish.  The skin just was crispy and fatty in all the right ways.

The main course was a seared lamb chop on a bed of asparagus and a creamy wheat berry sauce.  The lamb was executed perfectly, tender, subtle, wonderful.

The dessert was a strawberry rhubarb stew.  I'm... not one for deserts but it was very good.

We came as a group of four and each had the same tasting menu so we could compare notes after.  The verdict was 4 people just in bliss by the end.

Casa Del Chefs.  I look forward to coming back.
review.author: Kwai L.

review.description:
Oh, Bea, you had me at bottomless brunch for $45! 

Went here with a girlfriend one Sunday and got in right away. I was immediately drawn in by the band playing and the idea of being able to drink to blackout for a very non-Manhattan price. I kid, kind of. It's also half a block from my apartment which I find incredibly fortuitous. 

Sat down and we were served immediately even though they had a pretty good brunch crowd. Tables are kind of close, but you never feel like it's intrusive. I wish the tables had been bigger, though, because I really wanted to have one of everything in front of me. No worries, I can pace myself. 

The food here is amazing. The drinks here, ditto. 

House ricotta, pear salad, everything. The best thing to do is close your eyes and point and then order that, X2. We had just an amazing time eating incredible food. 

Service was spectacular, the decor is gorgeous and the ambiance is just what you need when you're sipping on beautiful drinks (no, really, they're so pretty) and eating some amazing food. I'm shocked they don't have a line out the door on the weekends with a bouncer controlling all the foodies. More for me! 

Love, love love!
review.author: Nic P.

review.description:
Very cute place!  We sat in the back area which is bright and airy with an outdoor feel.  

The food:
I stuck with the recommendations on Yelp!

Tuna guacamole - people have raved about this and it was good but not the best I've ever had.

Green pasta - yummy but not mind blowing.  

Manicotti -different sauce  with beef and tasty

Lavender monk- ok drink.  

Cute place to try if in the neighborhood.
review.author: Rene B.

review.description:
the atmosphere here is very comforting
theres a dark and romantic feel to it
didnt have to wait at all to be seated
the waitress was super friendly and checked on us throughout the whole meal
the duck appetizer was absolutely incredible- my favorite dish
the lamb chops were perfectly cooked and so tender- only comes with three however
overall, loved the decor as well as the food.
no complaints whatsoever
review.author: Raymond W.

review.description:
3.5! Overall, dinner food was solid and service was great.

Came here for dinner with my friend before a comedy show. We were running 30 minutes late, but we called and asked to push back the reservation, which they were super gracious about. We sat in this covered outdoor-esque garden area with plants around us, exposed brick, etc. which was really nice.

Food-wise, we got the duck turnover, tuna targuac, and green pasta entree, all to share between the two of us. The duck turnover was really interesting and flavorful, kind of a sweet and sour sauce with some fruity pieces which added some great flavor. The tuna targuac was also very yummy and seasoned well, and came with these interesting green rice-cake-chip things for you to spread the tuna targuac on. The green pasta (green due to spinach) was also pretty good -- nicely al dente, with about 6 garlic-seasoned shrimp. The shrimp was a little bit underseasoned, but I enjoyed the creamy garlic pasta flavor. 

Food came out quickly and they were able to get us out of there by 715 to catch our 730pm show which was perfect.
review.author: Lillian Z.

review.description:
This place is pricey but truly amazing, so in my opinion absolutely worth it. We went for dinner with friends there and was good. 

The decor is super chic and yet homey. They have old movies playing against the backdrop of the white washed exposed brick and candles on all the tables. The decor inside behind the bar is speakeasy meets steam punk meets modern. It was very cool inside. I liked it a lot. 

The menu is small but incredibly interesting. I ordered the only vegetarian entree on the menu: Tomato stuffed with root vegetables, eggplant, kale and grains. It was very flavorful and just incredible. Just amazing. We also ordered mac & cheese, beet salad, mushroom pizza and few other sides. Everyone at the table throughly enjoyed their meals as well as drinks. 

They have a nice selection of cocktails. They do cocktails VERY well. We all got many different ones to sample all of them and they were all unique and interesting and delicious. Very well made. Great bartenders! 

The food was filled with so much flavor. This place does veggies well. They should really add another veggie entree on their menu because they are really killing it in that department. Definitely worth checking this place out!
review.author: Maulik M.

review.description:
I've been here a couple times and both times service seems to be lacking.  I'm not sure if they're understaffed, but they sure are slow here. Other than that, the food is pretty good. 

My last visit here was for their Sunday bottomless brunch. Most of their items on the menu were great. The pear salad may sound boring to the palate, but trust me you should try it. It's light, well dressed, and is packed with flavor. The spaghetti was surprisingly good too. Loved the idea of the melted layer of cheese on top. It's what made the dish delicious. Unfortunately, the fried egg was overcooked so it didn't blend in very well. 
I did have more than one serving of their French Toast. How dare you add Nutella to this dish! *sarcasm* I couldn't get enough of it. The Tuna tar guac & eggs benedict was delicious as well. 

I love bacon, but nothing spectacular with their candied bacon, so I would skip. The smoked salmon was also basic.

Favorite bottomless drink was the blushing mimosa. It's not too sweet and went down like water ;)
review.author: Frances T.

review.description:
Great bottomless brunch! Delicious food and a great variety of well made brunch cocktails as well. The service could use some improvement but everything else about the place was spot on.

The front of the house seemed a bit disorganized when we reached, and though we had a reservation the hostess had given our table away to someone else. They sorted it out soon though and we were seated after about five minutes of waiting.

The space is cozy and charming, and done up in a rustic yet classy sort of way. They have an additional room off to the side which was closed for a private event when we got there.

The brunch, as I mentioned, is excellent! The food options are amazing and for two hours you can get as much food and alcohol as you want with the bottomless option. We sampled roughly half the items on the menu, and the standouts for us were the twice baked potato, candied bacon, and the brioche french toast. The drinks are good as well, I especially liked the Carpe Diem which was tasty and strong, and the Blushing Mimosa which was nice and refreshing.

Our server was friendly and sweet, but the service was a bit slow and indifferent. At many points during our meal we were left waiting for someone to come and refill our drinks or take our order for the next round of food.

Overall a great brunch deal with some really good options, and a somewhat inexperienced (in my opinion) staff. If they get the kinks in their service sorted out, they would get a solid five stars for sure.
review.author: Melville G.

review.description:
This is our second time here. We love the Chilean Sea Bass! Unique offerings on the menu with small plates to share or full entrees. They have a Tuna Tar Guac that is must-try!

They cater to dietary restrictions very well. The items I wanted were prepared to accommodate me and yes, that means sugar and gluten free!

My husband is on his third dark & stormy and says it's one of the best dark & stormy drinks he has had. Perfect balance of the components.
review.author: Julia M.

review.description:
We were a group of 3 who had a wonderful meal at  Bea's after  a Wed matinee.  We ate well prepared fish and 3 generous-sized, delicious lamp chops. The  price was moderate for a restaurant in the theater district & the service was attentive and efficient. The old timey probation era feeling was pleasant. Old movies were flashing  in the wall for visual atmosphere, but not for real viewing.
I would have given the restaurant a 5  but did not because the noise level was high. (There is a separate room that is  light & bright, & I would request that seating next time.  It was  an atrium in the previous restaurant at this location  & maybe it would be quieter)
review.author: Sara G.

review.description:
The cocktails are pretty good. The food came put surprisingly quick, you're going to get your food fast if your hungry. I got the green pasta since it seems to be all the rage, but it could use a tiny dash of salt, other than that, great place, great ambiance. I enjoyed the vodka more than tequila, but that's personal preference. Try it out and you won't be disappointed! 
Not too busy, plenary of space at the bar and the bartenders are pretty great!
review.author: Heather H.

review.description:
For $45 dollars, the world is your oyster.
Unlimited brunch cocktails AND unlimited brunch tapas were the name of the game, here at Bea.

A gal pal and I made reservations via Yelp for a Saturday brunch. My friend was seated immediately (oops- I'm never there exactly on time) and wasn't asked to stand until I got there. Although this may seem like a small detail, Bea stands out from other brunch scenes in the city, in more ways than one! 

There was a live band playing morning jazz tunes and the dishes kept coming out immediately. We started with the Scrambled Egg Logs, Kale Salad, twice baked potato, and brioche french toast. They were all SO GOOD. Then we ordered the Tuna Tar Guac, the fruit cup, and the maple- spice flavored bacon. I honestly didn't think I would like the bacon (it's not crunchy) BUT boy o' boy, the flavor was so on point.

Bea is definitely my new go-to-staple here in the city. Can't wait to go back and sit in the atrium!
review.author: Monica R.

review.description:
Yes, yes, YESSS! Guys, there is a reason why this place has such good ratings and so many reviews. Brunch at Bea was everything I hoped for and more. The bottomless brunch was worth every penny. Bea, just take all my money why don't you!

Obsessed with the vibe of this place. Rustic and chic with an intimate feel to it. The exposed brick, brushed wood, dimly lit candles, and live jazz music playing in the background will really set the mood. There is a tiny alcove towards the back which is where the live band plays. They had a group who sang and played jazz music. Loved that! It does get a little loud so be prepared for that. I especially couldn't get enough of the tiny "outdoorsy" side room filled with greenery and a skylight roof. The roof lends itself to plenty of natural light. It's like you're outside without really being outside. I definitely would like to dine in there next time I visit. 

This place gets pretty busy so you may want to consider making a reservation ahead of time. It was at max capacity when we arrived but luckily we were able to be seated and served food at the bar. Service was great. The food came out relatively quickly. 

Ok so let's talk about this brunch. $45 for a totally bottomless brunch... yes you heard me right. That means bottomless drinks and unlimited small plates for 90 minutes. Not gotta lie, I debated doing it at first but I decided it made more sense after realizing an entree and three drinks would cost me the same price ($10 each a la carte/$10 drinks). That being said, it was 100% worth it. Loved being able to sample all kinds of stuff. Here is what all I tried.

Drinks:
- Morning After aka Bloody Mary: excellent, spicy, and garlic-y (in a good way)
- Mimosa: good, pretty standard

Food:
- Tuna tar gauc: delish! I liked the mix of flavors... my boyfriend couldn't stop raving about how much he loved the "green chip things" it came on, his words "I could have eaten an entire brunch of just the tuna tar guac"
- Twice baked potato: very good, baked to perfection
- Pear salad: good (sweet) flavor but also super boring... literally it was a bed of arugula, 4 slices of pears, and 1 date... not really worth ordering imo
- Fruit cup: pretty self explanatory, came with whipped cream on top 
- Brioche French toast: AHHHmazing, a must order, best part was the Nutella on top
- Smoked salmon: really cute presentation, three bite sized pieces of salmon on bread with other toppings
- Pork shoulder: very good, I'm not a pork eater but I gotta say it tasted just like chicken, very tender and juicy
- Spaghetti and eggs: a total snoozefest, not as exciting as I thought it would be... the egg took away from the tomato sauce flavoring, there also wasn't nearly enough sauce on it... skip this dish
- Eggs Benedict: pretty standard 

All in all, I really like this place. Top notch food, service, and ambience. Sure, it's on the pricier side but totally worth it. Plus, it's in a great location... walkable distance from Times Square and many of the theaters. Check it out!
review.author: Anika S.

review.description: This is an interesting brunch spot. They offer $30 for unlimited brunch tapas. We initially resisted since we didn't think we'd each that much, but each tapa is pretty small. You'll likely end up eating that many per person so definitely go for it. Each tapa was very tasty. The baked eggs and asparagus were the two main ones that stood out.
review.author: Thomas C.

review.description:
We went to Bea with a group of 4 before seeing Hamilton on a Saturday night. Our reservation was at 6 and we needed to be at Richard Rodgers Theatre around 7:45. We let our server know our time constraint and she was more than obliging to get us our food and out the door without making us feel rushed. She was wonderful.

I got the lavender monk for drinks and the green pasta for dinner. I enjoyed both of my choices immensely. The lavender monk may be one of the better cocktails I have ever tried and the green pasta was creamy and flavorful. We also shared the ricotta with honey which tasted great but smelled kind of weird. It kind of had a fishy, oyster briney smell which really threw me off because the flavor was mild and sweet. I am not sure if this is the intent of the dish or if this was a one off situation but I think I would like to try a different app next time. My dining compatriots got the shepherds pie, the english muffin burger, and the green pasta as well. Everyone had nothing but good things to say about their dishes. I snagged a few of my english muffin burger friends fries and they were very good. The aioli dipping sauce was fantastic.

Dining at Bea was a perfect precursor to going to the theater. The food is great but the atmosphere and helpful staff put it over the top.
review.author: Anu P.

review.description:
Bea is one of my absolute favorite restaurants, period. I've been here enough times to work my way through a good portion of the menu and I have yet to be disappointed by a dish. Bea consistently delivers flavorful, interesting, and downright delicious food. Everyone person I've recommended this restaurant to has since gone back several times / would recommend to new friends. 

It is a little bit of a hidden gem as the restaurant is always bustling but never packed or requires too long of a wait. I've generally been able to walk in without reservations. 

Highly highly recommend!
review.author: Nancy L.

review.description:
Tucked away on an otherwise nondescript corner off of Times Square and the Port Authority Bus Terminal is Bea, a gem of a New American restaurant. With dimmer lighting, vintage films projected on the walls, and a mix of oldies and 2000s music over the speakers, it certainly makes for a unique atmosphere.

I've been to Bea on a couple occasions to help inform this review. The appetizers all look very appetizing, but the way the menu is laid out does not clearly delineate between apps and entrees, probably with purpose. Most recently I got the succotash to start, which was hearty and great to split: a tasty mix of corn, lima beans, and bacon. I followed that up with the duck turnover, which was a solid dish. I appreciated the pineapple and avocado creme sauce that topped the turnover, but the stuffing inside was not particularly remarkable.

Meanwhile, the green pasta with shrimp, which I had previously and hence suggested to my friend upon returning, is phenomenal. Whether it's the pasta itself or the cream sauce I'm not sure, but it is a dish packing a punch. A must get in my opinion.

Bea is one of the more dependable options in the immediate environs of Times Square that I have come across. I would not hesitate to drop by after work or even for a special occasion or night out. The drinks list is decent (more so for wine and cocktails) and the service is attentive. I will surely be back, at least for the pasta.
review.author: Arthur C.

review.description:
On the pricer side but the matcha noodles were delicious, portions were a little small. Service was very accommodating, our party sized ended up growing after we got seated and the staff there easily found a bigger table for our group. 

Drinks were okay, I felt they weren't sweet enough but this is coming from someone who likes everything sweeter.
review.author: Jenny N.

review.description:
I was so thrilled to have found this amazing restaurant!  Hubby and I had a late dinner reservation (11:15 pm) on a Friday night.  When we arrived, the place was pretty packed, but we were seated pretty quickly.  I had one of their signature spicy tequila cocktails, which was surprisingly refreshing/flavorful and not too sweet.  I would try it again.

We started with the Tuna Tar Guac and House Ricotta (honey on the side).  Both of these dishes were absolutely amazing.  They were well portioned for starters, so we were not too full to eat our entrees.  Hubby ordered the English Muffin Burger (medium rare) and I ordered the Chilean Sea Bass.  We sampled each other's dishes and agreed that both were quite good.  Hubby's burger was cooked to perfection - the meat was tasty and moist.  My Chilean Sea Bass had a firm exterior (no crust) with a moist and buttery interior.  The corn and veggies that were paired with the dish really complimented this fish.  We shared a good bottled of Sangiovese, so we skipped dessert.

The service was great and the ambiance was both romantic and fun.  It was an amazing night and I will definitely return.
review.author: Theresa C.

review.description:
Bea is a nice cocktail bar located in Hell's Kitchen. I went here over the weekend with friends and family and had a great time.

The ambiance is nice and the place was not loud enough where you cannot hear the people you are with. If you are looking to take a group of four out for drinks, this place is the spot to go!

My only complaint would be the limited late night food menu. The waiter did not offer any opinion on the choices listed and made us feel as if it would be a waste.

If you like Gin, then you will love The Brooklyn Cue and Over The Moon; they are delicious.  

I tried the Tottenville Tea and The Paper Fox. I would not suggest the Paper Fox as the housemade ginger syrup used did not taste well.

The service was great as the waiter was attentive and knew her cocktails. There was no crowd at the bar and never a long line for the bathroom which is always a plus. I am not sure if anyone will find this cool, but they do play a black and white film on two walls. It is not distracting but interesting if you are into that.
review.author: Ross P.

review.description: Love their bottlemless brunch. I do wish they would either add or change up the menu a little more but not enough to keep me from coming back. We recommend to anyone we know headed to the city. 5/28/17
review.author: Rebecca B.

review.description:
Officially the best burger in NYC !! After guilty spree at Glossier near by, I was looking for a good cheap eat near by and found this amazing spot. The place is tiny, could seat 16. 

We got a sliced/chopped cheese chicken burger & teriyaki chicken taco with Milk tea. First bite into my perfectly barbecued & charred yet succulent chicken, I was lost. Paired with cheddar and other flavors, it was Christmas in my mouth. I strongly encourage that order. We actually switched the beef for chicken in that burger. Moving on to tacos, very good and flavorful as well but my adjective list still roots for the burger. Milk tea was okay. Only complaint was that our table (communal) was occupied by two, who seemed like friends of the cashier and was eating outside food which threw me off a bit but I can never complain because of the burger.
review.author: Mathangi D.

review.description:
Small little store with a good amount of options to choose from. Burgers, tacos, fries, even drinks! 
It was quick and easy to order and get the food. Eat in or take out, you're good to go. I had the taco platter with the cheese steak taco, tempura fish taco, and spicy pork. All three of them had a unique flavor. I think the platter was worth it to get a taste of the different taco options. And 3 tacos are definitely enough to fill you up.
Would definitely be back to try their other tacos and their fries. Maybe even their burgers!
review.author: Nanciee C.

review.description:
I always go for the Taco Platter when I'm here. During my most recent visit I chose Tempura Fish, Grilled Steak, and Chipotle Chicken. I also got a Breakroom Fries that I shared with my friends. 

Taco Platter: I love that they weren't stingy and were very generous in filling the tacos with a LOT of meat. Because of that, the single flour tortilla barely held everything together for each taco, which made them a little messy to eat. By no means am I complaining (because how can one even complaining about being given MORE meat), but I think going forward, doubling up on the tortilla would probably help. 

Breakroom Fries: It's a lot of fried goodies all in one aluminum foil pan! There are tater tots, fries, bacon, and a fried egg. I love the jalepeno slices; they give a slight kick. There aren't many seeds, so you don't have to worry about burning your tongue off.

There's an array of hot sauces to choose from. However, my friends and I found that there were many bottles that were nearly/completely empty, especially the more popular ones (i.e. original Cholula and the green El Yucateco were harder to spot).
review.author: Sharon X.

review.description:
I came in for happy hour, WHICH THEY NO LONGER HAVE...rather than being defeated, I decided to order some tacos. These are some bomb tacos. I got the chicken and carnitas. Both were so flavorful, with very tender meat. They don't skimp on the pico and there's 1 tortilla (versus the normal 2 around here). I've had a lot of tacos in the city, but these have to be some of my favorites. 

Also, it was really hard to contain my excitement when I saw the hot sauce wall. To top it off I got the mint lemonade, which was very fresh was sweet while still maintaining the tart from the lemon.
review.author: Sonia S.

review.description:
Breakroom is okay. After a disappointing meal at Set L.E.S., I looked around for some bougie ass tacos that would finally impress me. Enter breakroom, which serves essentially the same type of tacos and fries, but at a slightly (and I mean slightly) lower price point. It's a hole in the wall almost, with 3 tables with bar-style seats.

My friend and I both decided on the taco platter, which is 3 tacos for 10.95. Of course, I also opted for the breakroom fries, to compare it to the fries at SET L.E.S.

I chose the fish taco, carnitas, and steak. The fish taco was hands down the best one. A lightly fried piece of fish with an airy breaking, along with a slice of avocado and a refreshing slaw. There was a good mix of flavors and textures, and I really enjoyed this one. It comes wrapped in a freshly made tortilla (thought there would be 2 for a more authentic touch). Compared to the nasty tortilla at SET L.E.S. (Which I suspect is store bought), this tortilla was much better without that raw flour taste. 

The carnitas was a bit tough, and paled in comparison to the carnitas at chipotle for example. The steak was similarly chewy, and both tacos fell flat for me. If I were to get tacos here again I might just stick to the fish. 

The fries coke topped with a fried egg, some crispy pork belly, and cheese. This is where SET L.E.S. wins. The pork belly here was small chewy pieces, and the fried egg was kinda sad. The cheese was just cheese, and I felt overall disappointed by these fries, whereas the fries at SET were unbelievably good and generous with the toppings.

Overall I probably wouldn't return there. The tacos are still quite expensive at almost $3.50 for each one, and they weren't even that good. Also the hand sanitizer machine didn't work, which sucked because tacos are super messy.
review.author: Kevin C.

review.description:
I do not know why I have not heard about this place. I'm around Chinatown a lot but have never seen this place until yelp!  Came here on a Friday evening. This place is a hole in a wall. It is small and there are not a lot of seating. They have high tables with tall stools. I like how they have so many different kinds of hot sauce you can try. 

We ordered the original burger, steak taco, pork belly taco, breakroom fries and passion fruit lemonade. My favorite is the steak taco. It has good flavors. I would recommend the breakroom fries but it is spicy. It has tater tots, fries, bacons, jalapeños and a egg. I asked for the jalapeño to be on the side but they threw it in the fries anyways. My boyfriend liked the burger. He said it was pretty good. 

Overall this place is a good place to stop by to grab a quick bite/snack. The prices were reasonable and the food came out fast.
review.author: Daisy C.

review.description: If you want something other than Asian food in Chinatown then come here and order their tacos. I love the tempura fish with the avocado, cheesesteak,  and spicy pork tacos. My go to whenever I come here.
review.author: Ren Z.

review.description: This place has the best tacos.  I have not tried their burgers yet, but many yelpers claim that they also have the best burgers in town.  I strongly strongly recommend you get fried chicken tacos.  Those are amazing.  I think the 3 tacos for $10 deal is the right one to go for here.  You can order from a list of a wide variety of tacos.  Great place for casual tacos and burgers.
review.author: Joseph K.

review.description: Decided to get lunch while I have jury duty. Place is very small but cozy. Came during lunch time obvs. Food is really good. Got the ribeye cheesesteak. Must come back here again
review.author: Lexi R.

review.description: A cute little taco and sandwich place in the midst of Chinatown. There's only enough seating for 15 people, so it can be awkward to go and realize you either have to get take out instead or come back later. The breakroom fries are a must try! They have bacon, dippy egg, pork belly, fries, tater tots, scallions, and jalapeños on them and they are Delish! The tacos were all great, and the breakroom burger was yummmy.
