We started with the roasted beets, herb yogurt, pistachios and beet chips and the glazed pork ribs, salsify chips and micro celery. The beets were great (esp the yogurt) but the ribs were out of this world: falling off the bone, still moist and just enough glaze.

Then pastas: the duck pappardelle and the fazzoletti were both excellent. The portions were just right and the pastas light and just the right degree of al dente.

Finished with the chocolate budino which was rich, creamy and the perfect share.

BYOB for now and a steady and happy stream of customers...esp for an early Wednesday evening in Bushwick. I can imagine weekends might be just a bit crazy.

So come during the week and experience some magic coming out of an astounding small kitchen.
review.author: Nina K.

review.description:
This is a great neighborhood restaurant in a tiny space, so the stars reflect the rating compared to other restaurants of its kind.  

I never thought I could get amazing house made pasta around the corner from my apartment and the dishes are executed with unusual lightness. Mushroom appetizer has great balance, the pork ribs are rich and flavorful and the steak and eggs are a brunch steal.

The space itself lacks ambience, but it's all about the food here.
review.author: Dory K.

review.description:
This is an in-depth review. My reviews are based on 5 categories.
Ambiance 
Service
Food quality 
Price
Value

The Ambiance was a 5/5. This has a really wonderful feel to it. When you see it from the street the entrance is small and seductive. At first glance it looks like you are walking into a small hip coffee shop. Walk through and down the hall and the place opens up into a 1950's rat pack jive bar. Private booths wrapped in leather, new age hipster feel to the bar that messes oh so well with the entire style and theme of the place. 

The Service was a 5/5. Our server was not only very helpful with the menu but an absolute gentleman. He was at our table when we needed him and never when we didn't. Absolute perfect balance without being over the top or excessive. The outfit worn by our server and others also helps tie into the theme of the restaurant just add that little extra charm to the place.

The food quality was a 5/5. We ordered two of the trademark burgers and a 3rd entire that was a classic chop salad. The burgers were cooked exactly how e had asked them to be, served hot right from the grill. A wonderful blend of great tasting meat and spice made this burger a true standout. Simply put one of the best specialty burgers you can get in all of Manhattan. The fries were cooked with a golden crisp and a sprinkle of salt that had a great taste in between each mouthwatering bite of burger. The salad was presented with a full coating of grated parmesan cheese, a bed of fresh greens, and a tasteful dressing that really topped it off nicely. 

The Price was a 4.75/5. Lunch with drinks and food for 3 of us stayed under $100 with tip. For the quality of this food I feel this is a fair and balanced price.

The Value was a 5/5. With everything that went into making this a wonderful experience it is easy to highly recommend this place. The atmosphere is lovely, the service is exceptional, the food had me wanting to come back again before even leaving, and the price is just right. Thank you Trademark for a wonderful afternoon, and we will surely see you again soon. 

TC.
review.author: Teddy C.

review.description:
** Updated Review- After leaving this review, which I will not retract bc it is accurate of our experience, I have to say that management worked hard to right the wrongs of our server. They didn't just apologize, they worked to find and fix the problems and I hope this means others that visit this establishment will have an improved experience in the future. 

The food was definitely 5 stars but the service was one star. Snobby, inattentive, and basically nonexistent. I was really excited about this place and was sadly disappointed.  Icing on the cake... Told us they didn't serve alcohol until 11 (we were there at 10) and shortly after we saw them pouring mimosas at the bar.
review.author: Lydia M.

review.description:
I really wanted to like this place after the rave reviews and the proximity to my gym but it was just meh.

Ordered the shishito peppers which were served in a generous portion and were tasty.  My friend ordered the brick chicken which I've never heard of before but tried some and is something if I returned would order.

I had the TM burger and that was incredibly underwhelming considering it was $19.  Probably should priced at half that. Fortunately it came with some fries that salvaged it a bit but would not recommend.  

They were out of one of the beers I wanted but the service was great.  The decor is was warm and it wasn't too loud.

I am torn if I would go back or not.
review.author: Johnson L.

review.description:
I've had really great food at everyone of the restaurants under the In Good Company group. Trademark def being one of them!!

$14 cocktails. I got the uncle PAT which is grapefruit based with tequila. My friend had an old fashion. 

As a table of 4, we shared the Tuna poke and burrata & knots appetizers. Tuna poke was really yummy and marinated well. The small size is $16 for a small bowl. Pretty good size if you just though want to try a bite or too with 3 other friends. The entree size of the poke is $32. The burrata & knots was rly flavorful. Wow the knots. I don't know how they made the bread so soft yet crunchy. And the burrata was a great pairing with it!! I usually don't like eating big globs of cheese but thought it paired very well with the knots! Def think the appetizers were be star of the night. 

I ordered the scallops which come in 4 with fingerling potatoes. It's a little on the saltier side but  the dish sauce and potatoes balanced it out. The dish was $34. 

My friends also ordered the spaghetti & clams around, TM burger, and fried chicken sandwich. From what I heard from them: burger was a little dry, spaghetti was "not bad" and fried chicken sandwich was great !!

Overall ambience is cute and hip. A smaller spot so I'd make a reservation just in case! Service was great!! Our waitress was really nice and sweet.
review.author: Tanya Z.

review.description:
While there's only one "Trademark Taste & Grind," the company that runs this restaurant seems to basically operate the set like a chain. Sure, they have different names, but the food is really similar between them. So, if you're looking for a distinctive experience, you might want to head elsewhere. The decor is very trendy and a bit busy.

Prices were way over the top for brunch at a mostly empty place on a Saturday (at about 1pm). The brunch burger was over $20. It was good but not *that* good. Service was attentive and efficient.

The three-star rating reflects that everything was pretty much alright, just not good enough or priced well enough to motivate a return visit.
review.author: David S.

review.description:
Following my previous experience and review, my friends and I returned to give Trademark another try. This time, we were invited to sit in the actual dining room and sample more dishes.

Upon entering, you walk through a trendy looking coffee shop to get to the actual restaurant in the back. The venue is beautifully decorated with a cool, almost retro feel. Wood carved figures hung on the wall next to our booth, along with frame pictures, exposed bricks and fun light fixtures. The service was immaculate, partly due to the fact that we were invited back by the restaurant so as to be given extra attention. Nonetheless, the staff was extremely attentive and helpful throughout the night.

Food thoughts round 2:
Smashed Beets - surprisingly tasty mixed with tahini and feta to give the root more flavor
Meatballs - delicious meat covered in melted ricotta cheese soaked in some warm tomato sauce
Crispy Gnocchi and Cheese - again delicious warm little bites with gooey cheese and soft yet crispy dough
Tuna Poke - fresh tuna in a refreshing sesame oil / soy sauce combination; really good but not spectacular
Whole Branzino - special of the night; fish was cooked tenderly and skin to a crispy perfection but the fish lacked flavor, which is mostly attributed to the white fish itself; the side of oyster mushrooms was amazing
Sea Scallops - I only had a bite, which was cooked tenderly but felt lukewarm
18oz Bone-In Dry-Aged NY Strip - I only had a piece; though cooked medium rare, tasted dry and stale to me; friend commented that she preferred the 8oz Hanger Steak over this at Trademark
Chocolate Chip Cookie Skillet - once again, delicious goodness that satisfied our cravings

I'd definitely recommend Trademark for its cool atmosphere, delicious drinks, wide selection of apps, and the cookie skillet. The entrees, however, were good but forgettable. A big thank you to Stephen for your hospitality.
review.author: Claire W.

review.description:
We stopped here for a Saturday brunch while visiting the city around 11:30. The restaurant was full, but not jam packed. We had a table of 6 with a reservation and were quickly seated from the friendly hostess. Our waitress was nice and responsive and didn't rush our group at all. 

For drinks I ordered the gin and tonic and it was strong, but not overpowering. Two others at the table got drinks and commented that they were good, not amazing, but good nonetheless. 

We ordered the bakery basket and avocado toast for the table. The bakery basket came with savory and sweet scones, banana bread, and a cinnamon roll. I'm not a banana bread fan so I don't think it's fair for me to grade that. The scones on the other hand were moist, fluffy and yummy. I had the cheddar and scallion ones and really enjoyed it. As for the avocado toast, it came with pickled shrimp and perfect spices. I almost regretted not getting that as my entree as it was so good. 

For my entree, I got the brunch burger and it was the perfect amount of greasy and the egg on top was perfectly runny, but well cooked white. 

Steven, the manager, came by the table to say hello and make sure everything was good. Nice place for brunch. We enjoyed ourselves.
review.author: Shawna M.

review.description:
Got the recommendation for this restaurant from the Refinery Hotel. I like that it has a speakeasy feel to it. 

The menu is super diverse. We had a vegan with and a girl who is gluten intolerant in our group and they had no problem ordering. 

From the items we ordered, the ones that were AMAZING included the cauliflower steak and the grilled cheese. I also ordered Kale and quinoa salad and that was pretty good, too! 

The music was good, you can tell it's a very nice upscale spot. One thing to note -- it was weird how far the bathrooms were!! Cool restaurant in a part of town with not too much else around!
review.author: Christina G.

review.description: Feels strangely like a takeout cafe when you walk in, but there is a cool restaurant in the back and the food and drinks were fantastic. I can wholeheartedly recommend the bacon burger. Desserts are also great. Looking forward to going back and happy to have found this place.
review.author: Tony C.

review.description: Nice place to brunch in. The meal was delicious. Nothing was too greasy or overly seasoned. The mood was calm and not as crowded.
review.author: Christine K.

review.description:
Came here and went straight for the grinding, since I didn't really have enough time for the tasting.  They actually have a little cafe area in the lobby area away from the main restaurant.

It was interesting to see, because it was the only place where they actually used a mini scale to measure the amount of coffee.  Honestly couldn't tell if that really made a difference on the taste of the final product though.

Overall, good espresso, but nothing that I would crave on a regular basis.
review.author: Alex Y.

review.description:
When you walk in, you will pass through a cute little coffee shop. Don't worry, you are in the right place. We were lead to our seats, a nice private booth and I immediately noticed the lovely decor and ambiance. 

For our appetizers, we chose the burrata and knots and the pickled shrimp toast. The knots were a bit too salty for my liking but the shrimp toast made quite an impression on me.

I knew I had to order the fried chicken sandwich since everyone raves about it. The breading on the chicken wasn't that crispy but was rather a bit mushy. This is probably due to the cole slaw on top of it. I was also surprised to find that the sopressata was cut into very minuscule pieces and mixed into the cole slaw. You can barely taste it or even realize that there are any there. The only part worth mentioning is the spicy honey inside the sandwich. It went very well with the chicken.

I also tried their 8 Oz hanger steak with herb butter. This dish was a bit small and also quite salty as well. However, the steak was very juicy inside. 

If you need to use the restroom at any point, just a warning that it is quite a maze and a trek to get down there. You might get lost finding it like I did.
review.author: Connie T.

review.description:
A friend and I dined in here today. Had the business lunch and ordered the chicken sandwich. Very good... interesting take on it. 

Staff were very accommodating
Food was great. 
From entrance to exit, atmosphere, decor and lighting was on point!
review.author: Kyongil L.

review.description:
I've seen Trademark pop up a few times when I was looking for lunch / dinner options around me, but it never really made me want to try it out until I was going to go get brunch with my roommate and she noted that she wanted some place with eggs. It's actually a pretty cute spot that felt very rustic and ornate. It looked similar to a couple other bar / lounges in the area but it definitely felt more like a cozy and trendy restaurant than a place where you grab beers with co-workers after work. 

I ordered the chicken sandwich which came with fries. I was pleasantly surprised by how large the chicken piece was and the bun was toasted and absorbed some of the oils from the chicken. The chicken itself was very tender and perfectly crispy. It was a winning combination with the cole slaw as well. The fries were soft and nicely fried, and I feel like they were using Huntington ketchup as well so you had that extra texture and flavor from the sauce.

Overall, I was pretty happy with my meal and on a late Sunday, it was fairly empty so you're seated right away and have your food served up quickly.
review.author: Jen L.

review.description:
Trademark has been on my "to eat" place for quite some time now so I was excited to try brunch here last Sunday for the launch of their Bloody Mary bar...I don't like Bloody Mary cocktails AT ALL, but their juiced up kale/lemon juice and cayenne pepper blend actually had me singing a different tune...you're also allowed to choose your own alcohol base from vodka, tequila, bacon bourbon and smoked gin...as much as I was craving gin, I went for the bacon bourbon cuz mama ain't raise no fool :). 

I then added things like a slab of bacon, mini cheese burger sliders on skewers, chorizo and cheese skewers, a blood orange slice and other things that would make my cocktail look good on the Internet and contain things that I would later enjoy nibbling on. 

Brunch wise I enjoyed the following:
+. Bananas Foster French Toast - brown sugar caramel, vanilla sauce and sea salt (full disclosure: I hate most banana things so I knocked the banana slices off!), 

+. Salmon lox latkes with rosemary (these were beyond delicious. SO delicious!)

+. Fresh fruits acaii & granola smoothie bowl (it looked really pretty...lol).

+. Crispy Mortadella Sandwich (egg & cheese, black pepper mayo) - HOLY COW THIS WAS THE BRUNCH MVP. The mortadella was phenomenal and I would slather that black pepper mayo on everything. Everything.

________________________________________________________

Service, ambience, cocktails, coffee and food - everything here was behind superb. Perfect brunch spot and I can't wait to come back!
review.author: Stephanie P.

review.description:
Had an awesome meal here. Started with the Hola From The Other Side which was delicious (and who could resist that name?), then my friend and I shared:

+ burrata and knots
+ tuna poke
+ TM burger
+ fried chicken sandwich
+ warm chocolate chip cookies and milk
+ the big banana 

Burrata was decent but the best part were the knots - they served them in a skillet and they were easily the best I've ever had. I could have eaten them all night. The poke was perfect, especially the homemade crackers they were served with. Loved both sandwiches and the fries were great, though on the salty side. Cookies were awesome. I'm not a pudding person, but my friend thought it was incredible. Delicious food overall and super friendly staff!
review.author: Gab G.

review.description:
This is a cool place, with a cool vibe.

I ordered a lamb sandwich, that came with an au ju.  It was dry, and lacked flavor.  I would not reorder.

Our server was inattentive, and spent most of his time talking to the bartender.

We did see a manager during our visit, but he could have been served better training his servers to be attentive.
review.author: Eric W.

review.description:
It's been pointed out to me that as a creature of habit, I tend to order the same things regardless of the restaurant, and the most prominent of those dishes is GRANOLA. Holy hell, I can eat granola for every meal. Yes, yes, I know it's actually not healthy at all and contains quite a load of sugar but I think I've ordered it at enough places to know what amazing granola is. 

(Shhh, I know I can make it myself for less than $10. It's my version of avocado toast or scrambled eggs or French toast or any number of items that appear on menus that can also be made quite easily in your own kitchen. I just love how it tastes. Plus, it's one of the few things that won't make me feel sluggish and slightly resentful at the end of the meal.)

And Trademark's is by far THE BEST granola I've ever had. Would it be too much to ask what goes into it? I counted walnuts, sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, at least three kinds of dried fruit. I'm normally a very generous person but I begrudgingly handed over a spoonful for my friend to taste. Her fried chicken sandwich ended up being the perfect size (the pictures made it look colossal but it's actually quite reasonable in person). 

I did think the small version of the tuna poke appetizer was ... quite small for $16. I'm sure they use high grade tuna and all but the ratio of fish to everything else was off. Suffice to say eating the poke was like dropping pebbles into a well of hunger. I dove into my granola. 

At the end of the meal, no less than three people stopped by to ask how everything was. "Good," I said, lazily patting my belly in a way that would horrified my mother, "Very, very good."

I'll definitely be back to try the famous cookies and the famous Brooklyn coffee from Trademark Grind.
review.author: Joy G.

review.description:
A group of friends and I decided to come here after Penelope was booked. We had a group of 6 and making the reservations was not a problem on a Sunday morning!

When we got there, the decor was very interesting! Not only was the service very attentive throughout the entire time, but the food was amazing! I wish I took photos but the food looked too good for a photo shoot! 

We left feeling very satisfied and glad we found a new brunch spot!
review.author: Belle L.

review.description: Really nice restaurant ... we were very impressed with the creative pallet of the chef and diversity of menu... Warm Olives were deep fried olive 'poppers' with a crust like a hushpuppy. Yogurt sauce was fresh balance. Smashed Beets were fresh and the Naan was toasted to virtual chip. The marquee of the meal.... Fried Chicken sandwich. Served with Fresh Sweet Bun... toasted. The slaw was sweet crunchy with a soprassetta and then a hot fried crusted chicken patty hot and juicy. Just awesome.
review.author: rod m.

review.description:
Super impressed by their level of service! 
They just opened, taking the place of another Indian restaurant. I ordered from the previous one several times. They were decent. However THIS place is trying hard! I went in for pickup and the man was going above and beyond to be helpful and fast. It says it takes a while for delivery but it's right down the street so I wanted to test how long they would take. They were delivered in probably 15 minutes. 
And it's very good Indian food! The spices are complex and the meat isn't too dry. The chicken tikka masala (the basic item I get when gauging one Indian restaurant to another)'s chicken was a hair dry but it didn't matter. I'm just impressed by their service! They gave us free dessert and those thin cracked sheets!

Pretty great! Thank you!
review.author: Julia M.

review.description:
Ordered chicken tandori lunch special for delivery which came with vegetable, naan and rice. 

The chicken tandori was surprisingly flavorful and juicy.  Not dry at all. Very pleased. Came with 2 pieces. Didn't look like much but filled me up.  It came with a side of cauliflower and potato which was yummy too.

The naan and the rice could have been better. The naan wasn't crispy but since it was delivery, I will overlook this and try again in person.  The rice was a little wet and soggy. I think the sauce from the other dishes spilled over. I will also give them the benefit of the doubt since the other items more than made up for it. 

I ordered a mango lassi that was thick creamy sweet mango deliciousness. I am hooked and I want more. 

I received papadum and rice pudding as well which I don't believe came with my order but were both greatly appreciated. The papadum was crispy and was great with the sauces especially the green one. The rice pudding was delectable with a hint of cinnamin.  

Overall, I really loved the chicken tandori, mango lassi, and rice pudding.  I am excited to try other items on the menu.
review.author: Chrystina C.

review.description:
My friend and I were were in the neighborhood having a few beers and both decided we were pretty hungry. We noticed Mughlai Indian Cuisine across the street. Now, I've just very recently started to discover how much I love Indian food. The flavor is like no other and I love spicy food so this was a match in heaven.

From the moment we entered until we paid the bill and left, it was top notch. You immediately feel the family aspect of the restaurant. The seating is open and encourages a family style experience. We were seated close to a family who looked like they were visiting and started conversation. They had nothing but amazing things to say about Mughlai since they entered entered for their meal.

My friend and I were immediately greeted by who turned out to be the restaurants owner. He was so humble and friendly. My friend and I decided to split a chicken samosa. The owner was helpful with suggesting what sauces would work best with the samosa and we both took his advise. The flavor of the samosas are an instant pleasure to the palate.  The chicken was also very tender!

Being that I'm still fairly new to Indian food, I decided to order something I was comfortable with and have had before. I ordered the chicken tiki masala and my friend and I split a basket of garlic naan bread. The food came out within a reasonable amount of time and according to my friend who frequents Indian restaurants - the meal was also served in its traditional form as far as the presentation. 

The meal was spectacular. The chicken was perfectly tenderized and the sauce was a mixture of different flavor and spices that I really enjoyed. I'm happy to say I finished the whole thing. The portions were just right. The garlic naan was the right combination of soft and crispy. You could definitely taste the fresh garlic. 

I highly recommend that anyone who enjoys Indian cuisine go and check out Mughlai if you're ever in the area. You'll be welcomed in with a smile and end in good conversation with the owner. It was a pleasure.
review.author: Kris O.

review.description: Excellent place. I love their shush kabab. Service is superb. The owner is an extremely friendly guy. Very hands on. Ask for his recommendation.
review.author: Ibrahim M.

review.description: One of the most phenomenal meals that I've ever had in NY in my six years of living here. The service was just as amazing as the food they brought out. I'm stuffed but have continued to eat because I don't want the flavor to ever go away. You could order a plate of dirt and they would find a way to turn it into magic. With that said, this place is incredibly clean. The symphony of spices was something not to be ignored. You don't have to love Indian food to appreciate the skill and flavor that this restaurant has executed. Everything from Bhel Poori to the garlic naan and goat curry, every dish blew us away. My husband and I came from midtown based on reviews and they did not disappoint. We are looking forward to making this our date spot as the price is right, the ambience is relaxing and the food and service are above and beyond incredible. You would be a fool to pass this by.
review.author: Sheena H.

review.description: This place is great! We asked the owner, Khabeer, what was good and he brought out three incredible entrees. The real star of the show was NAN. Crispy, soft, and delicious. The service was great and the beer was cold. I'll definitely be coming back.
review.author: Brett G.

review.description: Seriously I live around the corner and this food is soooooooooo good!!!! The naan yum!!! The servings wow!!! Presentation and ambiance wonderful... also the mint chutney. Ahh...
review.author: Dereje L.

review.description: Excellent customer service and food. The owner is a lovely guy and cares about his customers. Also a  nice ambience inside the restaurant. Bonus: complementary warm rice pudding for dessert! (Could've been a one-time thing, but so nice.) Will definitely come back.
review.author: Georgia H.

review.description: Really great Indian food with good service. The owner used to work at my favorite uptown Indian restaurant, but my boyfriend and I both preferred the food here. I'd recommend the vegetarian Tikka Masala, which I had never seen on a menu before, and the Poori. Looking forward to going back soon!
review.author: Ruth A.

review.description: Amazing Indian food! The best in LES! Love the all appetizer, very fresh and mouth watering! This is becoming our spot for delivery and eat in.  Staff is super nice.  Must try!
review.author: Neetu K.

review.description: Went to Mughlai for lunch today. Extensive manual. Don't know how to order so we told the manager chicken, shrimp & veg one each. What a surprise food was delicious and with good presentation. Not too much spice either. Bill was reasonable. Highly recommended.
review.author: Hong M.

review.description: Solid spot.  Have only ordered delivery but all of the food was great and a great value for the price. Will be my new go to spot for Indian delivery.
review.author: Aaly H.

review.description: When the boy mentioned this place for the fifth time this week, I figured we'd better make it Friday date night. I was not disappointed. Food was high quality, tasty and, exactly on price point (entrees 11-20) to make you feel ok about having a couple beers on the bill. The thing that really stood out was the service - I think it's the owners who are helping out with serving, but they add a personal touch with recommendations and make an effort to find out what you like. We're 'far' by ny standards (a while 5 subway stops away), but will definitely be back!!
review.author: Ria H.

review.description: Great service and amazing food! Seriously the most amazing palak paneer I've ever had. Eat here!
review.author: Gabrielle V.

review.description: This place is beyond heaven, never in my life have I been bombarded with wave after wave of delicious colours scents and tantalizing taste. Despite being stuffed to capacity I'm still craving the food. The mango lassi has the perfect blend and dare I even say a hint of rose water. The sofiyani biryani was the most authentic dish I ever tasted I thought I was in Mumbai the moment I entered the humble abode. I cannot wait to visit again
review.author: Chantal L.

review.description: Came here for lunch today. The hyderabadi chicken curry was juicy and I had a flavorful meal overall. The service here is attentive too!
review.author: Crage L.

review.description: Hands down the best Indian cuisine in NYC. I had the tandoori lamb chops and they were juicy.
review.author: Khalid K.

review.description: Very very solid Indian restaurant in the LES! Great food and attentive service all at a very attractive price point. Will definitely be back soon!
review.author: Mike T.

review.description: Food was great and the service was wonderful. We split 4 dishes with 6 people and still couldn't finish everything.  Try the chef's specials for something especially delicious.
review.author: Mary H.

review.description: New Indian restaurant in LES. Incredible service... I ordered for pickup and the owner was very friendly while I waited. The food was excellent and fairly priced. I'll be coming back.
review.author: Rishi A.

review.description:
I've been here numerous times for brunch and I figured it deserves a review. To start off, the resturant is on the smaller side so brunch on the weekends usually mean a 10-15 minute wait (which isn't terrible for the delicious food that you will eat). All the servers are extremely nice and attentive which definitely adds to the meal.

Now to the food; the avocado toast is...amazing. the avocado is tastes fresh and the seasoning on it with little bacon bits is perfection. My only complaint is that the toast is sometimes toasted for too long because it's rock hard so I tend to break it into smaller pieces before biting into it. My friend got the eggs benedict and the eggs were poached beautifully. I judge brunch places by their eggs benedict and I must say, this place does an excellent job!

I would come to this place every weekend if I could however, the street parking around is sometimes difficult but that's not anything the restaurant can control.
review.author: Ruby L.

review.description:
We had a delightful meal at Côté Soleil and felt so at home here -- this is a lovely family establishment and the proprietors treat everyone with such warmth. I really felt like we were being treated to a meal in a friend's cottage in Provence.

The food is classically French and well-executed; there are lots of classic French culinary school dishes on the menu, and portions are generous. I noticed vegetarians and children eating here, and the clientele was pretty diverse: a nice reflection of the neighborhood, and there's something for everyone here. It's the kind of place where I'd gladly take out of town guests or parents, though it is rather on the small side.

We tried the escargots, pâté, coq au vin, and salmon -- and got an extra basket of bread so sop up all the amazing sauces. Everything was super, and I especially enjoyed our appetizers. The herb butter surrounding each little snail was packed with so much flavor and I probably clogged up my arteries sponging all the leftover butter with the slices of baguette we had. The pâté, which I believe is homemade, had a nice spice profile and bits of pistachio, very country-style. The entrees were warm, comforting, and well-sauced, and everything was plated unfussily but appealingly.

Most importantly, the staff was unfailingly gracious, kind, and attentive -- you can tell that they really care about this restaurant and have invested in this neighborhood. I'd love to come back for brunch!
review.author: Natasha G.

review.description:
I love love love French food. I heard about the opening a few months back and decided to take a friend here and I have to admit, I was really impressed with the place. It is such a neighborhood gem, I could really see myself coming here once a week and they also have a really kick ass Sun-Thurs deal for an app and entree for $19.10, there are 4 options for apps and 4 options for dinner. The one thing, the restaurant is on the small side and the tables are kinda mushed together, and not that it matters but having a French waitress was a nice touch. Fun fact, the name means sunny side in French.

The food:

Le Pâté Maison- Homemade country pate served with gherkins, mustard and bread. This was super homey and comforting, the texture wasn't as smooth as I would expect a pate to be but the flavor was great and I loved the bits of the pistachio. I felt this had more of a consistency of like a sausage pattie, but still a great starter. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=4n9_csOzgwtQlHdEhtYVPA&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

La Soupe à L'oignon Gratinée- French onion soup gratinée. I thought the French onion soup was really good, I loved how it was not too salty since I typically find it to be overly salty. I loved the chewy stringy cheese, it had a really nice consistency but I did wish the broth was a bit more pronounced, the broth could have been a little more beefy. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=gLiWxGVPhRy3i6NlEx1Iiw&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

La Terrine de Foie Gras- Home made duck foie gras with toasted bread and jam. I am a big foie guy and I really enjoyed the terrine. The flavor of the foie was very pronounced and I enjoyed the creamy texture and the crunch from the bread, the only thing I wasn't crazy about was the jam which I think was apricot. It was too aggressive and overwhelmed the flavor of the foie instead of complement it. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=IX-iiQWy6Ck7X7znv9hXpQ&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

Les Escargots au Beurre Persillé- 6 Snails with garlic butter. I really liked the pronounced garlic flavor in the oil and you should dip the table side bread into the oil, but the snails themselves were just OK, not too much going on but that oil was excellent. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=Wj19CxXrS7Yl6p78zm3G7Q&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

Le Cabillaud au Champagne et Pommes de Terre Nouvelles- Pan seared codfish w/ Champagne sauce and roasted fingerling potatoes. This is their best entree, the cod was so perfectly cooked, it was so nice and flaky but that champange sauce was excellent! The sauce tied everything together perfectly. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=UxDudTgwZrp6Gjk35olPZQ&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

Le Saumon à L'oseille et ses épinards- Filet of salmon served with rice, spinach and sorrel sauce. I thought this dish packed so much flavor. I really enjoyed the salmon, the spinach and the sorrel sauce, everything made sense together. I did find the salmon to be more cooked than I would have preferred but the dish is one to order. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=z5dS_pIeKnTQa0f7qlEYug&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

Le Coq Au Vin- Chicken braised in red wine with mushrooms, pearl onions, carrots and potatoes. This screams Winter to me, the Coq Au Vin was so rich and comforting. The flavor was great, I really loved the depth of the sauce and the root vegetables from the pearl onions to the carrots to the potatoes. I thought the chicken was nice and tender but it was a bit overcooked and a tad dry for me. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=myYeXMnMPpjhsU_rHP5YdA&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

Le Boeuf Bourguignon- Slowly braised beef in red wine sauce with mushrooms and bacon, served with mashed potatoes. The beef was so tender and the texture was great, I did wish there was a tad more fat in the beef to give it a little more silkiness. The mash was such a great pairing, it really worked well together but sadly the mash ran out before the beef did, wish there was more mash. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=m6-E4fPu1QM2qbJP8NYBWA&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

La Bavette à L'échalote- Flap steak served with potatoes and salad w/ green peppercorn sauce. This was my first time having flap steak and it was just OK to me, it was kinda like a chewier version of skirt steak. The green pepper sauce had nice flavor but had such a weird look to it, it looked like liquid cheese that tightened up. The one thing I did love were the fries, the fries were excellent, they had a nice potato flavor with a really nice crunch. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=7nTFFe25S_erwUzoxiJYfg&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

La Crème Brulée- The Crème Brulée was good, the layer of sugar on on top had great texture, the custard was so nice and velvety, this is a must get. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=XOcmlFAI2DCfU9LHnuUxtA&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA
review.author: Ben L.

review.description: What a lovely addition to the neighborhood! The brunch is great and reasonably priced. Truly one of the best quiches I've ever had, and I feel so lucky to have it just a few blocks away. The service is very polite and wonderful. Definitely look forward to trying dinner, and I hope they start doing lunch too!
review.author: Jen K.

review.description: Delicious! Service was great and friendly, food was good and really tasted authentic. Nathalie, our waitress, was the best ever! We will be back to try more items on the menu.
review.author: Johanne M.

review.description:
My neighbors Jimmy & Carol are big fans of Côté Soleil they invited me to go there with them.  I was traveling and once I returned from France we went for Sunday brunch. The place was buzzing with people. We ordered mimosas, coffees and placed our order. I had Croque Madame and my friend Crêpe we were chatting and catching up but it took awhile to be served. The food was well prepared and tasty. We ordered creme brûlée for dessert and got complimentary glasses of mimosas which was a nice gesture. I would definitely come back for dinner to try it out. I'm happy we have good neighborhood restaurant to enjoy French cuisine. ***Update****
Last night I went for dinner! Oh and it was good!
I picked dishes from their specials menu. French onion soup & Le coq au vin with glass of wine. French onion soup was delicious however I want to focus on Le coq au vin. I lived in France for two years and love French cuisine. Le coq au vin at Côté  Soleil taste as a homemade it brought memories from the days I spent with my friend Jacqueline in her home. This is the place if you haven't tried Le coq au vin to come and enjoy it! It is rear for me to compliment kitchen but last night I told the waitress that this is exceptional Le coq au vin! Get your shoes on and go to Côté Soleil for dinner. Don't forget to order a wine & Crème brûlée for dessert! Cheerio!
review.author: Meline V.

review.description:
We came across this delightful place walking around the neighborhood. Decor is quaint and nice. A bit cramped but such a nice experience. Everyone that works there are French. We decided to eat here during Sunday  brunch. 

I had the grilled cheese with ham (and egg on top). I liked the dish alot but the toast was a bit too crunchy. The amount of cheese was perfect. Egg was a bit overcooked. Next  time I'll ask for it to be more runny. 

My son had  the burger. He seemed to like it. I liked the French fries that came with it. 

And my husband had a crepe. It was good but it would have been better if there was some sort of gravy on top. 

All in all, the atmosphere, the music, the service and the food, made a delightful experience. 

And you can't beat the price. Extremely reasonable.
review.author: Angelina E.

review.description:
Good food, enjoyed in a nice (French) ambience. Impressed with the service. Loved having the French news on TV and pictures of Paris spread around the restaurant. Only weak point for me on this first experience was the wine.

Definitely worth another visit.
review.author: David H.

review.description: Very fine bistro fare in Sunnyside, Queens. The service amiable. One of those out of the way jewels one might find in Montmartre perhaps. The cordon Bleu was elevated with delicate mashed potatoes and string beans that desperately wanted to be haricots verts. The creme brûlée was ample and well caramelized. The coq au vin and beef Bourguignon were applauded as well. A great place for family gatherings but on the cozy side.
review.author: Molly G.

review.description:
New French restaurant in town and I got to say that I am very pleased. The atmosphere is very cozy, the owner and staff was very friendly and the food was delicious. 
So we got Eggs Benedict, French Toast with Nutella and The Baguez. 
Eggs Benedict came with fries and salad. The fries were lightly seasoned and so tasteful. One you cut into the egg yoke and ham then dip your fries inside, what a wonderful taste. The salad was even good with a little bit of dressing. 

Next was the French Toast. I got to say I never really  had French french toast until today. It was very fluffy inside and a crispy on the outside soo good. And the strawberries and Nutella made it complete. 

Last but not least The Baguez. This is lamb sausage, fries and harissa mayo in Bagguette. It was really good and filling. It had a hint of spice and everything was well put together. 

I will definitely be coming back. Only con was a little bit of a wait for the food but understanding since they just opened. The wait was worth it!!!!
review.author: Ivelisse M.

review.description:
Run ... don't walk.  Brunch was fantastic.  Can't wait to try dinner!  Trying to post pix!

Dinner is amazing, can't wait to return for the others I want to eat!
review.author: Michele C.

review.description: Went there with my dad and husband and dinner was nice.  I had the salmon dad had the cod hubby had the beef.  Its a nice atmosphere.  Will go back again soon.  Soup of the day was nice
review.author: Lauren B.

review.description: I absolutely loveeeeeee this place! One of my favorites to be honest. I have been here both brunch and dinner and I have to yet be disappointed. The first time I came here was for brunch and the food was delicious! The service is good.The only down side is that it's a very small facility. The second time I came here was for dinner and oh boy! My boyfriend had the hanger steak which was absolutely delicious and tasty.I had the most delicious and cheesy truffle pizza. I absolutely love the atmosphere for dinner.Its very romantic.
review.author: Paola C.

review.description:
Came here for brunch. Just a few tweaks would make this place great. The avocado toast was basically mashed avocado on bread with little bits of bacon. For the price I expected a little more. 

The biggest issue was the service. It was slow and they don't do free refills on coffee. I don't mind slow service for quality food - but at least refill my coffee cup as I wait. 

Crepe was fantastic. As was the croque madam
review.author: Fuzz R.

review.description: Great time, great food and amazing atmosphere! Definitely my new favorite spot in sunnyside
review.author: Maxime M.

review.description: This is a nice cozy little place. The staff is super friendly and nice. Everything on the menu had a authentic French flair. I had steak and mashed potatoes (comes with salad as well) and my friend had the truffle pizza. The truffle pizza is really good, however kind of on the heavy side. You can really taste the cheese. My friend said it was the best pizza she ever had. My steak was alright, it comes with the shallot sauce, which is a red wine sauce, and on the sweeter side.  I personally don't like that red wine taste, but it wasn't bad.
review.author: Farhana R.

review.description:
I rarely write reviews, but everything was so amazing that I feel I must! This cozy Queens spot was just the thing I needed to end the weekend. I went in for dinner on Sunday night and was blown away.

The Foie Gras was the best I've had in a long time, and the Coq au Vin was flavorful and tender. Everything tasted so fresh! 

The service here is outstanding. Our waiter was so kind, patient, and helpful. The owner, VIncent, helped out quite a bit on the floor, we loved him too! I love seeing owners stepping into service to lend a hand. It says so much about the business. 

All in all, it was a delicious meal with a great staff. Will be back again very soon.
review.author: Dani P.

review.description:
This place is deelish I had the croque madame which was cheesy w/ a nice crunch and a Salad loved it

But Their Truffle Fries tops it all very very good

For Desert Their Caramel Crepe was sweet and salty yummm 

Service is very attentive, they care about your experience 
Atmosphere was nice and comfortable they played French music on the background, lol makes you want to learn it

Will be coming back
review.author: Elleny R.

review.description:
Came here for dinner on a Tuesday night, the place was consistently busy and full, but the noise level was never overwhelming. Phenomenal food (tabbouleh, beef bourgignon, burger and chocolate mousse) with good service and beyond reasonable prices.

I am reluctant to even tell you Yelpers about this place--so I can keep it to myself and not worry about more folks taking up spots--but it is too good not to share the wealth and support this excellent local business in Sunnyside/Woodside!
review.author: Emily G.

review.description:
Really like the food here, a great addition to our brunch options in the area. We are looking forward to returning for dinner after having brunch here twice. 
The one star we took away was for our second visit, both service and food was slightly inconsistent where as our first visit was perfect. Both times we ordered one of the sweet crepes for dessert, the first time it was made by the owner himself and the crepe was just as how I remembered having in Paris, paper thin and crispy. The second time the owner was not there and though still tasted good was a little thicker and more soft so it left us slightly disappointed after craving it.
review.author: Eva X.

review.description:
Great food, stellar service and amazing ambience- we've been coming here for a few years now and absolutely love their falafel- it's hands down the best you'll ever have. Also the vegetable couscous as well as the salmon dishes are great! 

Can't go wrong with having brunch or dinner here!
review.author: Barblin M.

review.description:
Discovered this cute Moroccan and Mediterranean restaurant while around the area in Williamsburg.

We had ordered the mixed platter, which contained hummus and salad along with pita bread for dipping. The pita bread was fresh out of the oven and still hot when served. It was really good! We also ordered the lamb and chicken as well, which was a pretty large dish so I would highly recommend sharing it.
review.author: Jessica K.

review.description:
This place is worth the wait!!

That being said, make an reservation if you can because it's packed! My husband and I went on a Thursday night and had to wait almost an hour to get seated. 

The food itself was amazing - highly recommend the dip sampler (it feeds 3-4 and comes with the most amazing pita), any grilled meats, and their specialty the Bastille which was basically a giant flaky pastry filled with chicken seasoned with delicious herbs.

We will definitely be coming back with friends!
review.author: Wendy T.

review.description:
This is my bf's favorite restaurant and i cant agree more with him on that. there is always a wait so we try to go there as late as we can so we dont have to. Even at 930-10, there is still a short wait. They have a bar but its usually packed as well. We dont mind the wait though, the food is really exceptional and we dont go often. Its not our typical casual dinner spot, we prob come here once every 2-3 months or special occasions. This is a great spot for a date =)

 

Their menu isnt that big, but everything is so good. They have daily specials that change seasonally. We usually get their mixed platter as an app, that hummus is like amazing. If you dont like hummus, you will after having it cafe mogador. You need to try their tangines (they are known for their tangines). My favorite is the Casablanca. 

 

I dont find their food heavy or greasy by any means, its just so flavorful that you want to keep eating until you burst. Their portions are huge either, its just the right portion.You want to leave satisfied with your meal and not fall into a food coma afterwards.
review.author: Jessica L.

review.description:
Cafe Magador is by far the best meal and waitstaff I experienced during our spring break Brooklyn/NYC vacation! My husband actually found this gem online and I am so grateful (even though he knows picking restaurants is my bailiwick). 

Located in the hipster Brooklyn neighborhood that is Williamsburg, this place opened in 1983 and has a following. We got a table for 3 quickly at 10 am for Saturday brunch. Good thing too because shortly after the line with all the beautiful, young people (with money my poor 20something son added) trailed out the door. 

Before I get to the food, let me just say this place had ambience, complete with mosaic tiles in the bathroom. Mirrors, china and a lovely bar as the centerpiece. I seem to recall a patio in back too but could be mistaken. The staff was by far some the most young professionals in service I have encountered. They were friendly and respectful even though it was clear we were not part of the beautiful set nor did we have cute Williamsburg babies in tow. 

So, the food. I will let the pictures speak for themselves but the sides of home fries were crispy and fresh. We each had an egg dish. I loved mine which included a semi-spicy tomato Moroccan sauce. Other sides which make this place unique include hummus, pita bread, tabouli, and Arabic salad. I also splurged on a cup of the rich Turkish coffee - highly recommended! Be sure to swirl the grounds when you are done. I don't know how to read them but it's pretty. 

Definitely add this to your eating list if you get across the bridge to Brooklyn. Great shopping and parks too.
review.author: Courtney S.

review.description:
This is a great multifaceted gem good for having a date or meeting up with friends for a good meal and drinks before a night out in the trendy parts of Brooklyn. 

The menu is well designed to initiate the casual diner into the world of Moroccan cuisine and goes to pains to contextualize the different dishes by listing out the individual ingredients as well as having the servers be well versed in describing each different dish and making suggestions.

The interior is cozy and inviting with exposed brick, creating a very francophone atmosphere. Their wine selection is well thought-out and offers several reasonably priced options. This is definitely a place where you'll want to share a bottle or two of wine with your friends!

On our most recent visit they had a special duck which was delicious. I can't wait to return to try the chicken tagine, a signature Morrocan dish.
review.author: Austin O.

review.description: I came here for breakfast back in April and my friends and I loved our meal. I had never had Moroccan breakfast before and I'm so glad I tried this restaurant because the food was amazing! I got a sampler, which included poached eggs, tabouleh, hummus, a small cucumber/tomato salad, and pita. Everything was prepared perfectly and it was just delicious. We got a pot of mint tea with it and it paired perfectly. I would definitely come back here again!
review.author: Kevin B.

review.description:
My wife and I spend our honeymoon in Morocco and wanted to find a Moroccan place to eat at for our anniversary this year. Cafe Mogador was well recommended by our friends and we were not disappointed. The interior is an adorable cafe setting with a full bar as well, not unlike those which are so common in Morocco proper. There are only a few large tables and the seating is pretty tight in the main area so if you're uncomfortable being close to others or have a large group you may want to call ahead to see what is available. There is also a lovely garden area in the back where you can sit and eat but it was closed for renovations when we visited.

As far as our first-hand experience with Moroccan cuisine goes, this spot certainly delivered on flavor and diversity. The menu was filled with authentic Moroccan delicacies and everything we ordered was great. My wife had the chicken tagine, I had the sausages with roasted vegetables, and we both shared the hummus appetizer and Moroccan sweet tea. Our only small disappointment was that the tagine was not actually served in a tagine (as it would have been in Morocco. If you are unfamiliar, a Tagine is a Teepee-shaped cooking pot typically made of clay which a dinner is baked in. The top is removed for serving. Regardless, this was a small detail and the food inside was quite enjoyable.

Service was attentive and friendly. All-around we had a great time and would return. Be advised that if you come here and there is a wait, the only real standing room is outside.
review.author: Jordan B.

review.description:
Elena, our hostess wasn't welcoming. We came in here on a busy Saturday and she saw us come in and didn't greet us. I had to go up to her and ask her to get on the wait list. She told us it would take an hour for our party of 3, which we were fine with. Then 15 minutes later, a party of four came in she told them it would only take 20 minutes. It was questionable of why it was only 20 minutes for them but an hour for us...We waited for 40 minutes and then saw the party of four that came in after us get seated. I asked Elena how much longer is the wait now. She said your whole party is here? I said yes, we were always here, you checked us in. She then said give me 10 minutes and seated us shortly. I didn't like how I had to approach her both times to get seats, once when we came in and the second time because its been an hour and other people that came in after us were seated. 

Besides the long unwelcoming wait with our hostess, the food was good. It made up for everything, kind of. For appetizers, we ordered the eggplant hummus was really really good with the warm pita bread. As for myself, I ordered the middle eastern eggs that came with more hummus, tabouli and an arabic salad. Their tabouli and arabic salad was just as good as their hummus. Man everything on that dish was delicious!   I devoured everything on this plate and then some. I ordered a side of home fries and bacon... can't go wrong with either. My girlfriend ordered the eggs benedict with canadian bacon and she said it was super delicious. I have to try that one next time. 

Oh! Their OJ is freshly squeezed.. be sure to get that!
review.author: Madison L.

review.description:
Love the place and love the food! The greenhouse dining room is absolutely charming! Service is above and beyond!
Worth any wait ... anytime!
review.author: Patricia W.

review.description:
Amazing space, amazing service, and amazing food on Wythe in Williamsburg. While taxi cabs stream by you in the area on a given evening, make sure to make a stop here for an amazing meal and experience. I can't wait to come back for a brunch during the daytime on a wonderfully boozy brunch day.

It started with some Moroccan tea that tastes of mint, mint, and more mint. Then add the mixed platter and amazing lentil soup of the day that really was enough to nibble on during amazing conversation with my gf. The bread accompanying the platter was fresh, crisp, and oh so filling. 

Then came the finale and the amazing lamb tagine with a charmoulla sauce (spicy cilantro) next to traditional cous cous. 

Wow, what amazing clean, healthy food and a packed restaurant filled to the brim even for a weekday evening. Check it out and be glad you did.

Cheers!
review.author: Joseph L.

review.description:
This place is so charming, cozy and cute! I walked into a warm and dimly lit restaurant that was in full swing. The brisk cold air outside was instantly gone as I walked in. Since they don't take reservations on Friday and Saturday nights I just put the hostess on notice that I had a party of 4. It was around 7:30 and she gave me an estimate of 50 mins. The actual wait was more like 40 minutes so we were happy about that.

We shared the following Appetizers : Greek salad, hummus and babaganoush with bread that reminded me of naan bread. The bread and hummus was really nice and fresh and together were my favorite appetizers. The Greek salad was a little less enticing. Although Greek salad is my favorite I didn't like that the feta cheese was not broken down and there were less tomatoes than usual but there was something else missing from the flavor but the side salad made up for it.

Entree : My ladies had the chicken grill and mixed grill. These dishes came with a side salad. I had a smaller appetite and had the garlic shrimp appetizer with a side salad and extra olives. My side salad was much better than the Greek salad. The greens were nicely chopped and the olives were a nice compliment.

For my beverage I had the Mango Martini which was solid! For round two I had a glass of Pino Noir. 

For dessert we shared the Almond Cake which is gluten free for the birthday girl!

Last but not least I need to talk about the customer service. Cafe Mogador gets five stars for their attentive nature. My water glass was always filled. The dirty plates were methodically removed from our table. The waitress made sure we had enough time to choose our dishes and worked with me on how to coordinate the suprise. To top it off,  is as the crowd winded down, they didnt try to rush us out and made us enjoy each other's company and the sultry ambiance.
review.author: Sheri S.

review.description:
Friends and I initially wanted to go to House of Small Wonders for brunch, but the wait was ridiculous, so we stumbled here instead - thank god we did, because this place is just as wonderful...

The seating in the back reminds me of an Egyptian movie with magic carpets, exotic dishes, lush plants & cushions, and a beautiful stream of light to add to it all. I wasn't able to sit here because of peak brunch hours, but next time I will be back and eating in that spot :).

As for the food, it was flavorful and extremely filling. It was my first time drinking Turkish coffee and I highly recommend it for its novelty and flavor. It is sweet, strong, and a taste you won't be able to find easily. The hummus here is 10/10, and although a lot of dishes here are very appealing, you won't go wrong with any dish that includes hummus in it (get the Middle Eastern eggs!!). I ordered the Halumi Eggs and got a hefty chunk of cheese - certainly good for cheese lovers like me! 

Thinking that what I ordered wasn't enough, and because I am a meat lover, I ordered the sausage which is good to share between 2. It wasn't necessary and out of this world, so one entree should be more than enough! Staff here were extremely accommodating and friendly, and did not make me feel like a total Middle Eastern nub since it was my first time trying this cuisine. They helped my party of 6 move over to a bigger table just as it was about to get busy.
review.author: Carmen W.

review.description:
A pretty fantastic brunch spot in Williamsburg with a middle eastern twist.

I came here with four friends on a Saturday afternoon for brunch. We were seated within 30 minutes which is not bad at all for a party my size compared to other brunch spots in NYC. 

The decor at this place is on point. Seating is roomy and spacious, good for mid-sized groups. There's a green house/garden area at the back of the restaurant with lots of sunlight. It creates a warm and energetic vibe even on a cold winter day. 

The menu features a selection of breakfast items, and prix fixe brunch items that include a main dish, orange juice, and a choice of cappuccino, espresso or tea. I got the Middle Eastern Eggs with poached eggs, which came with hummus, tabouli, arabic salad and zahatar pita. Everything on my plate was delicious. The zahatar pita tasted pretty authentic. It reminded me of the food I had when I was in Jordan years ago. The hummus was flavorful and creamy.  The tabouli and arabic salad were fresh and tangy, a great balance of flavors to the humus and pita. 

My friends got the Blackstone Eggs, Moroccan Eggs, and Chicken Grill and they all loved it. No complaints!

Overall, the food was delicious and the service was great! I highly recommend this place for a brunch date with friends.
review.author: Jacqueline C.

review.description: Food and service are generally decent. Wait times can be pretty long during evenings and weekends.
review.author: Kori L.

review.description:
We were famished by the time we were seated, so the appetizers disappeared almost as soon as they appeared - falafel and labne served with warm pita and a spicy chutney. My entree, the Lamb Tagine.. gosh, sooo good! It was a huge portion of meat, falling off the bone, perfectly seasoned! The sauce was a tad sweet at first bite but went really well with the buttery couscous.. Polished it all off! Others in the group had pancakes, Mediterranean eggs and Bloody Marys.. all good! We were then joined by more friends and moved to the garden lounge area in the back - couches under a nice green house sort of canopy, some gooey chocolate cake, cocktails and a hot chocolate... decadent! 
Service was pleasant and efficient throughout and the decor was pretty.. so all in all, 5 stars if I ignore the wait for a table!
review.author: Preeti P.

review.description: Will definitely be returning to try their other menu items. I had the salmon entree that came with couscous. The salmon was juicy and the salmon skin was as crunchy as a chip. It was one of those super satisfying meals where you don't feel like you ate junky food. It was good wholesome cooking. The couscous was pretty plain, i would opt for their vegetable couscous next time as that was more flavorful. The service was not bad but I did feel rushed to finish my meal since I arrived much later than the rest of my party. It was a friday night so I understand their urgency but even with that minor hiccup, I still had a wonderful experience and food was delicious!
review.author: Cheuk Yin H.

review.description:
We had a fantastic meal here, albeit we waited over an hour for a table. Usually I won't wait for a table, but seeing we're on vacation and trying to catch up with a bunch of friends, it didn't matter.

There were 6 in our party and we managed to order a lot of food. The appetizers were delicious -- definitely order the labne, babaghanoush, hummus, roasted eggplant.

Entrees are also really good. There is something for everyone. We especially loved the braised lamb shank and the Moroccan fish tagine. Ask for the hot sauce (it was more like a paste) if you like spicy food. It was so good our table polished off 6 little plates of it.

The service was pretty good even though the restaurant was packed.
review.author: Anita L.

review.description:
This review is more of a 4.5 stars instead of 4 star.

I was expecting a longer wait for a table, but we were seated in about 10 minutes. Loved the atmosphere here, and even though it looks nicer in the back, there's no wrong seat in the house.

We started with the garlic shrimp and they were awesome. We also had the fried corn cake which I couldn't get enough of. 

I was really looking forward to eating the hangar steak, but unfortunately, they were out of it, so I was very disappointed. In the end, I ended up ordering the Salmon which had a ton of great flavor (and I'm not even a fish eater!). It was served with a carrot puree and lemon yogurt. I would definitely recommend that dish.

For dessert, I had the chocolate cake with raspberry sauce and vanilla ice-cream, and it was delicious!

I'm not in Williamsburg too often, but I will definitely keep this place in mind next time I'm in the area.
review.author: Rashid M.

review.description:
This restaurant by far is a gem, it has great ambience with a really cool garden to sit in the back. When we came here we sat in the back garden. The food is amazing, really fresh and tasty Mediterranean food! We didn't have reservations and were lucky to grab a table immediately. I would though call next time because they get really busy. When we left they had an hour wait! 

The staff is super nice and help picked out some of our dinner.

We ordered a bunch of great food. For apps
2 dips: hummus, babbaganouh with fresh hot flat bread it was so yummy. The dips were fresh flavored authentic I wish there was a bigger portion. the bread was addicting! 

We also ordered falafel it was fried crispy goodness moist in the middle and perfect with the tahini. 

We also order a special a Halloumi app with grilled bread an fennel pollen it was good but not what we expected but def delicious

For entree 

We had the lamb with chickpeas and rice. What a great dish. The meat fell off the bone and the sauce was rich and delicious. I couldn't stop eating it. The portion was good for two. Not knowing how big the lamb was we also ordered another entree.

Duck confit with salad and French fries. I love duck and this was so amazing. It was done right! Again, the meat was falling off the bone and seasoned perfectly. The salad was a bit over seasoned but a minor detail to this wonderful dish. I would have loved another veg instead of fries with this. But they were exacuted perfectly. 
 
Overall this restaurant is elegant from the ambience to the food. The staff again is nice, accommodating and not overly on top of you. I would def check this place out. Btw parking is a tad difficult!(255)
review.author: Kim G.

review.description:
I ABSOLUTELY ADORE THIS PLACE! I saw the birthday celebration thingy on some yelp reviews and decided to come here for my friend's birthday. I don't take they take reservations but we were there pretty early so we were able to get seats. I walked in and quietly told the waiter it was my friend's birthday and he was like okay okay and gave me a few winks. 

We ordered the shrimp in garlic sauce, the stuffed beef, and the oxtail stew. Each dish comes with 2 sides so we got plantains and rice for the most part. Everything was delicious. My personal favorite was the beef. It was fried and was basically layers of beef, cheese, and ham. I usually am not a fan of ham but it tasted really good together. We also ordered a mango juice which was soooo good.

For dessert we got tres leche cake and these little donut things I can't remember the name of. I can't have milk but my friends really enjoyed the tres leches cakes. As they were bringing out the cake with a candle, a disco ball came down and a super loud birthday song came on. The waiter did a little dance/performance that was so much fun and we were all cracking up. The entire restaurant was clapping along and saying happy birthday. It was a really nice and friendly atmosphere. 

My favorite thing about this restaurant though is easily the service. While everything was delicious, the service was just the absolute best. The waiter was so nice and so friendly to us. He had us try to order in spanish which was so cute. I just love this place and I would highly recommend especially if you're celebrating a birthday. It makes for great snaps and videos!
review.author: Jamie L.

review.description:
Good service, good food for sure.

I came with my wife and son for dinner and we were very pleased with our experience here. For appetizers, we had their ham croquettes and plantain chips along with the flattened bread they serve you. The ham croquettes in my opinion was maybe the worse croquettes ever. They were shaped like a breakfast sausage link and tasted ZERO ham. I even had to ask the waiter if this was the ham croquettes and even he acknowledged there was ham in there. Perhaps they blended it or something because there was no hints of ham in that croquette whatsoever. And the way it was deep fried, the batch of oil they used must have no been changed all day or they overcooked it. The plantain chips however were nice. Light golden color and crispy. The flattened bread was unique. I kinda wish it was toasted a little bit longer just it would be a bit toastier and easier for the butter to melt.

For our main course, we kept it simple. We ordered the paella once we sat down because it takes up to an hour to cook. It well worth the wait. I've had my fair share of paella in my life and this would easily rank somewhere in my top 3. It's $51.99 to start with, so that kinda threw me off guard because according to their website menu, it's listed at $41.99. So expect $10 dollars more. They should consider updating their website and menu prices. But the paella, it was unbelievably good. It had seafood, chorizo, and chicken. They weren't stingy with the ingredients either. There was plenty of scallops, lobster, and shrimps. It was served nice and hot, straight out of the pot. It was so good and so hard to believe that this was suppose to be a serving size for two. My son loved it!

We enjoyed the evening with sangria and I tried a bottle of their Cuban style ale. The bottle of ale was $7. I asked for something from Cuba, but its produced in USA. I was hoping for a actual Cuban cerveza. The sangria was delightful and refreshing. As far as the service goes, I think it could be better. We went on a weekday, it was really empty compared to the weekends here. Much of staff were chatting in the back or at the bar. We felt a little ignored at times. They didn't serve us the flattened bread until one of the main waiters or host noticed it roughly 15-20 minutes after we sat down. But all of the waiters were friendly. 

I would certainly love to come back for the paella. The biggest downside to dining at Rincon Criollo, they only accept American Express! For me, that's just a huge blow. Master/Visa is pretty much standard everywhere else and this spot is acting like the old Costco with their AMEX only policy. I mean even Costco now is accepting Master, Visa. For reward purposes, I really dislike the fact that they don't accept any other card except for AMEX. So either be prepared to bring cash or use their ATM.
review.author: Gary L.

review.description:
The smoked pork chop at Rincon Criollo is one of the best pork chops I've ever had.  Most places will overcook and serve you dry pork chops.  This place makes their pork chop perfectly.  This is the only dish I order every time I come here.  My friends loved the ox tail, but for me, the smoked pork chop is their signature dish.

It is a small place and it does get crowded.  But the staff and service is fantastic.  I only come here once in a while but they always seem to remember me.  I love their birthday celebrations here, they turn on the birthday music, the lights go on and the waiters come dancing :)
review.author: Kevin L.

review.description:
We came here on a Friday night around 8PM.
Ambiance - great music. The tables are pretty close and the place is pretty small.

The servers were very friendly and if you never had or are new to Cuban food they will explain in detail (which we really didn't need.)  We had the maduros, pollo asado, moro rice, rice and beans, ropa vieja. The Pollo Asado and Ropa Vieja were both in the salty end. The Ropa Veija was cooked to perfection and melted in your mouth, it was just too salty. We also had the tres leches and I was not really impressed. For $5 for a slice, I could barely even split it with my friend.  We also ordered "sangria." Do NOT get sangria here. The server went behind the bar got a slice of orange and cherry garnish and put it in the bottom of the glass and poured wine on top. That is not sangria my friend.

In sum, whoever cooked on Friday night was very heavy handed on the adobo. The portions were on the smaller side for the prices we paid approx. $16 for ropa vieja. I was not impressed and I honestly do not think it was worth it for the price we paid.

**Also, they only accept AMEX  but there is a Bank of America across the street, a Chase bank down the block or you can pay a fee and use the ATM machine in the restaurant.
review.author: Romi J.

review.description:
BEST TRES LECHE CAKE / CAKE in the world! 

Read no further, just come and order a whole cake and that's all you need. But if you need to eat, you can eat their delicious food as well.

I came here for a dinner after hearing about this place for so long and it was too long overdue. I should've came years ago, I had the oxtail and my lady had the ropa viejo(shredded beef). We ordered the tostones, maduras, rice&beans, and the famous yucca. Everything tasted darn near perfect, although I did expect bigger portions cause I was able to finish everything.... Regardless my oxtail was fall off the bone tender and flavorful. Also I love fried plaintains and they do it right here, not greasy at all with the perfect amount of crunch. 

But back to the main point, TRES LECHE CAKE. This is the only restaurant in my whole life I ordered extra cake to take home. 

*The flan was pretty bomb too!
review.author: John T.

review.description:
Absolutely love this Cuban restaurant. Have been here several times and every time I want to try something different. Everything on the menu is delicious.  My favorites are the breaded chicken, breaded palomilla steak, oxtail, ropa vieja, paella..   etc.  You get 2 sides with your entree and it's a must for me to get the rice & beans! Also love the sweet plantains and tostones.  

For dessert, get the flan and/or leches cake! So delicious.
review.author: Monica W.

review.description:
Such a small, cozy place which reminds me of coming home to visit relatives. When you come here, you're treated like family right when you step foot. 
I've been here several times and the food doesnt disappointed. Coming from somewhat critical Cuban in-laws (which I hope they dont see this..haha) they swear by this place. It reminds them of home which is why they keep coming back here. 
The menu is very authentic and contains a lot of amazing dishes. That cuban rice and that yucca frita!  Geez..Im getting hungry thinking about my meal here over the weekend. 

This area is very congested and there's so many food choices here but this is a definite must try!
review.author: Jessica R.

review.description: Excellent Cuban restaurant with a great menu and service. The portions were huge! I had to take everything as a takeout as I was unable to finish it. I had Beef Liver (phenomenal!), Oxtails (finger-licking good!), Natilla/Cuban Custard (not too crazy about it). Definitely go for Oxtails. You won't regret it. The meat melted in my mouth and was full of flavor. See photos below.
review.author: Dmitriy S.

review.description: The food was so delicious, and the Cuban sandwiches are also very good. It tasted like authentic Cuban food full of flavors. We ordered the breaded flounder and the oxtail. I had been trying to get my husband to come eat here to years but he hadn't, doubting how good it was. Once he began eating he was amazed, and said it was beyond good. He is a picky eater so this was definitely a home run.
review.author: Liliana C.

review.description: This place never fails to satisfy my Cuban food cravings. Food and service are always top notch!
review.author: Augie A.

review.description:
"Where the hell did they take me?" I thought about my girlfriends as I squeezed into my seat.  Tightly crammed tables fill this restaurant where English is hardly spoken and only American Express is accepted (besides cash).  A hole in the wall indeed.  But WHAT a treat!  Admittedly, my fluently speaking Spanish friends ordered for me.  But don't let that intimidate you.  The waitstaff is friendly and informed, and make you feel just like the food does - at home.  

Ropa vieja, tostones, sweet plantains, rice and beans, stuffed yuca, shrimp scampi, rolled chicken stuffed with cheese and ham - all cooked perfectly, priced perfectly, and portioned perfectly for sharing and experimenting.  Flan and cappuccino for dessert.  And ohhhhh the sangria!  White or red - take your pick!

Go here not just for lunch, but for a feeling of a country!
review.author: Renee L.

review.description:
The vibe at Rincon is completely
Contagious, lively with plenty of laughs to go around. This is the type of atmosphere you can only get at a family run neighborhood staple. Oh and the food is kind of amazing, all of it. 

Rincon Criollo can best be described like a mozzarella filled meatball: Straight forward and completely unassuming on the outside, soul satisfying surprise on the inside. Ironically, this analogy also can be used to describe the rolled steak(some things cannot be described, just order this!) 

If this is your first time eating Cuban, you're about to become a convert...
review.author: Donald S.

review.description:
You will not be disappointed. If you don't mind the parking issue, or don't mind taking the train, this place is a great little gem.

The restaurant is kind of small but very cozy. It's a good place to come with friends and family. If it's your birthday, it's even better. I came here with my BF for dinner and we were able to experience how they celebrate birthdays (it was another customer's birthday). They turn the lights off, there is a disco ball on, lots of joy and singing and all the other customers are clapping as well! 

The food here is also really good. I had to ropa vieja. The entrees come with 2 sides. So I ordered the rice and beans, and the boiled yuca in garlic sauce. Although the yuca was a bit dry, the sauce made it tasty. The rice and beans, you can never go wrong with rice and beans. The ropa vieja was tender and full of flavor. The dish looks small but it was enough to fill me and my bf's stomach
My boyfriend ordered the oxtail and he enjoyed it! He said it was very tender and falls right off the bone. He ordered tostones and Maduras as his sides. The tostones were one of the best I've had. The maduras was sweet and tasted like a dessert.
For dessert, we had tres leches cake and flan. My bf isn't a fan of flan but he really enjoyed it here! I love flan and this really was THAT good. Their tres leches cake mmmmm you cannot miss out. Their desserts were so good, we ended up ordering another order of the desserts separately!

To top it off, the servers here are all polite and nice.
review.author: Gloria K.

review.description:
While on vacation in New York, we stopped by this place and wasn't disappointed. The food portion was a lot! The wait staff were very friendly. Got there around noon and was seated promptly. A few min later the place filled up quick!
I ordered the breaded pork steak with rice and beans and fried plantain. When I received my food, I was overwhelmed lol. Taste and favor was on point and shockingly was able to finish the whole plate. Will have to try the desserts next time. 
Will definitely come back when I visit New York again.
review.author: Fred Q.

review.description:
Can I get a *whoopwhoop* for this place? 
What a cozy and inviting restaurant. Came here a few months ago for a small birthday celebration and truly enjoyed it. 
As other reviews mentioned, the wait is looong if you come anytime between 6-8:30pm. We came on a Friday night at 6:45 and waited about 45 min to be seated. This speaks to how popular this place is.
