Service is very friendly and go out of their way to accommodate. Also as we discovered, this is a popular place to come celebrate your birthday. Throughout the evening the severs performed a birthday song for just about every table in the restaurant. 

Straight to ordering: 
- Chorizo Espanol ($6.95): good way to start a meal for a male birthday. With meat. 
- Picadillo ($11.95): chopped meat w/onions and peppers. This was probably my favorite meat entree that we tried. Those grilled onions just added an extra oomph. 
- Ropa Vieja ($15.95): shredded beef in tomato sauce, thought this was a bit salty but flavor was good and beef was tender. 
- Rabo Encendido ($15.95): oxtail served in a stew-like sauce. Tender chunks of meat. This was delish too. 
- Bistec Enrollado ($15.95): rolled steak aka. steak cooked in a roll. This was ok.

Two sides came with each entree, we ended up with a combination of: 
- Moros y Cristianos: rice and beans--omg...I have never had such addicting rice and beans in my life! I never even knew rice and beans could be addicting! Perhaps there were bits of pork fat cooked with it...whatever it was, I couldn't stop eating  them. 
- Plantanos Maduro Frito: fried sweet plaintains, oldie but a goodie, tho generally pretty heavy and you can't eat too many of them.
- Plantano Verde Frito: fried green plaintains, also good.
- Yuca con Mojo: cassava stewed with garlic sauce (butter)....yumm again. 
- Papas Fritas: French fries, not worth ordering here. 

I must pause here to mention the generous serving sizes of the entree and side dishes. You will not be left hungry. 

To top it off, somehow we managed to eat a a flan and the bunuelos Rincon Criollo (donuts soaked in syrup) between the four of us. Would recommend the flan, it had a good home-made consistency. 

Mmmm...rice and beans. I would come back for another plate of these any day (after a week-long workout). Not to mention to try some additional entrees. And certainly you can't beat these prices.
review.author: Susan C.

review.description: I was in the area and stopped by this hole in the wall. This place is kinda dated. The outside needs some freshening up. Its in a very busy area right next to the train. Its very hard to find parking. I found a parking across the street after circling the block a couple of times, but i needed to feed the meter and it was only a 2 hour parking. The outside sign is very dated and dingy looking. This place needs a face lift. Its a little old. The floor tiles look old and i saw some tiles broken. It just needs a little TLC. When I walked in, I was immediately greeted and seated.  Overall It has a cozy vibe, and there's light music playing in the background. Its sexy. Pictures everywhere. Lights are dim. Its great for couples. They sat me down right away. I ordered the ropa vieja, maduros (sweet plantains), white rice and black beans. I also ordered cuban beer. Everything was delicious and came out right away. I loved the ropa vieja which is shredded beef and had an amazing aroma and tasted amazing. The maduros were perfect, just a little crispy in the outside and soft in the middle which I love!! The waiter was attentive, but not in my face which I appreciated. The food was fantastic and I would definitely return when I'm in the area.
review.author: Rosemary S.

review.description: The best Cuban restaurant in all NYC. Amazing food! Been going here since I was a kid and I'm now 43 yrs old. Quality of food has never changed. Restaurant staff is wonderful and attentive and pleased to serve there customers. Must try the Ricon Omelette. What am I sayn try everything it's amazing. Can't say enough about this Restaurant food fantastic. I travel all the way from the Bronx to eat here. Viva Cuba!
review.author: Joseph R.

review.description: A destination truly worthy of grabbing an uber if your flight is delayed (my reason) as it is 5 minutes from La Nastia airport--don't fall for any of the airport food concessions! On walking in I was greeted by the warmth of Cuba in the form of music, aroma, and a hustling-to-serve waitstaff who dropped a fresh ice water, bread, and butter before my coat went on my seat back. This review is short as my plane is taxing and I hope the pics are helpful.
review.author: Chris P.

review.description: I guarantee you'll love the El JEFFe combo (arroz con pollo, oxtails, and sweet plantains). If you're a real boss tres leches cake for dessert. You're welcome!
review.author: Jeff O.

review.description:
Yum! My coworker told me that there is a scarcity of good Cuban food in Queens. She's from Florida, so she knows. So we met a co worker and her hubby here to try good Cuban food, for a weekend lunch.

We ordered 2 apps, and 4 entrees (includes 8 sides- 2 sides per entrée), to share family-style. We devoured thinly sliced chorizos, Cuban tamal, ropa vieja (shredded beef in tomato sauce), oxtails, roast pork, and liver with peppers. We wolfed down black beans, fried sweet plantains, fried potatoes, yuca with garlic sauce and fried plantains. After all that, we still had leftovers. K had a refreshingly cold passion fruit drink. 

My favorites: 
If you love garlic, you have to get the yucca with garlic sauce. Soft, starchy cassava boiled to a soft sweet-potato-consistency with this sweet savory garlic sauce. So good! I've never had yucca like that before! 

The shredded beef with tomato sauce was so good! Tender fall-apart-under-your-fork juicy beef in a sweet homemade red sauce. Yum! Everyone loved this dish.

The oxtails was wonderful! Stewed soft cartilaginous oxtail in an tomato-spiced stew. I wish I had ordered two of these. 

The roasted pork looked dry but wasn't. It was tender and the pork juices in the sauce was excellent! Drool worthy savory pork sauce. My co worker loved the sauce more than the meat.

Verdict: Definitely coming back to try more dishes! Everyone loved the food. I want to eat that beautiful breaded steak! And more oxtail please! 

Transport: This lovely Cuban restaurant in Corona, Queens is easily accessible via the 7 train or by car.
review.author: Doreen L.

review.description:
The decor at Thai Villa, is impressive, from
The Buddha water fall at the entrance to the  hanging golden leaves in the dining area. The lighting creates a wonderful, intimate atmosphere. 

We were seated immediately upon arrival although, they asked if we had a reservation and we replied that we did not, they still found a table for us. The staff is very kind, and attentive. 

Upon being seated our server brought the huge menus over and throughly explain what are the recommended dishes, the traditional dishes, and the Thai imported spiced specialty dishes. 

After we placed our order, another server came to hand deliver complementary appetizers. Photo will be included. I believe he said it was a chocolate bean curd, over pineapple. I honestly can not recall the exact description as to what else was in it but it was yummy. 

I ordered the curry Puffs as an appetizer, the chicken pineapple fried rice & a Thai iced tea. My husband ordered the chicken pad Thai and a soft drink. 

Everything was great from the service, to the food, to the beautiful decor, even the restrooms are very nice but most importantly well stocked and clean. 

Great place for a date, or a small group dinner. Prices are moderate, food portions are plentiful. 

I say check it out for yourself,  I think you will enjoy!
review.author: Millie R.

review.description:
Craving Thai food and in the mood to check out LES, we visited on a Wednesday evening early summer. We showed up around 9pm and were seated after a 25 minute wait. The wait went by quickly as the waitresses offered us drinks and allowed us to sit in the lobby area while enjoying the lively crowd. The decor at Thai Village is interesting but well-done, and makes for a unique experience. It indeed feels like dinner at a nice indoor villa with proper lighting and background music. 

For food, my gf and I shared the steamed dumplings and wings for appetizer - both were delicious but the wings really stood out with a uniquely familiar flavor. We then ordered the Thai basil and green curry for main dishes. We were warned that both dishes would be spicy but found them to be moderately peppery and completely bearable. 

Overall, a delicious and reasonable priced Thai dinner in a nice setting that's appropriate for a date or simple dinner.
review.author: Jameel A.

review.description:
Very beautiful and unique interior! Came here with a group of 8 and waited over an hour for a table Wednesday night without reservations. They squeezed 8 of us at a 6 person round table upstairs to accommodate our large group. 

The menu is very extensive, with traditional thai cuisines, and dishes with a unique twist. We shared a variety of appetizers including marinated chicken wrapped with pandan leaves - (Gai Hor Bai Tong), shrimp and rice noodles (Ray Rai Nah Phu). Everyone seemed to enjoy their main dishes. I ordered the Royal Pad Thai ($18) - a specialty dish, and the presentation was definitely impressive. The Pad Thai was delicately wrapped in a net of an egg and it looked amazing - definitely a unique twist to the traditional dish. 

Restaurant is good for groups of 6 or less.
review.author: Syyu C.

review.description:
First off, the decor is amazing. I felt like I was sitting in a royal Thai Palace! Needless to say, they went ham on the decoration and it is absolutely beautiful. It's  a great place for you to bring a date! 

I've heard many good things about this place and I have been itching to try it out for months!! Overall the food is pretty good and each plate is decorated and presented beautifully; the chefs here really take the time to make these dishes look "instagrammable" LOL. The menu is so extensive! It literally has so many options you can choose from; I felt a little dizzy just looking at my options. Tip: if you cannot handle spices ask your waitress or waiter house by see the dish will be because I have heard from other people that some of these dishes are really spicy. 

As for the overall service experience, I thought the staff was really helpful. My hostess knew the menu inside and out and was glad to point out to me which dishes may be too spicy for me to handle. I have to say that service was a little slow, it took us forever to receive our food and I got really anxious at one point because people who came in after us got their food before we did. Anyway, onward to the dishes:

1) Lychee Thai Tea ($4)- It was delicious! Not too overly sweet. It also looked fancy as hell but I think $4 is a little bit overpriced. I would order it again anyways because I honestly was in love with it 

2) Kao Tang Na Tung appetizer ($12)-  Least favorite dish of the day. It sounds really fancy on the menu but I didn't think it was that good. Definitely would not pay $12 to eat this again. Basically it had mince shrimps, minced crab meat, minced pork, shallot, coconut milk and lemon grass; all of the above ingredients were basically puree into a paste which they put on a rice cracker. It looked good but it tasted okay. I couldn't discern what the heck was in the paste at all. 

3) papaya Salad ($9)- Love how they used fresh papaya! Each bite was so crunchy! It also came with pork rinds which is one of my guilty pleasures. Also it was not too spicy, which I really appreciated. The downside to this was that it was way way too salty/sour, which I attributed to WAY TOO MUCH chili lime dressing. It would have been better if they didn't drown the salad in the sauce. They also used a lot of fish sauce in the dressing so it made it super salty; I was gulping down water with each bite. 

4) Royal Pad Thai ($18)- This was what I had came for! I saw all the positive reviews about this dish and how fancy it looks; my verdict is that it tastes just as good as it looks. The presentation was so beautiful! The pad thai was wrapped around an egg net (so creative right?), there was bean sprouts on the side; it also came with 4 huge prawns, perfectly cooked I might add. It sat on top of a single banana flower petal, which I would suggest you not eating LOL. I enjoyed every single bite of this plate, it was so delicious and definitely tasted a whole lot better than the typical pad thais I was used to eating. 

5) Green Curry - it came with heart of palm, thai eggplant, pineapple, basil leaves, coconut milk and I believe a meat of your choice. I also thought this dish was really good; it was not my main course but that of a friend of mine so I only took a bite or two to sample. I thought the spice level was just right and it tasted fresh and homey! It went beautifully with the jasmine rice. 

SO in conclusion, I would love to come back here, not just for the food but to just enjoy the atmosphere! Thank you Thai Villa for the wonderful experience.
review.author: Fiona D.

review.description: This place has a grand appearance and the service is amazing. My friend and I didn't have a reservation on a Sunday night but got seated within half an hour. The view on the second floor looks amazing and it's definitely a lot colder than the first floor. The curry puffs tasted pretty good, but nothing that special. The Royal Pad Thai looks incredible and taste delicious. The duck dish (forgot what it's called​) tasted alright and was a bit dry. The dessert tasted better as you eat it and it was a good dessert to share. I don't think I could've finished it myself. Overall, the presentation of the food here looks incredible.
review.author: Susan L.

review.description:
Fiancé and I came across this Thai food restaurant tucked away on 19th street. I'd say this restaurant is pretty cool for date night and perhaps enjoying a few drinks on the weekend? The atmosphere is sort of different than the others, which made it quite unique.

We ordered the Larb salad (chicken), Royal Pad Thai and the Garlic chicken. It was all pretty delicious! However, the reason why I took away one star is because every dish was a bit on the salty side in our opinion. You'll definitely need extra rice to wash it down. The difference with the regular pad Thai and the royal is the egg wrapping, as well as the prawns. Is it worth it? Maybe. Are you a big shrimp fan? 

The service was great and fast. The waitress explained the menu thoroughly when she found out it was our first time. We went on Memorial Day and it was definitely popping.
review.author: Jennifer Y.

review.description:
I had this place bookmarked for so long bc of the "date night" decor and ambiance and finally got to visit here with my cousins, friends and bf. I love how the fancy gold details made us feel like royalty, especially when sitting in the canopy booths. Because of our large group, I wanted to call ahead to make reservations but they only do walk in reservations on fridays and saturdays (day we went). I had a friend who was already in the city sit around there an hr ahead while we were in transit from BK. Expect a long wait for big groups.

ORDER
Complimentary appetizer: something with beef? Kinda had a sweet taste to it which I liked. Not sure bc place was loud and packed, so couldn't hear the waiter. My cousins couldn't try it out bc they're vegetarian.
Red curry tofu: super delicious with lots of flavor without putting my tongue on fire. Really filling.
Pad kee mao: cousins ordered the veggie option, while bf ordered the chicken option. Chicken was super tender. Plating was a bit off putting, but don't be fooled by the portion bc it fills you up.
Krapaw gai sub: friend ordered this and loved it, saying that it reminded her of burmese food. Fried egg was an added bonus as well.
Kaeng chapoo phu: crab entree on the special dinner menu. Friend wanted to splurge a bit to celebrate. It was tasty, but not worth the price.

Overall, this place is awesome for the food, ambience, and service. Special dinner menu is a bit pricey, but the entrees are super affordable. My cousins and boyfriend enjoyed some drinks as well. Our waiter was attentive and checked in on us throughout the night refilling our drinks as needed. I'd love to come back for lunch one day.
review.author: Nicole T.

review.description:
Highly recommend Thai Villa- took a friend and he begged to go again the next day.

First, the space is absolutely gorgeous. From the waiting area in the front, the main dining area and the restrooms, everything was well thought of and executed perfectly. 

The menu has something for everyone. During lunch, there is a great lunch special that will give you an appetizer, entre and choice of soup or salad. I have not been disappointed with any choices I have made so far. 

Service is amazing. Staff are friendly and attentive. Food comes out quickly as well. Perfect for a lunch meeting.
review.author: Monica F.

review.description:
My friend has been dying to come here after seeing the beautiful decor....I have to admit.. the decor did really bring me back to Thailand with all the bright lights bouncing off the gold like in Thailand with its gajillion temples. However, I wasn't too hyped to try this place because I could've just gone to the elmhurst/woodside area for cheap authentic Thai food. But what the heck, I felt bougie that day after finishing my finals. We went there for lunch on a weekday and the place was pretty packed when we went but luckily got a table immediately. 

The food was more like a 3/5 stars, but with the fancy decor and attentive service (the servers all wore traditional Thai clothing!) I bumped it to a 4. 

Kha Nom Boung Youen ($19): in the past, I've only really had the street food kha nom Boung which is more like a light, sweet snack. So it was very interesting to try a savory version of kha nom boung. The crepe shell was made of egg and was very crispy. The filling contained a myriad of super fresh seafood (so so good) and you pour on the cucumber relish. For me, the relish was a bit too sweet... like the first few bites I thought the dish was amazing but towards the end I was chugging my water. I guess my advice would be to DRIZZLE on the cucumber relish to your liking. 

Lunch special
Chicken Tom Yum Fried Rice ($13- price varies with choice of meat): the lunch special comes with a choice of soup/salad and listed appetizer. We opted for the salad and chives pancakes. They were both very small portioned and honestly I wish they stuck with just one thing and given more of it. The fried rice itself was pretty good, with Tom yum flavor (lemongrass, galangal, lime...) coming through with each bite.
review.author: Tanya K.

review.description:
My husband and I took our half Thai niece here for her birthday. I loved how this place was decorated, which looked very fancy and royal. We sat at one of the booths, which made me felt that we were in a tent. None of us were alcohol drinkers so we ordered some virgin cocktails. They looked nice but super sweet.

We started with some complimentary appetizers in lollipop shape, which were very fun to eat. Then we had Kao Tang Na Tung (Crab-coconut dipping), spicy chicken wings, Soft Shell Crab Nam Prig Pao, Ped Ron (Crispy Five Spice Duck), and Frog legs Krapraw. The soft shell crab dish was my favorite. It was saucy, crunchy and oily. Frog legs were little bland though.
review.author: Wei V.

review.description:
Thai Villa is absolutely beautiful inside from the entrance to the bathroom. The service is impeccable. I met up with a good friend of mine for dinner around 6 with the after work crowd. Regardless of the many patrons, the waiters and hosts were giving personalized service. The prices are comparable to affordable Thai spots, def worth it. 

First off, we ordered Singha draft beer from Thailand.
To wet our palate, we were given a complimentary Ma hor (minced pork & peanut ball over pineapple) which was rather satiating. 

Then, we given a run down of the special entrees which I believe is a great gimmick used to convince you to buy the more expensive items off the menu. Refusing to be charmed, we ordered an of appetizer steamed vegetable dumplings and calamari. For the entree, the traditional Pad Thai and Hor Mok Talay. 

Steamed Vegetable Dumplings- gorgeous blue exterior w/ sesame seeds yet a bland vegetable filling that required the tasty sauce included.
Calamari- portion size could be increased. Some of the best calamari I've had beside my own. They were fried in a uniquely seasoned batter with a dope dipping sauce too.

Chicken Pad Thai- proportionate ingredients with the right amount of peanuts added. Chicken was subpar. 

Hor Mok Talay- aesthetically pleasing with the coconut shell and robust filling. The interior had a subtle coconut sauce with well seasoned seafood (prawns, Crab meat, etc.) plus perfect jasmine rice to accompany it. 

In the city, hungry for Thai, go check it out. Duhh!
review.author: Zin R.

review.description:
Came here for my friends birthday dinner! The decor is breathtaking! This place has a super expensive vibe to it but they don't really rip you off. 

Everything we ordered was delicious and so esthetically presented. I hope to come back here again.
review.author: Prarthana P.

review.description:
Thai Villa is an incredibly beautiful Thai restaurant in between union square and flatiron areas. I went here for dinner and drinks with a friend after work after passing this place many times.
They only seat complete parties and at 6:30 there was a 20 min wait for 2, with no opportunity to have a drink at the bar while you wait (which I thought was a little odd).
Once seated we noticed the wait staff was very pushy, and trying to turn tables quickly. We ordered drinks and tried to hold the ordering process but they kept pushing for our food orders so that was that.
The drinks were good, I love a good lychee martini with Thai food, but Definitely Manhattan pricey!
They were out of my entree of choice, so I ended up ordering the Royal Pad Thai, and the presentation was seriously beautiful.
The interior of this place is also incredible beautiful, intricate patterned drapes and extravagant gold hanging chandeliers make you feel like you've escaped from NYC for a short minute!
review.author: Sam K.

review.description: Such a beautiful place! My friends and I met here for lunch and ordered from the lunch menu which included an appetizer, soup, salad and entree. We ordered pad thai's and curry. The portions weren't that big (since it's the lunch special menu I guess? And prices were cheap), but enough to fill us.
review.author: Grace R.

review.description:
You can never go wrong with Thai food... especially not at Thai Villa! This is probably the best Thai place I've tried. The dishes are unique and although you can get the same plates at places like Spice and Somtum Der, trust me when I say that Thai Villa is betttter.

No reservations are taken on Friday-Sunday, so be sure to come here early around 6-6:30 because it gets packed very quickly. I love this restaurant's decor and its seats--sadly we didn't get to sit in a booth. So if you want to have a more than comfy dining experience, come in groups :) 

On the house: small sampling of pork + pineapple on a stick. The pork is so good!! 

Drink: the classic Thai iced tea - sweeter than ever and not too creamy.

Appetizer: Ray Rai Nah Phu - You can eat the leaf...hahaha. This is made to be eaten in one bite, and it tastes delicious, although I suggest eating it without the leaf anyway to get a better taste of the meat + curry. The curry is more sweet than it is spicy! 

Entrees: crab fried rice and stuffed seafood crispy egg crepe - I order the same thing at every Thai restaurant: fried rice or Pad Thai. It tastes the same everywhere. Yet I was not disappointed by Thai Villa's crab fried rice; I don't know what it is, but the rice tastes more flavorful. Kudos for the attempt at molding it into a dome. The stuffed seafood crispy egg crepe is even better, although the seafood most likely tastes better than usual wrapped in the egg and dipped in the relish. 4/5 for both dishes! 

Dessert: mango sticky rice - Our waitress told us that this is the best choice on the menu, but to me it's a mere 3/5. I don't like the idea of mixing rice with fruit...hard to get anything down after a few minutes. The blue coloring doesn't make it any more appealing. I don't know what else is good for dessert, but don't get this if you're not into this mix either.

Overall, a positive experience. Really want to come back to try everything else on the menu, especially the appetizers. Good for date night & a casual hangout.
review.author: Amy L.

review.description:
Almost 2 months ago I had my birthday dinner here with my friends. We had to wait about 30 minutes for a table [of 5] to become available. The interior is very beautiful; lots to look at while you wait for a table/your food. Lights disguised as grand bells hang from above in the waiting area. Nice big canopies hang over the booths. There are also pretty chandeliers with gold-colored leaves lined up in the center of the dining area. 

I ordered the Kha Nom Boung Youen (stuffed mixed seafoods with egg crepe). There were a few pieces of shrimp, squid, scallops, mussels, cashews/peanuts, and bean sprouts. It comes with a little ramekin of a slightly sweet, tangy sauce with cucumber cubes and raw red onions. I wished there were more sauce since the dish gets dry without it. 

Of course I also had to get myself a glass of Thai iced tea. It was very refreshing and the tea flavor pulls through more than the milk, which is what I prefer.
review.author: Sharon X.

review.description:
Since two of my friends stopped by Thai Villa and raved about how great the Royal Pad Thai was as well as the décor, of course, I have to check it out, plus I have a guest from out of town, so I thought this was a good chance to bring her to this place and experience the traditional and authentic Thai food. 

Unfortunately, this place doesn't take any reservations, so there was a little wait there. However, in the meantime, you can check out the multiple-sized bells in the front while waited. This place has some serious ornate designs which reflect the royal vibes in some of the palaces in Thailand. 

We got seated in one of the canopies. We started with some cocktails, which some of them were named after the famous islands in Thailand, Goot and Samui. I love the finish touch of coco Lopez on Samui. Unchun was not bad either!

We then proceeded to ordering our appetizers and  main course which most of the privileged dishes were the names that I haven't heard of before, plus I love to take a walk on the wild side, so this was quite a treat for me. 

We ordered Pun Sip, a younger sibling of Curry Puffs; Mah Haw, an amuse-bouche of minced pork and peanuts skewered thru a small piece of pineapple; and Yum Hua Plee, a semi-spicy mixed salad of fried banana blossoms and shrimp. 

I got to have a quick chat with one of the owners and learn about the how the design process was done. I learned that 95% of the décor was designed, custom made and shipped from Thailand, a whole boatload!

Then came our main course which were recommended by our lovely waitress, Jern. She warned us that most of the special dishes tend to be spicy. Well, not for me! Thank god we only ordered 3 entrées; otherwise, I might have just passed out at the restaurant. 

So we got Haw Mok Talay, mixed minced seafood with red curry paste baked in a shell of coconut - talk about presentation here! Next up was Kaeng Cha-plu Poh, a red curry mixed with crabmeat and shredded betel leaves server with deep-fried soft shell crabs and betel leaves -- a must try; and last but not least, Kaeng Runjuan, a spicy beef soup with herbs, culantro and thai green chilis served with greasy rice -- another must try. 

I think we got a dessert to wrap up our dinner. I don't even know what it was since I was too stuffed. 

I was happy to see some good beer selection on the list including Allagash White on draft and Ommegang's Hennepin in the bottle. Snob alert!

My stomach got a little mixed up a bit since I switched back and forth between cocktails and beer.

I will definitely go back again with my coworkers to check out what I was missing!
review.author: Jedsada Y.

review.description:
I was truly excited to try this place out after seeing all the ravishing reviews and high ratings. So off the bat I did have high expectations. 

First of all, if I can only choose one cuisine to eat for the rest of my life it would be Thai food. After trying this place out It was a Total Miss. I'm Super disappointed because I thought it would end my hunt for the best Thai restaurant in the city. 

The royal pad thai, what's so royal about it? It majorly lacked in spices and in flavor! I think the royal family would agree with me...Wasn't too impressed with the egg netting either. I've had this presentation before in other restaurants, which at least gave it a little flavor. This one didn't. 
The panang chicken curry with a request to make it spicy was just mild. I had to use the curry to give the pad thai some flavor.

By this time, I wanted to ask them for a spice rack. Mind you, I don't eat super spicy food. Just enough to tickle my palate.

On the upside I did enjoy the curry puff pastries, which went well with the sweet vinegar cucumber salad type dipping sauce. I also loved my beverage called samui. It brought me back to Thailand's sunny white sand beach & clear water while drinking a piña colada....

On my way out I was happy to see they were wiping down the menus. I think menus are one of the most filthy things to touch right alongside a door handle.

Tip: tables on second floor looked more private try to reserve those tables
review.author: Frances T.

review.description:
We stopped in on a Friday for lunch as a group of like... 20... and did not have a reservation.. and they let us walk right in! 

Strangely they were able to seat us right away and we sat underneath this beautiful gold sculpture thing that was floating in the sky. That was really nice, the entire atmosphere is really beautiful. 

They have a really extensive menu of thai food, I'd ask your server if you're unfamiliar with thai food to help guide you. I ordered this cucumber salad and it was good, I mean, it was cucumber salad. 

The servers were all really nice and helped the mostly confused people in our party figure out what they wanted. I think it's a great option for thai food, most of all, nothing was at all that greasy!
review.author: Molly S.

review.description:
Atmosphere: very elegant. I walked by it on the outside, scaffolding, construction, etc. But, the inside is very nice.
Food: 
curry puffs: crisp outside. tasty center. 
Calamari: sweet dipping sauce and the calamari wasn't too rubbery.
Royal Pad Thai: Great presentation. the egg net was pretty cool.
Mango Sticky Rice: was seasonal. Very tasty. Would have preferred a bit more cream or like an ice cream cold texture. Nonetheless, it was good.

Overall: I enjoyed this place.  There is a bit of a wait time, we ended up sitting at the bar, but enjoyed the meal and ambience.
review.author: Peter J.

review.description:
One of the best American style restaurants in NYC. Great place for dates, girls night outs, to get drinks at the bar. Gramercy Tavern is a no tipping restaurant. 

You like nice restaurants, but are turned off by the bougie-ness, then Gramercy Tavern is for you. Unassuming staff, memorable food, and beautiful interior design with super pretty flowers all around the restaurant. Check, check and check. 

Two areas to dine: tavern and main dining room. Tavern is more casual and has more bar-type food. I heard the burger is great. 

We got a la carte lunch at the main dining room. We were debating between a la carte vs. tasting menu but we opted to get individual dishes because we wanted to try the pork loin dish. 

*Pork loin and deckle: omg this was beyond great. The pork was super tender and flavorful. Usually, pork dishes can be very salty and the meat is firm. But Gramercy executed this dish perfectly. The rhubarb definitely upgrades this dish to the next level. Recommend this. 

*Black bass: pretty good, but our hearts were distracted by the pork loin. Fish was cooked perfectly, I wish the flavor was a bit stronger. A bit bland, but still very tasty. 

If you want to impress your lady friend, make reservations and she will love it, I promise!
review.author: Janet J.

review.description:
Finally tried Gramercy Tavern this weekend and while it was a great experience, it was nowhere near as mind-blowingly amazing as I expected. All around, a very good meal, but nothing to write home about. First off, the dining room ambiance is rather underwhelming. We were unfortunately seated in the back room facing the wall which was a little disappointing. The bar area and bathrooms however, are gorgeous with fresh flowers everywhere. Service and pacing was great. We were able to enjoy a relaxed pace without feeling rushed which I appreciated.

Food - to start, we were served warm biscuits with goat cheese butter. Great way to start the meal. For my starter, I ordered the beef tartar. It was delicious and a hefty portion topped with mini potato chips. For my main, I ordered the chicken. Served with some peas and mushrooms, it was extremely moist and delicious, with good flavor, but unfortunately not anywhere close to the best chicken I've ever had. Which for a Michelin starred restaurant in NYC, equals underwhelming. For dessert, I tried both the "Chocolate" and "Cherry" and both were fantastic. Probably the strongest part of the meal. 

Overall, a great experience but I don't think I'd rush to come back, especially considering the prices.
review.author: Rachel L.

review.description:
This was our first Michelin Star restaurant experience and it was a pretty great one! We were a bit indecisive as to which day we were going to go to Gramercy Tavern so we actually walked in without a reservation. The wait time at the bar was about 30-45 minutes and for a table was about 90 minutes. We opted to wait for a table because of all the rave reviews!

They have their restaurant divided into the Tavern & the Dining room. At the Tavern (bar & some table space), patrons can order from the a la carte menu while there is a full multiple course menu in the Dining room.

We started off with a couple of their Specialty Sodas (Strawberry & Basil / Vanilla & Passionfruit) & were offered some bread. All were enjoyable as we browsed through the menu. Per recommendation from our waiter, we decided on getting two appetizers & two main entrees. Everything was ordered at the beginning and the meal was paced by the kitchen.

The appetizers we got were the Asparagus Salad & Cavetelli with Pesto. The Asparagus Salad was light & fresh, I was surprised by how good it tasted with the tarter sauce. The Cavatelli was as expected; the pesto was tasty & the pasta was cooked very well.

For the entrees, I got the Grilled Shrimp & Carrot Stew and my husband got the Lasagna. The stew had a different kind of flavor & the broth was the most enjoyable part. I didn't realize there was going to be any fish in it along with the shrimp so that was a nice surprise! My husband enjoyed the lasagna and it was pretty flavorful but it was a bit on the heavy side.

Overall, a very pleasant meal & the service was spot on! The kitchen paced the meal well and our server helped us by making good recommendations. We'd definitely suggest checking out Gramercy Tavern for a fancy dinner night out.
review.author: Rashmi G.

review.description:
Owned by Danny Meyer and often considered by various publications to be among the best restaurants in the city, Gramercy Tavern is legendary in the NYC dining world. It's where Tom Colicchio made his name, and although I'm a hair less attracted to him than I am to Padma Lakshmi, I'm a big fan of that Top Chef. The kitchen is now run by Tom's successor, Michael Anthony (remarkable consistency in only having two chefs during a lengthy run in such a transient city and industry). 

I've been hearing about this restaurant my entire life, and combining that with many stars from many critics, I must say I probably came in with almost unreasonably high expectations for my first visit. These expectations were met in various ways, and unfortunately not in others. 

Things That Made Me Believe The Hype:

The squash tortellini with arugula, bone marrow, and crispy gremolata. This was one of the best things I've ever put in my mouth. It was head and shoulders above the rest of the tasting menu (and obviously better than everything on the vegetarian tasting menu that my wife opted for). 

The service. It was relaxed, but impeccable. I'm pretty sure the hordes of fine people scurrying around the dining room in uniform would've brought us anything we asked for. "You want a toe? Hell, I can get you a toe by 3 o'clock this afternoon. WITH nail polish." 

(I also appreciate that this excellent service is included in your meal. It really makes a massive difference when you spring for a meal like this, because 25% of a million dollars is...a lot of money. I'm not good at math.)

The lagniappe. From the perfect bread and goat cheese butter you start with to the coffee and caramel petit fours at the end of the meal, not to mention the chocolate granola bar you are sent on your way with, and the beautiful dessert with a chocolate inscription they sent out for my wife's birthday...this is a restaurant that knows the vast majority of us can only afford to do this on a special occasion. And they treat you accordingly.

Things That Made Me Flavor Flav:*

The marinated sea scallops with blood orange, fennel, and pumpkin seeds. Although it was gorgeous to look at, the scallops were under-seasoned and dare I say it, downright slimy. This was also the first dish of the tasting menu, and such a disappointment. It wasn't the only flaw in the food, but luckily nothing else was as off. That said, it was a sad way to start a meal I had been looking forward to for years. If they were just trying to temper my expectations, it worked. 

Everything else we ate fell much closer to the squash tortellini than the scallops, but the meal overall wasn't quite the perfection I had envisioned. I realize that my expectations were probably unfairly lofty, but that's what prices and a reputation like this get you.

Conclusion:

Please believe me when I tell you that this is still an incredible restaurant. It is impossible to have a bad time here. Between the majority of the food, the service, and the people-watching, you have to hate deliciousness and fun and having your every whim catered to if you walk out of this restaurant in a bad mood. 

But I think I'm going to eat in the Tavern next time, because I can't afford to drop this much money on those scallops.
_____________

*https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9vQaVIoEjOM
review.author: Peter D.

review.description:
Review for the off-menu burger only. Will update when I return for a full meal!

Overall (5 stars): The off-menu burger is a gift bestowed upon us. The meat falls apart in your mouth and the smoky flavor of the cheese and bacon complement the thick patty marvelously. The bun is somehow perfectly studded with sesame seeds throughout and toasted so that the outside is crispy but the bun itself still maintains chewiness. The chipotle aioli adds even more spice and smoky flavor to the burger. 

General: Upon stepping inside of Gramercy Tavern, one can feel that this is a world-renowned establishment. We arrived early before the restaurant opened on a Saturday afternoon, though I feel that we still would've gotten a seat if we arrived a little later. Service here is impeccable, from the time it takes to order drinks, order food, receive food, have all your plates cleared away at once, etc. You really receive top-notch treatment here. 

Food: I'm unsure if this is still true but I heard Gramercy Tavern only produces a limited number of these burgers each day. The restaurant grinds ribeye, filet, and other trims of the cow freshly each day. The wood-fire grill they use to smoke and grill the patty and bacon imparts that amazingly smoky flavor to the burger. The meat itself is so incredibly juicy and melts/falls apart in your mouth. The chipotle aioli and pickled fresno chiles are wonderful toppings to the burger for that extra kick of spice. Everything works together to deliver you one amazing burger experience. I can't wait to come back to the restaurant to try some of the items they have on their regular menu.

Overall summary back up top!
review.author: Andrew C.

review.description:
I don't know what's left to be said about Gramercy Tavern except "wow...omg, and everything in between".  What a magnificent experience in a stunningly beautiful room with intelligent and impeccable service and food that is nothing short of spectacular in every sense of the word. GT seamlessly blends leading edge culinary foresight and innovation in a comfortable and approachable manner. 

Words don't do justice to how beautiful the food is and photos don't do justice to how delicious the food tastes. I encourage you to scroll through some of Yelp the photos to see for yourself. 

Gramercy Tavern in NYC dining at its best, friendly, welcoming and oozing NY style and sophistication.  Can't wait to return.
review.author: Michael B.

review.description: Oldie and still a goodie.  One of the farm to table pioneers that has the formula down pat.  Duck liver mousse with toast is a good start and the clam flat bread is very tasty.  Grilled lamb entree is fine but overall, even though the meal is good but not great, this spot is still worth a visit.
review.author: Ben D.

review.description:
Get the burger. Get the burger. Get the burger. It was honestly delicious. I don't know how I feel about the chips (not much creativity or flavor) so if you can switch it up for something, I would do that. But otherwise the burger is awesome !

The lamb dish was VERY chewy and I wouldn't order it again. 

The sea bass was flavorful and light. So if you are looking for a healthier lighter option, I would go for this. 

Service was impeccable and I would definitely come back for that burger.
review.author: Mariam B.

review.description:
Went to celebrate my bf's birthday on Sunday night and couldn't have asked for a better experience.

We had dinner at the front tavern (a-la-carte) and shared appetizer, two mains and dessert.
- Oysters ($4 each): they have raw and roasted. I recommend you try the roasted, they were delectable
- Grilled Shrimp & Carrot Stew, Cumin, Mint and Sesame Flatbread ($30): deliciousness. The stew was like a cream soup, with hints of ginger. Very well finished flavors and super smooth texture.
- Monkfish, Lobster, Celery Root and Mushrooms ($32): loved it, the sauces on it are light but flavorful. Lobster pieces are small, but I expected given it is not priced as a large lobster dish.
- Caramelized Cheesecake, Tarragon Cookie, Pistachio Halva and Blood Orange Sorbet ($16)

Service was great. Our server explained to us in detail the dishes we were interested in. She also brought a delicious birthday cake after I asked her in secret at the back to bring something with a candle. I knew it was a no-tipping restaurant, so it was a pleasant surprise to be treated so nicely.

Wine selection is really good, organized by type of wine and then region. The somm was also great.
review.author: Daniela G.

review.description:
I am still speechless. Absolutely speechless. This was one of the best meals that I have ever had in my life. Gramercy Tavern is one of the top restaurants in NYC and completely lives up to the hype that surrounds it.

Everything we tried on the menu was delicious. It was a home run. I highly recommend trying the tasting menu so you get a sense of what the chef is made of but visiting GT bar-side is still worth it. Overall, the cocktails may not be the most creative but they are made with quality alcohol that make them worth ordering.

For me, the highlight was dessert. That chocolate pudding was easily the best dessert I've had in my life this far. It's a must if it's an option and you're visiting GT.

The price tag may be high but I've found that GT is able to deliver on if you should pay for it. If you're in NYC, living or visiting, you need to try it at least once.
review.author: Kathryn T.

review.description:
I'm not sure what to say that's already been said multiple times.
1. Service-impeccable - we didn't have reservations at the restaurant portion, just the tavern-but asked if there was a cancellation to fit us in if possible---we got In!! 
2. Service was beyond amazing and the staff was extremely knowledgeable.
3. We tried the tasting menu. Typically my group always adds salt or need hot sauce but we experienced the good without adding any ingredients which tells you the level of sophistication and each dish.

Hands-down one of my favorite experiences in New York
review.author: Nadia N K.

review.description: Four stars because the lamb was not as good as we expected. However, the flatbread was VERY GOOD, must try. Also, the burger was amazing too. The drinks were over priced. Overall, it was good place to dine. Good customer service and food was good.
review.author: Meichelle L.

review.description:
Maybe the most relaxed "fine dining" ever.

As soon as I walked in, the warm & easy vibe was immediate & engulfing.  The bar was particularly inviting; it was almost too bad my table was ready early.  

The prix fixe menu has a few options in each course so that there's little chance of not finding something that appeals to you.  

From the amuse bouche to the complimentary chocolates at the end of the meal, this dinner was delicious & impressive.  The house rolls were hard to resist.  The crab spaghetti was surprisingly unique & light.  Both the black bass & the flounder were artfully prepared, but the flounder was the star.  Moist, flaky, tender, silky...this fish practically melted in my mouth.  Exquisite. 

And then, GT surprisingly succeeded in topping off a perfect meal, w an unforgettable dessert.

Matcha "cheesecake."

They use the term "cheesecake" loosely here.  Just as the waiter explained beforehand, it is more like a mousse.  The lightest, silkiest, & creamiest mousse you've ever had in your life!  The first spoonful stopped my thoughts.  It's a showstopper...visually & gastronomically.

This is one of the best desserts I have ever had.  A highlight of my NYC trip.

I understand why everyone loves it here.

A perfect meal.

5 stars.
review.author: Veronica M.

review.description:
Came here for dinner.  We had to wait 15 minutes even with a reservation.   The dining area is beautifully decorated.  

The menu is simple, for dinner, it has a 3-course menu for about $125.  The dishes change seasonally.  

We had the beef carpaccio and squid ink campanelle (squid ink pasta) as the first course.  The squid ink pasta was very tasty, it had bits of lobster, chorizo mixed in the sauce.  The beef carpaccio went well with the garnishes - peach and arugula leaves.  The appetizers were the best part of the meal. 

For entree, we both ordered the duck breast with sausage, the portion size was very small and honestly, the sausage didn't go well with the duck breast.  The combination was very strange.  The duck tasted okay but the meat was not tender.  I had better duck elsewhere. 

One thing to note, their rolls are very good. They are flaky and buttery, I believe they are called Angel biscuits/rolls. 

For desserts, we had the raspberry and chocolate desserts.  The raspberry dessert is a coconut milk cake, topped with apricot sorbet and raspberry.  The chocolate dessert has milk crisps, lavender and hazelnut brittles.  The ingredients, etc. are listed on the menu which would help the selection process.  

For special occasions, they would present your table with a small cake on the house.  There was a couple sitting next to us, celebrating their wedding anniversary.  They were given glasses of champagne and a cake.  Great personal touches there.  

At the conclusion of your visit, your server would give you some goodies from their bakery to take home, we were given 2 homemade granola bars.  

Overall, I think the food at Gramercy Tavern is average.  Their menu also seems to carry very basic American dishes.  The taste of the food is not very tantalizing.   Their dining room is also very loud.  The restaurant does seem to be very popular as customers kept coming in during my visit.  However, I believe you can get better quality food in NYC with that price.
review.author: Peggie Y.

review.description:
This place lives up to the hype!!!

On Saturday around 2:30pm the four of us were lucky enough to snag a table at the tavern (which only accepts walk ins and is more casual than the formal dining room in the back).

Like all Danny Myer restaurants, service is a key component to dining and you don't tip since hospitality is included in the price.

To start.
---Clam flatbread, celery root & salsa verde ($24)
Shared between the 4 of us this was by far everyone's favorite dish. 6 small slices were plenty to start the meal. The flatbread was super thin with a thick, decadent and creamy sauce. The clams were a nice touch, not fishy or overpowering at all.

Entrees 
---Tavern Burger (I believe $30)
This is actually not on the menu, is exclusively served at the tavern at lunch and if you look around it's a very popular dish. The burger comes with a thick layer of cheese which I believe is cheddar/gruyere mix and on the side: aioli, onion, lettuce and finely slices spicy pepper.

---Brussels sprouts fried rice, Poached farm egg and sunchockes -$29
Was able to try a bite of this as well and it was certainly interesting, a medley of flavors and very complex.

We were ogling at the desserts around us (cookie plate & beignets) but just couldn't think of eating more. 

Well done Gramercy Tavern. Well done!!!
review.author: Sarah G.

review.description:
Possibly my favorite place in the city. It can be both CASUAL or FORMAL depending on how you feel like that day.
So this place has two restaurants: 

The Tavern: (walk in only)
Casual, a great place to bring your date to. They have great selections of wine and beer, most of them are available in half glass, so you can really taste a lot of different kinds of drinks without breaking your bank. They have some great burger that is not on the menu, and I especially like the apple tart dessert

The Dining Room: (Michelin one star)
I've tried their dinner tasting menu. Just WOW! I am not sure if it's the wine (we ordered 4 bottles for the 6 of us), but everything tasted amazing. I have been to almost half of the Michelin one star restaurants in NYC and I will put Gramercy Tavern as #1. The service was amazing and the staffs are knowledgeable about the dishes. I will definitely come back again when the new tasting menu is up!

Tips:
+ the Tavern has some amazing desserts, good for people who just want to have an afternoon tea
+ order half glasses (they are generous on their pour), try different things
+ they have roasted oysters at the Tavern, amazing!
review.author: Mike H.

review.description:
No reservations, no problem!

One of the best Restaurants in NYC. 

Service: The Hostess kept my group updated with the waiting times and made sure to seat us as soon as possible. The place was crowded as any other night and we were able to get a table with no reservations in 20 minutes.

I ordered the Quiona Salad, followed by Smoked Artic Char, and finished with peach sorbet to try a multitude of flavors. One word... Savory!

I am not sure how often the menu changes, it maybe seasonal or annually.
review.author: Ross P.

review.description:
Amazing place. Came here for my friend's birthday; what a treat it was especially on a very rainy Saturday afternoon.

We decided to go with the Seasonal Menu. The service by the way was very warm and the decor--quite classy. I absolutely love the flowers all over.

We started with two freshly, flaky baked buns with butter that had sumac and thyme. Then the Marinated Fluke which was refreshing with the blood orange, fennel and pumpkin seeds. The next course was the smokey Cod in a sauce, asparagus,and yogurt. Perfectly seasoned. Next was the Squash Tortellini paired with Arugula, with Bone Marrow and Crispy Gremolata. Very flavorful. Finally, the Duck Breast & Sausage (I told them no pork--) served with Leeks, Charred Onion and Trumpet Mushrooms. The duck breast was perfectly cooked with the crispiest skin.  We finished it with desserts, a cream puff filled with clementine sorbet and an earl grey creme, Strawberries & Cream with Whipped Vanilla Cheesecake, Crispy Angel Food Cake and Sorrel Ice. They also brought out a coconut mini cake with a candle, two beautiful chocolates and jelly candy. 

Wow, talk about feeling glam and my palate was surprised every time :)
review.author: Mariam M.

review.description: Gramercy nails it every time. Appetizers, entrees, and desserts are all perfect. The little bread rolls and goat cheese butter were to die for. The price and portions are fair for what you are getting (for a "fancy" restaurant, I never leave hungry and the prices are reasonably affordable). The menu is seasonal and changes regularly. Service is always spot on. This is hands down my favorite all around restaurant in NYC.
review.author: Stef S.

review.description:
The lunch we enjoyed at this restaurant deserves all five stars. From the delicious food, impeccable service and friendly attractive ambiance, this was a great dining experience. And the desserts are to die for. 
Reservations ard a must and business casual is the appropriate dress. But definitely come hungry. Don't miss eating at Gramercy Tavern.
review.author: Peter R.

review.description:
Food was fcukin Amazing!!!!! Spencer at the bar is the homie. Ordered a cold Red stripe at the bar followed by Wings, Truffle Fries, Skirt Steak lollipops and Cuban sandwich...no pic to upload because everything was destroyed!!!  Belts have been loosened 2nd round of drinks coming... just know I will return!  

Thinking of making a second order to go... it's that serious.
review.author: Kareem H.

review.description:
A five-star place on Yelp? Rare. I came here for a brunch double-date. Around 12 on a Saturday, there was no wait. 

The space is pretty small, but they do have a nice-sized bar. We started off with the white sangria, which was sweet and tasty but pretty small. It was gone before I knew it! For our meal, I split the prosciutto panini which came with fries. Their fries were super crispy and had a great crunch to them. They were generous with the prosciutto, and just half of it was enough for me! 

Service was good - the bartender (maybe owner?) was able to give great recommendations for the beers, and he really made us feel welcome there. 

Their brunch menu seems pretty bare compared to their lunch/dinner (we were told that they didn't even have any sides), but I guess that just means we'll have to come back!
review.author: Michelle B.

review.description:
We had a great time at The Alcove - the atmosphere here is so friendly and welcoming, this along with the service is definitely where the place shines.

The food is on the simpler side from the tapas items we tried:
- Truffle fries - with bacon, this gets a lot of love on the menu. The fries were crispy and flavorful with good truffle flavor. Although not my favorite, it was delicious.
- The skirt steak lollipops - these are amazing. The meat was so tender and marinated well, along with the tomatoes and onions -- probably my favorite item!
- Salmon bruschetta - simple - lox, with cream cheese and capers. Delicious!

For dessert, we shared the churros which came with some sherbert. Delicious! This, along with two cocktails came to $60. All in all, we stayed for over 2 hours and had an amazing time - the staff was welcoming without being overbearing and the water continued to be refilled.
review.author: Alex L.

review.description:
Oh my poor taste buds... I am going to say flat out, I think their 5 star rating is bullshit. I feel like I was tricked into coming here with all the fake 5 stars reviews. The place is a popular place and I like the setup since it is a fun and a cool place to hangout but make no mistake, the food was junk. The restaurant is advertised as a gastropub aka a bar that has really good food, I think they should have just kept it as a regular bar lol. The restaurant is fairly small and the seating is pretty uncomfortable, so lounging around is not ideal. At the end of the meal, I was telling my friends this place was like the Jack of all trades, the master of none. But the one thing I did love was how they represent local breweries, I saw like 3-4 breweries from LIC and I also thought the service was great. I went with a group of friends and we just drank and had apps.

The food:

BBQ and Spicy Buffalo Wings- Gorgonzola cheese crumble crusted chicken wings. For fuck sake, how does a bar fuck up wings??????? This is where the shit hits the fan, this is why it went from a 3 star to a 2 star. The wings were super depressing and my least favorite thing we ordered. The "Spicy" Buffalo wings had zero heat and the BBQ wings were too sweet but the thing that really made the wings terrible, they were cooked to death. Were they scared the chicken was going to somehow come back to life??? The wings were so incredibly dry, there was absolutely zero moisture left in the chicken and to make matters worse, the wings weren't even served hot!!! Avoid at all cost. Congrats on winning the title for worst chicken wing. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=kpxJ-vcOfRMI1HCaBYaVZQ&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

Tacos- Spicy chorizo & chicken, carne asada, roast pork shoulder, topped with pico de gallo and homemade guacamole. They looked like authentic Mexican tacos, but they were not, they were just tiny, overcooked and boring tacos. I eat a ton of authentic tacos and these were not it, I was not expecting these to be authentic but I was also not expecting them to cook the shit out of them. Where's the flavor? Where's the juiciness? And why the hell would you drown the middle taco with guac and leave the other two tacos naked???? Was this supposed to be some kind of taco guacamole bowl??? https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=lj_3wtJ5FwzyGhsktLeF_g&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

Skirt Steak Lollipops- Marinated skirt steak skewers with chimichurri sauce, tomatoes and onion rings, on a bed of mesclun. Not sure why they even called these lolipops since they were just skewers, small skewers doesn't constitute as lolipops. The steak didn't have the best texture, the meat wasn't sexy, it was overcooked and it was pretty lackluster. Also, calling something an onion ring has a very specific meaning and it's not grilled onions. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=L58IGjpAChzDOFtfSF_eKw&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

Colombian Board- Spicy Chorizo, queso fresco, brie cheese, crackers, chips accompanied by ripe green grapes. The Colombian board was good, I loved the Chorizo, everything else was pretty standard out of the grocery. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=DO61jJxKrxlYZvz160JQLg&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

Alcove Fries- Herb Truffle Gruyere cheese fries with smoked chopped bacon. It's kinda sad when the fries were the best thing we ordered. The fries were nice and crunchy, I liked the hit from the truffle oil but I really loved the grated Gruyere cheese on top, it added a nice nuttiness. It's weird to say but the bacon really didn't do anything to the dish, how can bacon not make a dish better???? https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=lAnjvu1MN4Ct6Xg7M1Swxw&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA
review.author: Ben L.

review.description:
I decided to check this place out after seeing tantalizing pictures of the tacos and skirt steaks skewers. The servers were very attentive, but were a bit slow on the water service (for our non-alcohol drinking friend). My main problem was when we asked for the check, they charged our drinks twice. Alright whatever, we let our servers know to fix it. They come back with the check, and charged us the right amount for drinks but miscalculated the the total.... 

Anywho, on to the good stuff 
Mojito ($8): there was an assortment of fruit flavors (guava, passionfruit, pineapple...) to choose from. I got the passionfruit, which flavor wise was pretty on point. It was a tad bit weak, but I'll live. 
White sangria ($8) also pretty good, but I'd go for the mojito over the sangria. 

Guacamole ($10): the tortilla chips were heavily doused in sea salt which made it overwhelmingly salty, but it's easily brushed off. Honestly, nothing too special but a good decent to share with a group of friends

Tacos (3 for $12): personally I didn't like the shell because of it's soft, non-chewy texture but maybe that's just me. The assortment of meats were overcooked to the point where the guac and pico de gallo couldn't save the dryness.

Skirt steak lollipops ($12): it looks like a lot but there's really only 4 skewers hidden in the mixed green and pesto(?). The steak was very well seasoned, slightly over cooked, but it was still pretty good.

Alcove fries: the saving grace of it all. Truffle, cheese, bacon piled onto the crispiest fries you could ever imagine. The moment your server places it down, you'll be hit with the amazing aroma and it will very quickly inhaled by everyone. The one and only downside was the sprinkle of cheese was not enough to hold the bacon and fries together so after finishing the fries you kinda have a sad pile of bacon bits. 

Will I come back? Probably.. for the mojitos.
review.author: Tanya K.

review.description:
It took  3 months to finally eat here. And the food is well prepared. 

I especially loved the pork on top of the green plantains. They melt in your mouth. 

All the mojitos are freshly made and I especially like the flavored options - tamarind, passion fruit, Guava, pineapple and coconut. 

The alcove hot dog is a bit messy but exceptionally good. I definitely would order again. 

Truffle fries - if you like truffles, you'll love the fries. 

Next time I want to try the steak skewers.
review.author: Angelina E.

review.description:
This little gastropub is tucked away in the side streets of Sunnyside. While this place is easily missed their little lights outside will draw you in. 

The bartenders and waitstaff at this place will invite in like an old friend inviting you to his backyard party -- it's a laid back atmosphere with good food, drinks, and vibes. Feel free to ask one of the bartenders to recommend a drink, they'll be happy to tell you their story. Did I mention this is an educational gastropub? So, come here with an open mind and empty belly. 

If you're here to nibble and have a few drinks, try their truffle fries. If you're hungry and want something to hold you down for the day get their Alcove Burger it comes with an adorable  quail egg. If you want something to share, well tacos are sharable right? This place understands the subtleties of sweet, salty, fat, and gooey, so bring your tastebud too!

Tip: Don't come with a fur coat 'cause their kitchen smoke tends to float up to the dining and bar area. You'll have to febreze your furry friend the day after but it's worth it. 

Bon Appetit!
review.author: Flora M.

review.description:
I had very high expectations of his place. Unfortunately, I feel they may have been a little too high.

I ordered the truffle tries, tacos, and a beer which I think was a rotating tap called Ravenwood, I'm also fairly certain I am wrong about this.

The tacos were good, but not spectacular. While the meat on them was flavorful, it seemed like they used a very similar seasoning/marinade on the three different meats. It would have been nice to have them be more differentiated.

The other toppings were also good, but I would have preferred a tiny bit more crunch. 

The guacamole was okay, but I think it would have made more sense to provide it on the side, as opposed to one big dollop in the middle taco.

The sauce provided was good. 

Don't understand the lopsidedly cut radishes though... did offer a good crunch, but they seemed to be added almost by accident.

Those truffle fries I've had dream about (not really, but I hope to soon) they were fried perfectly. They were ever so crispy on the outside, and soft inside. They came out fresh out of the dryer too! 

The best thing was that they actually tasted like truffle! The toppings of bacon and cheese were also very well integrated into the dish (good amounts), and did not feel like something added after the fact just to charge more money.

Beer was excellent, flavorful, and went great with the meal. Wasn't too heavy, and didn't taste like dishwater either.

Service was great! I could tell they weren't having the best day, but they actively did everything in their power to make sure I, and the rest of the customers were happy.
review.author: Mark T.

review.description:
I came here with 3 more friends because two of them made the suggestion of this place and I was a bit hungry, the atmosphere is for having a romantic date or have an important appointment with someone you want to impress and the prices are reasonable. 

Although I didn't order any drinks with alcohol because I came from a previous event one of my friends asked for a pina colada, which looks very good.

For my food, I order the Patacon, but for my surprise this Patacon was not like a normal Patacon that I ate in the pass, that is a kind of sandwich between big two tostones(fry platanos), this had a few tostones and meat, guacamole everything on the side, a bit different but was very crispy, fresh and had a great taste. I could like to recommend this disk to share as an appetizer with a friend or to have it as your main course. 

We also share an order of Truffle fries with was very tasty if you order this I am sure you will end licking your fingers.

The staff was very friendly and fast did I good job with our table even the owner came and say hello to us.
review.author: Gerardo A.

review.description: Really nice staff, I went with my friends for brunch on a Saturday and we didn't have to wait. Food was good, ambience was comfortable and laid back.
review.author: Rey N.

review.description:
With fingers hovering over the 5* selection, I nervously dilly dallied between the 4 and the 5 stars. My heart was beating 5 but my brain was settling at 4. Brain won. Let me elaborate a bit on my dilemma.

The food is not quite tapas as the portions are quite large which is by itself not necessarily a bad thing but I wouldn't say that the food is really tapas style. The 3 items ordered, Cuban sandwich with truffle fries ($3 upgrade), chicken wings and plantain thingy with Guac and pork were all amazing. Honestly, could not fault the food.

The beer selection was awesome, so if ur into ur beers this place has a great selection on draft of some local craft breweries. They offer flights too!

The ambiance is casual, a good place to hang out with old friends and just chit chat. A nice local neighborhood vibe to it.

Prices are very reasonable and the service was really good too. Recommendations were spot on and they really know how to make you feel welcome.

So why not 5 stars.... I guess I'm just tight and to get my 5th star requires something very special. However, it's definitely a solid 4.
review.author: Ken L.

review.description:
I've been meaning to write a review on this little cozy spot for months now. My boyfriend lives a block away and I consistently demand to come here solely for the "alcove fries"!!! Now, as if I didn't love this place enough, they decided to bring brunch into the mix. The guava mimosa is amazing.. We had the avocado toast with homefries & prosciutto eggs Benedict (not to mentioned we were actually here last night for dinner lol). So yummy all around!

This place is such a cute Sunnyside gem. It's a smaller restaurant so it tends to get super pack, which honestly makes me really happy because it means they're doing well. The staff is so sweet, friendly & really focus on customer service. It's very much a family atmosphere, especially for the locals.  ALCOVE TRUFFLE FRIES, PEOPLE.
review.author: Dan G.

review.description:
I love this place! 

Its so good to have this spot close to where I live coz I don't have to travel all the way to the city just to have some good drink. This place is awesome! Relaxing vibe, cute & happy! 

On a saturday night after dinner in Queens we decided to have a drink. I regret not having the dinner here. It should've been easy for us on a cold night not to move from one place to another. I bookmarked this place long time ago because of the nice review that this place has give me excitement to try. We got the drinks and their crispy, yummy fries. They put a lot of bacon. Very flavorful! Hands down to their yummy mojitos! Big, fruity & strong that you don't taste it but really feel it. 

I love that its not loud and the service was awesome! Me & my friends had a great time. I don't feel the rush, very relaxing & friendly people. 

I'm coming back for more drinks and food.
review.author: Jean Claire G.

review.description:
I am stating this first because it was confusing and bothersome (I hope the owners read this and respond.  We should have asked why but didn't).  For some odd reason, the place was SMOKEY, literally.  The entire time we were there the place was filled with a light smokey air emanating from the kitchen.  Either their oven was dirty or they do not have the proper exhaust system in place.  So smokey, it was literally on our clothes for the rest of the day.  I am hoping this was a one time thing or else I wouldn't come back.   

This is a wife and husband run small restaurant / bar in Sunnyside Queens.  The husband and wife are very friendly and inviting.  To start, we had the Patacones and Truffle fries which were both tasty and enjoyable.  For entrees, we had the:

Alcove Hot Dog: All the toppings, which are plenty, come together so well.  Really enjoyed this

Skirt Steak Lollipops: Delicious.  Love the greens, tomatoes, onions and the steak was soft and juicy.  A definite buy!

Cuban Sandwich: Friend said it was good but the $14 price tag for it is a bit steep.  

We also enjoyed 3 drinks (1 white sangria and 2 whiskeys straight).  The total bill was $87.  

TIP: The kitchen closes on Sunday from 3pm - 4pm.
review.author: Mark T.

review.description: 5 stars well deserved. The owner, Jonathan, checked on our table frequently and made everyone feel like we're at our friend's place chilling. The tacos, Alcove burger with truffle fries were so amazing and their craft beer selection is excellent. I would trust any menu at this place. We're definitely coming back! Thanks for your hospitality :)
review.author: Irene M.

review.description:
To eat is a necessity, but to eat intelligently is an art!!! The food and drinks at ALCOVE are downright mouthwatering and satisfying! Come here for brunch, lunch, or dinner; doesn't matter!!!!!! The steak tacos ....truffle fries.....burgers.....I'm hungry just typing all this!!!!!!!!!!!!! 

And if the food and drinks don't speak for themselves, the owner Jonathan is priceless. He is amicable and so pleasant to be around! He will welcome you with open arms and take the time to go over everything on the menu in detail. We have been here with friends and family many times and will not stop.....DEFINITION OF a GEM. 5 stars are just not enough :/
review.author: Diamond S.

review.description: By far the best damn place to eat and drink in this neighborhood!!! I've been here a couple of times and the food and drinks are always on point. The wings and the skirt steak lollipops are a must have when picking off the menu along with their truffle fries. Presentation of the food is amazing. I prefer wine over mixed drinks but which ever you end up choosing you will  order more cause it's that good. Spence and Adrian are so full of life and constantly keep you laughing. It's not a place where you order food and the waiter brings you what you want there are always friendly conversations exchanged between you and them. The vibe of The Alcove makes you feel as if you were at a bar somewhere on an island. Great food, music and people. What more can you ask for?!?!? Definitely recommend this spot for tons of fun and for foodie lovers!
review.author: Yera P.

review.description: This is my favorite place ever! And I live in jersey! And that hour drive through city traffic is worth it all for the amazing family environment and the bomb ass food!! When you're here, you're legit family! Highly highly highly recommend.
review.author: Reenu V.

review.description: Jonathan is amazing and always ensures we have a fantastic meal and delicious drink. I feel like family when I come here and the service and food NEVER disappoints. Favorite place in Sunnyside hands down!
review.author: Victoria H.

review.description:
One of the better establishments in sunnyside, restaurants here are mostly disappointing. Limited seating so may have to be lucky or come early and beat the crowds. 

Pretty decent selection of beers with some options from various Queens brewers. Supporting local is always a welcomed move. Mojitos are average, I can do without. 

Standout would definitely be the food here. Cheese platter with select cheeses from Stinky Brooklyn. The honeyed raisins that came with the cheeses were amazing. Colombian board came with a sausage that wasn't disgustingly salty! Guacamole was a rough cut, still got chunks of avocado (personal preference thing here, but I do prefer a rougher cut than a total puree). Fries was the only average appetizer we ordered. Standard fries with some cheese and bacon, nothing stood out. 

The best app we had was the steak lollipop, basically skewered steak slices. Grilled excellently, topped with greens and onions and not sauced aggressively, blah blah blah delicious etc. What made it stand out was the cherry tomatoes, odd to say, but try it.
review.author: Leo C.

review.description:
Came in for lunch with a friend and everything was delicious and very reasonably priced!! Their lunch special had variety and was only $10! 
Salad, edamame, and fried rice! 
Friendly staff and very nice decor. Check it out!
review.author: Lilly I.

review.description:
Lunch special is anywhere from $10-$16. 
If you get the vegetable or tofu as your "meat" then it's $10. There are choices of pork, chicken, squid, shrimp and etc.

Lunch special comes w soup/salad and an appetizer. I had the tofu soup (broth was yummy) and spring roll. *One spring roll cut in half.

I chose green curry as my main and it's a bit of spicy next to a tower of rice. For the price, it's exceptional food. 

For my veggie green curry, the vegs are inconveniently large to fit into the mouth in one try. Also don't like the spoon size. 

The service feels bit rushed with no particular reason. Everyone is quite eager to clean up your table.

There's wifi available in case you need to write up that report.
review.author: Joanne K.

review.description:
I went to Up Thai over the weekend with some friends and, while it was good, it did not quite live up to the hype.

One area where Up Thai really excelled was the interior.  It is a gorgeous space, pretty large, with great decor.  It rivals Thai Villa as the nicest looking Thai restaurant in Manhattan.

The lunch specials are a pretty good deal; $10 for a soup or salar, appetizer, and entree, with some additional cost if you get a fancier meat in your dish, such as duck.

There were five of us, and we ordered a total of four lunches.  Four our appetizers, we got to try the soup and the salad, and had a mix of steamed dumplings, which are filled with chicken and shrimp, and net rolls, which are filled with crab and shrimp.  The soup had a really light and good flavor and, even though small, had a lot of tofu in it, which was nice.  The salad was pretty standard; it had the usual ginger dressing on it and was tasty, but nothing special.  The net roll has a crispy outside and has a good amount of shrimp and crab; it was a good choice.  I didn't get to try the steamed dumplings, but my friends seemed to like them. Overall, with the exception of the net rolls, the lunch appetizers are pretty much your standard Thai lunch appetizer offerings.

For entrees, my friends had pad thai and moo dang.  I got to try the pad thai, and it was good, but nothing too special.  My fiance had been to Up Thai for lunch previously and she told me that the pad thai was larger and had more sauce and was tastier her first time there.  Perhaps they were having a bad day this weekend?  I had the pra ram with fried squid.  The squid was cooked really well and wasn't chewy at all.  And there was sufficient vegetables in it.  The peanut sauce was really good and slightly sweet.  My only complaint is that the dish was so small.

Based on this one experience, I would say that Up Thai is a solid but not-so-special Thai restaurant.  It's lunch offerings are pretty standard, as are the prices, and the portions were somewhat small.  I do not know if I will return, but if I do, I hope it lives up to all the hype next time because this time it did not. I want to rate this 3 stars but the beautiful atmosphere bumps it to a 4, barely.
review.author: Joshua S.

review.description:
Cute Thai spot! 

We were visiting from out of town and thought we would try it from the positive reviews. We are so happy we did. 

I had the veggie panang curry which was perfect! And my friend had the pad Thai. We asked if the curry was big enough to share which they said no BUT it was. If you're a small eater like me I would recommend sharing the curry.
review.author: Ra S.

review.description: Easily one of the best Thai places in NY - wow. Starting from the atmosphere of this place to the food, my experience here has been spectacular. I tried the Ba Mee and from the first taste, I was impressed! I also tried a bite of my friend's Pad Thai & it was amazing. I wanna come back & try everything on the menu - highly recommend!
review.author: Diane C.

review.description:
My two girlfriends and I came here for a relatively casual birthday dinner, and we loved it! The interior with pretty lights and dim lighting makes the ambiance both romantic and fun, and the space is a lot bigger than what it seems like from the outside. We started off with drinks, all of which were fine - nothing special. The food, however, was pretty fantastic. I actually think the food was quite memorable since there are so many mediocre Thai restaurants in NYC. Up Thai, on the other hand, had really strong flavors that tasted more authentic than something made up with a ton of MSG.

Considering the very affordable prices of the menu, I would recommend this place to anyone looking to eat delicious Thai food in a trendy vibe. The three of us ordered, Up Thai Fried Rice Claypot, Kea Mao, and Poh Tak, which we all LOVED. I always appreciate restaurants that are gracious with seafood and meat. Trust me, Up Thai will make sure you get your moneys-worth. Not too salty, but with just the right amount of seasoning and flavor, I remember each dish being everything I imagined it to be from reading the descriptions. You will most likely not be disappointed! 

Service was also great! We wanted a birthday dessert for my friend, and the waiter was quick enough to catch that we wanted a candle, so he brought one out for us when we ordered dessert.
