Overall, I had a great time here, and I will definitely be back for more of Up Thai's delicious and authentic food. The only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars was because nothing was mind blowing. However, I would highly recommend this place to my friends and other Yelpers!
review.author: Lisa L.

review.description:
Very cute restaurant in an area that desperately needs good options. The ambiance and decor are elegant, and the lighting super cool... at this point everybody is familiar with their beautiful lanterns. 

I came here with three friends on a Friday afternoon at 6pm, she were seated immediately. They don't take reservations, so if you don't go early plan on waiting for a while. 

We shared a couple of appetizers, and had one main course each. Depending on what you order, portions tend to be medium-large. 

Plar koong: refreshing and spicy; good. 

Curry puffs: tasty; good combo with the sweet sauce they come with. 

Up Thai fried rice clay-pot: I only had a small taste of this dish (just a scallop and a piece of veggie), but enjoyed the flavor; sweet and spicy. 

Pla Saam Ross (branzino): lots of fish! It looked pretty plain, but the broth was very flavorful; the fish was very soft. 

Cod with pineapple curry: again, huge amount of fish! I really liked the coconut curry sauce. 

Duck prig pao (special): although the noodles were good, the duck was uninspiring...didn't have much of a flavor. 

Overall, it was an interesting meal. Maybe not 4-star worthy, but the service was attentive and professional. We found some pieces of cracked clam shell in one of the dishes, and they took that entree off the check. We did t even ask for it. That was classy of them.
review.author: Giacomo C.

review.description:
Not gonna lie, I wanted to come here mainly for the interior decor. 

We made a reservation for 6:30PM on a Wednesday night and when we got there, we were seated right away. The restaurant itself was smaller than I had expected but I loved the atmosphere. The decor was so cute and the restaurant was lively. 

We ordered Curry Puffs for appetizer. It was SO good. The outside was flaky and the inside had a thick mashed potato consistency. The sweet onion relish sauce went really well with it. The Pad See Ew was my favorite. The noodles were well cooked and definitely flavorful. We also ordered the Red Curry and Pineapple Fried Rice. I'm not a big fan of curry because of the coconut-y taste but it was pretty good! And you can't go wrong with Pineapple Fried Rice. The chicken was a little dry but overall, it was delicious! Everything we ordered was really good and flavorsome. We split 3 dishes among 3 people so we had a little bit of everything.

The waitress was also really sweet and very attentive. Constantly refilling our water and asking if everything was okay. 

Overall, I would definitely recommend this place. The ambiance makes it perfect for a date night
review.author: Yuri K.

review.description:
When I lived on the UES this was my go-to spot for a Thai fix! I've been here four or five times and have also done takeout. The ambiance is very nice with hanging lights, and a grown up Rainforest Cafe feel (but not too overdone). There's a bar right at the front of the restaurant where you can sit and wait if you're waiting on someone. 

The pad Thai, curries, and pad see ew here are all great. The tofu is perfectly cooked and not too crunchy or too soft. I've enjoyed their Thai iced teas too, and once ordered a lychee drink that I found too sweet.

There is usually a wait here on a busy weeknight or weekend so call ahead to make reservations!
review.author: Emily J.

review.description:
I don't know why it's taken us so long to try this place! Great ambiance and food! We shared a few different dishes:
Soft shell crab mango salad-beautiful presentation, with a full crab on top, totally delicious and amazing price of $12

Curry chicken buns-these were totally disappointing, 3 pre-made buns that weren't even warm. Filling was a very dry curry'ish chicken, which lacked any flavor.  $10

Summer rolls- these were standard Thai fare, but fresh and delicious, served with peanut dipping sauce. $10

Pineapple curry cod- this was really outstanding! Huge chunks of fresh flakey cod sitting atop a beautiful bowl of yellow curry filled with vegetables. $22

Will definitely be back!
review.author: glyn J.

review.description:
I was in the area and my friend loves Thai food. This place came up as being the closest with the highest star level on Yelp so we ventured in. First thing that you should notice when you arrive is the sexy decor which I think is the best way to describe any restaurant that you have to part a curtain in order to enter the dimly lit establishment. Our early dinner turned into a date based on the ambience. I found myself gazing into my friend's eye affectionately more so than usual LOL...which could be due to the lack of lighting.

The food and service were pretty good. We started with calamari then went on to share  the short ribs which came with stick rice. It was not really enough for 2 but would yield leftovers of one ordered it. We stopped before we hit dessert and realized that the restaurant had filled up almost to capacity by 5 PM.

Definitely would recommend this as early evening or afternoon date spot if you are in the area...
review.author: Cassie C.

review.description:
5 stars for food, 2.75 stars for service. 
A party of 10 for dinner at 5pm on a Saturday about a month ago, we ordered the following to share:
- satay skewers (3 plates to share for the table)
- papaya salad, mild
- special papaya salad with fried soft-shell crab 
- grilled, marinated beef on a mixed green salad 
- pad-see-eiw (one plate with shrimp, one with chicken)
- massaman curry (one with shrimp, one with beef
- pad thai (one with chicken, one with beef, another with tofu) 
- two orders of the soft shell crab house special served with a curried lentil or other grain of sorts 
- a couple thai iced teas and other soft drinks 

All the food met or exceeded expectations. Since we were a group of diverse backgrounds (from a couple that had never eaten Thai food, to a few who ate it every few weeks), we ordered the mild version of everything to be shared by all. According to one of the group who had been here multiple times this was her favorite Thai restaurant, and always delivered on quality and flavor. They don't skimp on the heat if you ask for spicy too. 

The only thing that took away from the experience was that even before we sat down, the hostess asked how soon we would leave. Mind you 5 of us got to the restaurant at 5pm, which is when the restaurant opened, and 9/10 people arrived by 5:15. We did this purposefully because thru don't take reservations. And the restaurant was 75% empty at 5:15. The hostess asked us if we could leave by 6:30...which frankly is really rushed. It took 20-25 minutes after we placed our order around 5:25-5:30 for all the food to finish coming out, which doesn't give you much time to finish it. I had to negotiate with the restaurant to stay until 6:45, and I suppose I should be thankful they didn't ask us to physically leave until 7pm. I understand that they have a lot of customers, but it's one thing if there is a line out the door and a large group is sitting around after their meal chit-chatting and making the wait longer for everyone else. But we had waited outside the door for the "open" sign to be displayed, only to be treated like they didn't really want our business. So as amazing as the food is, the experience left a bit of a negative taste in my mouth.
review.author: Susan C.

review.description:
It's a decent Thai restaurant in Upper East side. They have a good lunch deal like other Thai restaurants. 

First, you can choose soup or salad. I got Tofu vegetable soup and it was good. I couldn't see any Tofu though. 

Second, you can choose an appetizer. I got net rolls which are fried rolls with shrimp and crab. They were so so good! Highly recommended! 

Third, you choose lunch entree. I got Tofu pad thai and the sauce was very tasty with well cooked noodles. The portion was also pretty big so I was very satisfied. 

I was amazed by its decoration and atmosphere. It's pretty and splendid inside.

The reason I gave them four stars is that the service was terrible. My friend got shrimp pad thai but she got chicken one. She talked to the staff but the staff didn't say any word and took her plate. He came back with shrimp pad thai and didn't say anything. We all thought that they would apologize for it but they didn't. It doesn't hurt anything to say sorry.... 

Other than that, I liked this restaurant and I hope staffs are nicer and more friendly when I come back here.
review.author: Haeri S.

review.description:
Stopped by Up Thai based on reviews left by other fellow yelpers and the visit did not disappoint. Took advantage of the lunch special which is PLENTIFUL and very reasonably priced. Service was fantastic. Fresh, delicious food brought out in minutes. In and out in for lunch in less than 45 minutes.

I tried both the Thai fried rice as well as the pineapple fried rice- excellent! 

The vegetable tofu soup and dumplings were also delicious.

Hope to return on my next visit to NYC.
review.author: Alicia S.

review.description:
I ordered take out from Up Thai's lunch special. The special is a pretty good deal... you get one appetizer, salad or soup, and an entree. 

I decided to order the shrimp pineapple fried rice with steamed dumplings and salad. Overall, everything was just mediocre. I was expecting a lot more flavor from the steam dumplings. The sauce was also very oily and lacked flavor. The salad was also underwhelming. They just give you a container filled with lettuce. What ever happened to tomatoes, or other garden vegetables??

The pineapple rice was probably the best thing. Although they forgot to add soy sauce in the bag. The rice was tasty enough to eat without the sauce.
review.author: Xenia M.

review.description:
This place makes very good vegetarian curries. HOWEVER, THIS IS THE ONLY THING ON THE MENU THAT IS TRULY VEGETARIAN. The sauces for the noodles and sauteed entreés are all based with oyster sauce and or fish sauce and cannot be made without. 

We had crispy spring rolls to start off with. One order will get you 3 rolls, and in my opinion, they're not that great. They're good, but not great. 

I would still recommend going here for Thai curries. I got the panang curry and it was great! I asked for it to be medium spicy, but it wasn't spicy at all (in fact it was a bit sweet, but probably from the coconut milk and palm sugar that is in traditional recipes), which was upsetting, but not enough to made the meal bad. 

My friend got the Masamam curry, and that was great too. This was honestly the best Masamam curry I've had. I'm generally not a fan on Masamam because it's never been made well, but this place strikes a good balance amongst all the flavors. 

I would definitely come back here and try the green and red curries too. 

The ambience here is AMAZING!!!!! definitely a place I would go again on a date or just as a nice reataurant. Be sure to make reservations because this place gets packed!
review.author: Runal P.

review.description: Food is fresh, flavorful and healthy. The Thai coffee is very strong, I would recommend if your a true coffee lover. The prices are high for the amount of food you get, but the quality of ingredients is superb. I would recommend the eggplant with shrimp.
review.author: Donna K.

review.description:
I'd had Up Thai bookmarked for a while, and this Monday evening we finally made a trip to the restaurant. The place was surprisingly packed for a weeknight at 8 pm, but luckily there was an available table for us. 

As expected, the food is fantastic. Up Thai generally serves classic dishes that I recognized, but there were also some soups and other items that seemed a bit more obscure. I was so tempted to try the pad see ew (my favorite Thai dish and usual go-to) but ultimately opted for the chicken pad krapow (Thai chili, string beans, onion, bell pepper and basil leaves), which is served with jasmine rice. It was excellent: somewhat spicy, but not overpoweringly so. It also tastes a little sweet, I suppose because of the basil and bell pepper. The veggies are obviously all super fresh.

My dining companion had the cod with pineapple curry (red curry paste, pineapple, asparagus, onion, bell pepper). I'm a little allergic to cod, so I only had a bite of pineapple with the curry sauce, but I can tell I would've loved the curry. It had a very nice coconut-milky flavor to it. 

I also tried an "ultimate" Thai iced tea, a tea spiked with vodka. It tasted great, but was maybe a little pricey at $14.

The atmosphere was icing on the cake. It was a bit like stepping into a Thai rainforest.
review.author: Laura O.

review.description:
Probably my favorite dine-in Thai restaurant in the city. Super cute interior, nice service, great food and drinks, and good pricing.

Highlights include:
- For starters, the crispy-fried calamari is cooked to perfection. Also all of their dumplings, curry puffs and spring rolls are on point.
- Pad Kea Mao (broad noodles, egg, chili, bell pepper and basil leaves)
- Thai fried rice with Chinese broccoli, onion, scallions, tomatoes and fried egg
- Thai iced tea and Thai iced coffee

I could eat here weekly if I spent more time in the area (I hate the UES, but this place is worth the visit).
review.author: Josie T.

review.description:
TL;DR: don't get delivery, DO eat in. 

Did you know that Up Thai has a phenomenal lunch deal? Not kidding: starter with soup/salad and a main course for $11. Badass. I usually get either rice, noodles, or curry (which basically covers everything on their lunch menu), and it's all been delicious. I will say: sometimes, you get unlucky with the noodles. Everything tastes fresh here, but if you go on an off day, you can tell they're scraping those noodles off of the bottom of an old pan. They're the small pieces that are always less juicy, slightly more solid, and a different color that the "good" noodles.  So...a heads up, if you will. 

About delivery: I believe they tell you this somewhere on their site, but their food is best experienced fresh. If you have it delivered and the guy has to take half an hour to get to you, it won't be its best. Read: it won't be very good. 

As an aside, I've been trying for almost three years now to find a good CHINESE DELIVERY in UES/Yorkville with absolutely no luck. Here's what I consider good: delicious (self explanatory), in the $9-13 price range for one entree (no way should anyone be paying more than that for Chinese, ever), and of a decent size (read: none of those tiny white pans. I'm talking "I'll have the rest of this tomorrow" size.)

If you know of a Chinese delivery place that meets these oh-so-stringent requirements, "slide into the DM's (in a non-sleazy way)" as the kids say these days.
review.author: Helena B.

review.description:
Most ramen place are either pork bone broth or chicken broth; but the signature broth for this place is beef broth. It's amazing.
It was such a delightful encounter; although it's kind of out of place...but parking is not too hard to find and you can take the F train there. 
I ordered the beef tongue ramen and although they keep some of the fat on the tongue, it was not overpowering nor do I feel too fattening. The broth was smooth and flavorful - different from pork bone / miso or chicken. I am glad I went, I will definitely be going back for more.
review.author: Simon H.

review.description:
Amazing place! Definitly the best beef ramen ever!

Rich and full of flavor. The place was clean and roomy so I will bring some friends with me next time
review.author: Agata P.

review.description:
A great ramen place at a strange corner. It's on court street that hits Hamilton Ave so it's probably not getting as much foot traffic as other ramen shops in the neighborhood. 

The place is small with only a few tables, regardless, the ramen was on point. Za-Ya has a small and simple menu but that's what I came here for...ramen!

We ordered the Chicken Karaage - boneless fried chicken with spicy mayo as appetizer to share. The chicken was lightly breaded and there's ginger in it so it has a hint of heat. It was juicy and delicious without being heavily breaded and fried. 

We also ordered the Gyukotsu ramen - creamy beef broth, beef chashu (short ribs), garlic chips and cilantro. The broth was very rich and has a much cleaner taste than some other ramen places I've been to. It's not overly salty either which is good if you don't like salt. The beef chashu reminded me of korean bbq short ribs which was amazingly delicious. Not tough or chewy, but savory with a nice bite to it.

This place is indeed a hidden gem in the neighborhood and I will definitely be back for more.
review.author: Janet Y.

review.description: Delicious beef broth ramen. Got their gyukatsu which is creamy and rich. Has two big, tender pieces of short rib, saffron, garlic, cilantro, bamboo, radish? and scallions. Ramen were thin and cooked just right. Also got their other beef broth ramen which was clear instead of creamy. It was also very delicious! Cow tongue was tender! Wanted to add an egg but they sold out... Each bowl was $16. Chicken karaage was so good-crunchy, juicy and flavorful. Loved the dipping sauce too. Come visit!
review.author: Elizabeth N.

review.description:
Authentic Ramen with a unique traditional taste of Japan. Delicious, healthy and unique 
Great service too
review.author: Ralph D.

review.description: This was our first experience trying ramen and we loved it! I got the Miso (chicken broth, miso tare, pork belly, shiitake mushrooms, sweet corn) and my husband got the Gyukotsu (beef with garlic and cilantro in a soy sauce tare). Both bowls were super flavorful and filling. I'm a satisfied girl, with my first experience with ramen!
review.author: Brooke B.

review.description:
Lovely little ramen spot that bucks the trend of in-your-face, food-coma-inducing, over-salted, thick-brothed, bowls with subtle, balanced flavors, great proteins, perfectly chewy noodles, and hot, delicious broth.

Also, the staff is small and friendly and the space is super-cute. Definitely worth a trip, and hope they stick around for a long while.
review.author: Jake D.

review.description:
I ate at Za-Ya Ramen on a recent Friday night. The restaurant only had a handful of other patrons, but it's likely due to the fact that they've only been open for a week. I ordered the Gyukotsu Ramen ($16), a beef bone broth ramen, which is what the Mongolian owners said they are known for. 

The beef broth was rich, creamy, and full of flavor. It was nice to try something different than the typical pork based broths. It came with two pieces of tender, grilled beef, alongside some carefully arranged toppings. The noodles were more firm than I would've preferred, but were perfect after soaking in the pipping hot broth. This didn't stop me from ordering extra noodles ($2), as I felt the standard serving was not quite enough.

Overall, I would recommend this restaurant if you're craving authentic Japanese ramen, without having to venture into Manhattan or endure long wait times. I'm glad to see a ramen shop in this area of Brooklyn, with a friendly staff and reasonable prices.
review.author: Kevin Y.

review.description: We had the beef tongue ramen and one with chicken broth! They were both absolutely amazing! the beef broth was especially good. We will definitely go back.
review.author: Mona R.

review.description: This is one of a new place to go if you're looking for ramen. I had Gyukotsu Ramen and I love it. Perfect for a cool days and a Kaarage - fried chicken tasted good. It might be a little pricey but it's good for the quality. Place was a bit small, I think it would easily get crowded on weekends. Just a piece of advice; if you're planning to go on a weekend, be early to have a place for yourself.
review.author: Lupe M.

review.description:
This ramen spot is small and in a weird spot, but the ramen is great! It's salty and brothy and satisfies.

Prices are similar to the ones in the city.

Service was quick and simple. Our waitress was very friendly and helpful. She checked up on us quite a bit, which is good.
review.author: Danny L.

review.description:
The ramen broth lacked flavor- the overall experience was not great. The ramen noodles had good texture but the broth just didn't have much flavor. Also it is overly expensive. We got the tuna don as an appetizer and it was small for 9 bucks. My ramen was 16 dollars. I much rather go to momosan in the city- it isn't as pricey and flavors are way better. 

They also did not have ice - and they lack air conditioning. Will it be returning.
review.author: Diana K.

review.description: This was the best ramen I have ever had, and I would probably say that ramen is my favorite food. ZaYa had a unique beef booth with beef chashu that brought a new flavor to my pallete that I have never experienced at a ramen shop before. Additionally the juicy chicken karaage here was the perfect side to an amazing meal. This is definitely one of my favorite spots in town now and I will be visiting all the time!
review.author: Raunak N.

review.description: Popped in during their soft opening, having no idea what a treat I was in for. I got the beef ramen--it's different but it's delicious and definitely hits the spot. The meat is tender and the broth is creamy. Beer and sake are coming soon. I can't wait to go back!
review.author: Erin C.

review.description: Good location near Other Half. We tried the gyukotsu and miso ramen - they were both excellent. Unlike some other ramen shops, the meat was juicy and flavorful. The gyukotsu noodle was more like soba while the miso noodle was the curly ramen. The service was attentive and friendly. I only wish they had tsukemen. Will be visiting again!
review.author: Sora Beta A.

review.description: The fried chicken was crispy and juicy. The sauce that came with it was pretty spice and good. The pork in the miso ramen was super tender.
review.author: Jeanette L.

review.description: First time ever to try Gyukotsu (beef born broth ramen noodle) comes with a big beef chashu I love it!!!!
review.author: Yurie A.

review.description:
Great new ramen shop on Court street! The beef broth ramen was rich and delicious along with perfectly cooked steak slices to compliment the al denti ramen. We also had the arugula salad which was refreshingly good as a appetizer.

The menu was simple as I only saw beef or chicken broth based ramen. My only suggestion is to add a vegetarian option for the fellow ramen lovers.

All around we are impressed with the authenticity of the beef ramen and in my opinion are much better than Ippudo ramen without its fanfare. This is a hidden gem in the neighborhood and a much need addition in South Carroll Garden.
review.author: Sean W.

review.description: Outstanding. Excellent ramen and great service. It took longer than expected but totally worth the wait for this delicious meal!
review.author: Chris B.

review.description: As a ramen lover, this place is AMAZING!! The portion size is just right. I look forward to coming back to try the other ramens. So far, I love what I had last night!
review.author: Jamie L.

review.description:
Super fun place! 

We legit were just walking by looking for a bar to go to and the owner called us off the street telling us there was a shot and beer combo. I was like well how much are whiskey sours and he gave us a discount ! so fun and nice loved every second of my time there.

Very funny/ fun country themed steakhouse-y place. def will be back !
review.author: Victoria B.

review.description:
Party of 3 and ordered - 
-Pork Belly Appetizer - Generous amounts of porkbelly that were deep fried and it came with two sauces. Thought this was okay, the porkbelly was overly fried so it wasn't as juicy as I would've liked.

-Monster 50/50 Sandwich - This was good! Split 3 ways and it was more than enough. They give you a good amount of meat in the sandwich too. I liked the aioli they had with the crunchy slaw. Delicious! 

-Smoked BBQ platter - Added the meat candy for $5. Totally worth it as they give you a generous amount of meat compared to the $13 you would pay for an appetizer. Really liked the meat candy and the ribs! They were definitely fall off the bone delicious. The pulled pork and the brisket was a little dry for me but the ribs and meat candy made up for that. 

-Beers were also only $4. Not sure if we had hit happy hour or if those are regular prices!

Would definitely return!
review.author: Sara Y.

review.description:
Came here on a Friday night and ordered for pick up. Upon pick up, we were informed that they were new with the system to order out and that they were trying to get the hang out of it. I appreciated that they informed us so it clarified anything in case our orders were messed up. Unfortunately, a lot of the items we ordered were out, but we had already placed our order :( They compensated the items with other items on their menus at no charge! Overall, I think the service was great and the staff was amicable as well.

As for the food, we had half baked mac & cheese, dry rubbed ribs and and the LES Spicy tacos. 

The mac & cheese was super creamy and baked with chili, bacon bits and jack cheese. I really liked it! It was super cheesy since it was baked with a layer of cheese on top and some cheese sauce in it! The meat and chili added nice flavoring to it as well. Would recommend! 

The dry rubbed ribs weren't bad. I didn't have much of it. We initially ordered the fall off the bone ribs but they were out of it, so unfortunately we couldn't try it :( 

The tacos were good, but they were really spicy for me, so I wouldn't recommend it to someone who doesn't have a high tolerance for spicy food. They were pretty delicious, but the spiciness lingered in my mouth for way too long so it masked the taste of the taco. 

We went to the bar as we waited for our order and there was a $4 for a beer and a shot of moonshine. That moonshine was kinda disgusting, but it's a pretty good deal if you want cheap drinks!
review.author: Viona C.

review.description:
I know how absolutely ridiculous it is that I live in Queens and have never managed to go the original location, it was only once they opened in my home away from home, the LES, that I finally made it in. 

The hostess Adina saw me and the boy eyeing the menu outside and came right out to welcome us and ask us if we had any questions. We chatted a bit about the menu and she was so helpful and outgoing! Had we not already made up our minds about going in, she would have sealed the deal. 

The space is nicely done, woods and red tones, with a bar up front, seating in the back, and a another back room with more seating and doors (so it's great for private events). 

The food was to die for, possibly the best BBQ I've had anywhere in the city. We went absolutely overboard and I'm so glad we did because it gave us a chance to really see how skilled their chefs are. 

We started with the pork belly appetizer and their Half Baked mac n cheese. The pork belly was delicious, not as liquid-tender as some places I'm used to but still a good option on the menu. It comes with their original BBQ sauce and their habanero sauce. The mac n cheese however is some of the BEST I've ever had. It's got Jack cheese, bacon bits, and beef chili. The beef chili really takes it over the edge, this is some damn tasty chili. The spices are just right, and it's just the right amount so it doesn't overpower the cheesy goodness.Not that it needs the extra oompf, but I found adding some of their original BBQ sauce to the mix put the entire dish into overdrive. Their sauce is perfectly balanced, not too sweet, with a hint of smokiness. ALL THE FLAVORS. 

My partner ordered the meat platter (ribs, pulled pork, brisket) with the burnt ends or "meat candy" added on. It also came with cole slaw, pickles, and a biscuit. This is a generous, filling portion of food. While all the items are fantastic, the stars of the show were absolutely the ribs and the meat candy. In both instances, the flesh was beyond melt in your mouth tender, with the perfect amount of silky fat in each bite. Dipping the meat candy into the habanero sauce is a must. The original BBQ sauce goes great on the ribs, which I can't talk up enough, and I'm picky about ribs. They're good with or without sauce. 

I ordered their beef burger with pulled pork, Muenster cheese, and slaw. Slather some of that BBQ sauce on there, and this thing is daaaaamn good. It was also cooked a perfect medium rare.

The apple cake is sticky sweet. Their moonshine mimosas are massive. The Blood Moon cocktail has a serious kick from the habaneros. They have a great moonshine selection, including watermelon, blueberry, and apple. They also have pickle backs! 

Our waitress Lindsay brought the whole experience full circle. I really cannot emphasize the natural friendliness and competence of the staff, who are not only extremely knowledgeable about the menu, but treat you like an old friend in a way that doesn't feel forced. We were made to feel at home before we even entered, and that inclusive vibe extended from the waitstaff to us, and then from us to the other patrons (we ended up making friends with the next table haha, shout out to Rachel B. and her mom!). 

This was an incredible meal from start to finish and I am so happy to have this place in the hood :)
review.author: Luci B.

review.description:
Only having been opened for one week, we had an amazing time. I had asked Conor the manager for a private party during brunch time on a Sunday for 12. Little did I know that we would have the whole place to ourselves. It was an incredible rare experience and the staff only made it better every minute with their attentiveness and Care to make sure we had a good time.  They also left us alone too to make sure we had some privacy. We were able to make our own playlist for background music and we sat centered under the sun roof. Greeted by Conor himself, he smiled and told us some of the special things that we would get to make the event more special (example: a shotglass for each guest). I couldn't believe how personalized and wonderful it was and I can't stop saying good things about it!  If you're looking for a private space the back room with fence doors is the perfect place! 

On to the food! We started with quite a few appetizers. 

Mac and cheese: twisty pasta! It was very creamy with a touch of cheese on top and a special sauce (not sure what it was). Served in a skillet, nice and hot. 

Corn in a skillet:  fresh and hot out of the oven! It was seasoned deliciously and the corn had a grilled taste without the burns. 

Meat candy: also known as their award winning meat. These are the burnt ends served with three types of sauces. Be careful though. You might get addicted. 

Pork belly: the portion looks small but two orders plus other things for a party of 12 were just enough. The juice melts out of the pork belly fat and then in your mouth. I liked this dish but preferred the three above over it.  

Guacamole and chips: your standard but still delicious guacamole with puffed up tortilla chips. It's a good one to share amongst a few. 

As for the entrees, most of us just got the barbecue platter to share among two people. I LOVED the fall-off-the-bone dry rubbed ribs and the unbelievably moist cornbread. The pulled pork was ok and a great portion but the least favorite was the brisket. The flavors were there but we all agreed it was quite dry. I would love to go back next time and give the briskets a try again. Otherwise I'm happy with the ribs alone and would come back for everything else. :) 

At the end we also got complimentary apple crumb cake. They're not a dessert place but this cake is pretty damn good. Not too sweet, super moist. 

Thanks so much to Conor and the staff for everything you did to make the event memorable! You guys rock!
review.author: Lilian N.

review.description:
Came here pre-karaoke (Boho) for some drinks and food with a friend. Food was great, staff was great, drinks were great.

When walking in with my friend, we were confronted by security. We offered our id's, but instead of taking them he walked us inside--but not in a good way; it was more a I'm keeping an eye on you cause I want to kick you out way. Once inside, security asked us if we were with the party in the back, which we thought was odd: 1) because he's security, not the host, and 2) cause the host was right there. We answered that were were not and said it would just be us. Security looked at the host and made a gesture like, want me to kick them out? The host (we later found out was the bar manager) gave security a great dismissive look and told him it was fine. He looked at us and said, no problem, come with me. He was great and put our minds at ease cause we really felt uncomfortable with this oddly aggressive security person.

After that, the rest of our experience was great. We sat down had drinks and food. I had the mac and cheese and it was great. Served in an iron skillet with chili on top, you'll love it also. The menu says it serves two, but I'd say that depends on how hungry you are. I enjoyed a Catch in the Rye cocktail and it was delicious. I def want another.

After a bit, the hostess came over to check on us. We let her know that we were having a good time, but that someone should talk with security cause he made us very uncomfortable for no apparent reason. She apologized and offered us some moonshine, which we thought was really nice, but we passed. Later on she sent over an apple dessert thing as a way of apologizing for our earlier experience and that--was the highlight of the night. I really really don't like apple desserts, but man was this thing awesome!

Stop by and enjoy some food and drinks. I think that security business was just an outlier cause the rest of our experience was stellar.
review.author: Miguel C.

review.description:
I've only heard good things about Butcher Bar from friends and fellow yelpers, so I had to try it out for myself. I went this past Saturday with my fam, we arrived at 5:30 PM and were seated ahead of our ressie. We were greeted right away and given water for the table, we scoured the menu and went for the famous "Meat Candy" which are their burnt ends and guac to start. The apps came out fairly quick and they were delicious, but the meat candy stole the show for sure, they were little bits of heaven. They were nicely charred and had a slightly sweet taste, juicy, and just not enough! There was 4 of us and the order wasn't enough, I suggest you get 2 orders if you want a little extra, which you def will. The guac was a tab bit on the salty side, but surprisingly good, the chips were nice they were very similar to the texture of stacey chips. 

On to the main course, the BBQ! My cousin and I split the smoked BBQ platter which came with beef brisket, pulled pork, 1/4 rack of ribs, house slaw, pickles, and cornbread. We were nervous it would be too much, but the portion was perfect for 2 to sample a bit of everything. At first I was turned off because everything came out at room temperature, and if you know me you know I like my food hot! We were later informed by Conor the manager that all BBQ is served at room temp, they do a lot of competitions and that's how it's served. I was shocked by this and quickly realized that there was then nothing wrong with my meal; all the meats were juicy, cooked well, and full of flavor. The house slaw is delish, and I love the brine on the pickels. The cornbread wasn't anything special, I was working on the meat, I didn't have room for it anyway! My fav was the pulled pork, I loved it! My sister and her bf both got full orders of pulled chicken and beef brisket, you can order by the pound; watch out tho it's gets pricey! I had some of the pulled chicken and it was excellent, it was juicy and packed with flavor! 

Conor, the manager came over and greeted us halfway through our meal to check on us and make sure we were enjoying our experience, he offered us complimentary shots, which we gladly accepted. It was cinnamon moonshine, which came it the cutest little jars, it was delish! BBQ was great, the service was good, and the ambiance it super chill. I highly recommend this spot and hope to check out the Astoria location soon!
review.author: Felicia M.

review.description:
Great service and good food but $$$. I came here for a light meal before going out. Ordered the pork belly appetizer and pickles as a side. 

The appetizer is really APPETIZER size. small portions. Just a little plate of cubed pork belly BUT cooked perfectly and just crispy enough on the skin. 

The pickles side was so disappointing. It's a bowl of sandwich sliced pickles. Not the long cut usually on the side of dishes. And it's a HEAPING of them. So beware when you spend $6 on a bowl of thinly Sliced pickles lol it better be for like 20 people. 

The service was also top notch. Very kind and attentive. 

 But overall good cool spot with indie rock music blasting and cool cowboy western BBQ ambiance. Would come again but it is pricey!
review.author: Eleni K.

review.description: Hmmm all these 4-5 star reviews have this girl who grew up in Texas wondering why. I tried this place last week and honestly, it wasn't bad. The sauce was pretty standard, the beans were solid (at least in flavor, pretty soupy otherwise), and the chicken was good. Nothing about it stood out as better than average BBQ. It makes me think people up here are far too easily pleased. If I was closer to Astoria, I'd be willing to try the original location, but I'm by Redhook and there are whisperings (and a Yelp search to back it up) of the best BBQ in this city in my neck of the woods.
review.author: Melissa M.

review.description: This place is delicious. My friends and I came on a Tuesday night to try this place out. we ordered the pork belly appetizer, smoked bbq platter with burnt ends (extra $), and monster 50/50 sandwich. Service was quick and the food was amazing. They gave portions to our party of 3 and did not skimp out on anything. my favorite was the smoked BBQ platter. we were able to try basically everything we wanted to order. The ribs came right off the bone and the burnt ends (meat candy) was juicy. I definitely want to come back to try the other items on the menu
review.author: Ruby L.

review.description:
I absolutely love this place! Their drinks are out of this world amazing. We had the 
The Butcher's Punch: I think this is my favorite drinks so far on the money. 
 Georgia Creamsicle: this is made with moonshine so if you're a bit nervous to try first time I would say to start with this drink
Bees & Honey: This is the first time I've enjoyed a cocktail made with mezcal. It literally balances the mezcal perfectly and they use raw honey which is soooo good.
For starters we shared the wings and the chili cheese nachos. The wings were fried to perfection and the sauce that they used was really good. I loved the flavor of the chili with the nachos. We literally inhaled our food! 
For the main course, I had burnt ends aka meat candy and a side of mac n cheese. The only regret I had was ordering the quarter pound instead of half or even 1 lb because it was THAT GOOD. Also, last but not least THE CREW. The staff there are so chill; they literally embody what LES use to be. By the end of the night, we were chatting it up with the bartenders and hostess. They're not pretentious or overbearing which is a plus.
No doubt, I'll be back for the meat candy and I definitely want to try the other items on the menu. P.S....this is the place to try moonshine (go for the blueberry flavor and thank me later.)
review.author: Natasha P.

review.description: The food was delicious and the hospitality was good..I will back with my coworkers..loved the smokey BBQ flavor as well as the sweet and spicy sauce
review.author: Sharon B.

review.description: Absolutely amazing! The vibe from this place was extraordinary and gave a very good LES feel. The food was phenomenal. Burnt ends or "Meat Candy" was some of the best we've ever had. Mac n Cheese Starter with chili was delicious and big enough for two. The Buttermilk Pan Fried chicken sandwich was outstanding. Conor, the GM, gave great drink recommendations that were out of this world. Me and the fiancé came here for our two year anniversary and Matt the owner was super generous. We can't thank him enough. Alex, our server was awesome. Always near by and provided great recommendations. We will be bAck.
review.author: Derrick M.

review.description:
So guys and gals, this Butcher Bar just opened up in LES about a month or so ago. To my knowledge, it might be the only BBQ spot in the area, and they have prime real estate in LES with all of the traffic in the area.

I suggest that you get the Bees and Honey, which is a mezcal and honey cocktail that's absolutely one of the best drinks ever....they also had moonshine, which was pretty good and had some kick to it.

For starters, we kept it standard with chicken wings and nachos. Really good. For main course, I opted for the pulled chicken sandwich, which was pretty good and came with fries. My friends and I split a mac and cheese. This was pretty much the only downside of what we had since the M&C wasn't baked with cheese. It was pretty much noodles and cheese sauce.

The staff was also friendly. They had these cool t-shirts inspired by The Infamous Mobb Deep, a nice touch.

Overall, i'd recommend this place. Check it out!
review.author: Karsten V.

review.description:
I'm beyond grateful that Butcher Bar opened up a location in the LES, because it's absolutely fantastic.

The food absolutely lives up to the hype. The Meat Candy was melt in your mouth tender and came out within minutes of ordering (pro tip: eat it simultaneously with the pickles they put on the side, it's a game changer). As for entrees, even though the menu is considerably smaller than their Astoria location, there are still some prime choices. I got the BBQ chicken sandwich with a side salad and my boyfriend got the Monster 50/50, which is a half prime rib, half brisket burger. Both were phenomenal and, again, came out in a decent amount of time. The drink menu is also pretty good, and the waitstaff actually knows their stuff when you ask them for a recommendation.

The only downside is that there's one waitress for the whole establishment, which backed up our check as we were trying to leave. Once they nail down their computer software, though, I'll be back for more.
review.author: Emily C.

review.description:
After waiting for over a year to try the Butcher Bar in queens , one popped up at this more convenient location.   After much deliberation we went with the Fried chicken sandwich and the smoked BBQ burger and the smoked and fried wings as an appetizer . 

The wings were perfect and some of the best I ever had with the sweet and spicy sauce we opted for . 
The smoked BBQ burger was a tad bit salty, likely from the brisket addition . It had a good taste to it despite the saltiness.
The chicken sandwich was less than memorable . The breading and marinade wasn't as pronounced as I would have liked . It was just bland and had very little flavor for a fried chicken sandwich . Not even a request of a coleslaw topping could save it honestly . 

This place has a lot of offerings and a large drink menu so I'll try more options and update along the way .
review.author: Kern C.

review.description:
A friend and I were roaming the streets of the LES when we passed this place. It was a slow Saturday night and the hostess was outside inviting people to come in and check out this new establishment. She told us about the special - a Miller High Life and a shot of Moonshine for $3 - and we were sold! 

It was a nice set up and it was a good number of people there, but not too crowded and rowdy. So the atmosphere was very pleasant. We didn't get food (although we did try some of the bacon-I don't even think that's on the menu), we only had the drinks. I'll def be back to try it though, especially the burnt ends. Those look amazing! 

Oh, and we met one of the owners and his wife. They were so nice and cool! We even went back the very next day to get the special again. I promise to go back and try the food the next time.
review.author: Kendal F.

review.description:
A bunch of my buddies went to the one in Astoria and said hands down the best BBQ they ever had. 
And when I heard the city one was opening I just had to try it. 
The staff there is very nice and accommodating. Unlike other places around the area. We started off with the fried pickles which where to die for. That had a great sauce to dip. 
Next was the burnt ends or meat candy as the waitress told me. WOW!!! They just melt in you're mouth there amazing. It does taste like candy. 
We had the shrimp with grits as a main meal was also was full of taste. For a person that doesn't like grits you sure have to try it. 
Can't wait to come back here for more meat candy!!
review.author: Igor K.

review.description:
I would like to give it a total score 3.5/5. It has many seats and is a good place for groups. The service is very good. It got quite noisy as more and more people came in.

Meat candy (burnt ends): my favorite among all the dishes we ordered. The meat was tender and flavorful. Since the size in the starter was small, I guess it would be better to add it to the smoked BBQ platter (+$5). 4.5/5

Fried pickles & jalapenos: the flavors of pickles and jalapenos were covered by bread crumbs, but the spicy sauce for this dish was a big plus. 3.5/5

Smoked BBQ platter: It includes pulled pork, brisket, ribs, slaw, pickled cucumber, and cornbread w/ honey-butter. I wish they added more sauce on the pulled pork, which was good. The brisket was on the dry side. The ribs in this platter were similar to Fall off the Bone Ribs. I expected more 'smoked' flavor. 3/5

Fall off the Bone Ribs: the meat was tender. 3.5/5
review.author: Qinxue Y.

review.description: Wow. Get there early for.the Meat Candy. Finally a BBQ place that doesn''t make the sauce the star. Friendly and accomodating staff, good bar, nice atmosphere and reasonable prices. Try it soon before it becomes too popular
review.author: Tom S.
